sketch_text:
[{'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Well Hugh, here's the book.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Absolutely.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Well put. (Slight pause) So, any advice for someone who's just picked this book up, say, in one of the many fresh, clean High Street bookshops that stock this important new work and is considering, if not making a purchase, then at least slipping it down his or her trouser or trousers?
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Well Stephen, I'd like firstly to congratulate the potential thief on his or her good taste or tastes, but I'd like to follow up that congratulation quite smartly with a caveat or warning. 
    "}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "Hugh breaks off and looks over Stephen's shoulder or shoulders. There is a longish pause."}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Yes. I'm busy wondering what the nature of that caveat or warning might be, Hugh.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      (Jerking back) I'm sorry, I thought I saw something dark, vivid and unpleasant.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      It must have been your imagination.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Probably. No, the caveat, rejoinder, admonishment or warning I would make to the potential thief of this book is this. No matter who you are, no matter what your name is, no matter how far away you run, no matter how you try to disguise yourself with towels and the cunning application of coloured yoghurts, no matter what lengths you go to, no matter how well you protect yourself, we will seek you out and destroy you.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Eventually.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      We will destroy you eventually. And when we do ...
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Well ...
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Exactly.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      So. Just remember. You can run, but you can't hop.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      We'll be there. Across the street. In dark glasses.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Arms folded.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Watching.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      In silent reproach.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      So just you trot over to the desk and pay the nice lady cash money for this book.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Apart from anything else, you'll find that if you don't none of the jokes will be at all funny.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      That's right. Every sketch will have a punchline limper than ...
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Limper than ...
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Limper than a very limp thing that's especially limp today.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Exactly. But hey! That's the heavy part over with. Let's tell the average honest and surprisingly pretty punter a little bit about the genesis of this book, shall we Hugh?
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      This book doesn't have a genesis, Stephen. You're thinking of the bible.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Ha, what a very nearly laughable misunderstanding, Hugh. I meant "genesis" in the sense of "beginning or inception".
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      (Wiping his eyes with laughter) Oh! I see! And I thought ...
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      (Falling about) Dear oh dear.
    '}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'They pick themselves up off the floor at length.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      No, this book came about as a result, didn't it Hugh, of enormous commercial pressure to make the written texts of A Bit of Fry And Laurie available to the public at large.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      When you say "enormous commercial pressure" you mean ... ?
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      I mean some drunken overpaid publishing executive thought it might be a good way of staving off their eventual dismissal.
      Hugh
      Right.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      We wrote these sketches over a period of ... what, Hugh?
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Over a period of time, if I remember rightly.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Over a period of months between June and December 1987.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      When the world was young and everything seemed slightly frilly.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Why did we write these sketches, you may ask?
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Well, let me turn that question round and say "Why did we sketch these writes, you may ask?"
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Let me turn that question round and say "Why did we write these sketches, you ask may?"
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Because they were there.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      No, Hugh, because they weren't there. That's the whole point. Amazingly, no-one had written those sketches before.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      The Pythons had written something pretty similar though hadn't they? Stephen looks uncomfortable.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      (Through clenched teeth) Shut up, Hugh.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Sorry.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      No, as we say these sketches are the original children of our minds.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      They're our babies.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      In a sense, yes. In a wholly unacceptable sense.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Yes, because that's not to imply that we literally went to bed together, introduced various fleshy nozzles into each other's warm places and then gave birth to a pile of paper covered in amusing sketch material, is it Stephen?
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Hugh.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Yes?
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Shut your bleeding neck for a moment will you?
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Right-o.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      These sketches are for your perusalment and enjoyage to do with what you will.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Within certain rather exciting legal parameters.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      That's right. We ought to mention that you can't actually perform these sketches in public to a fee- paying audience.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Though why anyone should want to perform these sketches in public beats me with a wet napkin.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Oh I don't know Hugh.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Don't you?
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      No.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Oh.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Imagine your plane has been hijacked by a gang of terrorists and their leader, a rather desperate character called Miguel, threatens to shoot all the passengers unless someone can perform the "Haircut" sketch in the Club Class lavatory.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Of course you're right. How silly of me.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Well in those circumstances it would be quite illegal for you to accede to his wishes.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Quite right. We do not deal with terrorists.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      All we can suggest is that you volunteer to write a sketch very similar to "Haircut", and that you'll promise to have it finished and in rehearsal by the time you reach Libyan air space.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Yes. Just remember that Miguel's bark is much worse than his bite.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      And he cannot bear split infinitives.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      So that's got that out of the way. Anything else that the discerning consumer need know in order to extract maximum reading pleasure from these pages, Stephen?
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Oh just the basics. Consult your GP, wipe down all surfaces with a damp dry cloth, and do not go to sleep with your head on a railway line.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Sound advice. Although Stephen, isn't there one vital step you should take before consulting your GP?
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
      Absolutely, Hugh. Before consulting your GP, please please please consult your GP.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      For those of you reading in black and white, Stephen put a lot of emphasis on that third "please".
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Yes. Although I hope I didn't completely neglect the first two.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
      Of course not.
    '}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Once you've taken those basic, common sense measures, it's just a question of relaxing, kicking off your shoes, slipping into a loose-fitting kimono and going over to the cash desk to buy this book.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      Although if you've read this far without buying it, we can only assume that it's raining pretty heavily outside.
    "}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
      Looks as if it's brightening a bit over there ...
    "}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
      D'you know, you may be right ...
    "}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh comes into the office. Stephen is sitting behind a
			desk.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Hello, Control.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
			Oh. Hello there, Murchison. How are you today?
		'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Very well indeed as a matter of fact, Control.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			That's good.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Yes.
		'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Faintly uncomfortable pause.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
			So. Anyway. What can I do you for?!
		'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Well. This just came through flash from Berlin, sir. I thought perhaps you might like to take a look at it.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			Flash from Berlin, eh? Well I better had. We've got quite a few valuable agents in Berlin, haven't we? It might be something quite urgent, I expect.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Yes.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			(Reading) I see Valerie has decoded it for me. That's kind of her. Saves me quite a bit of extra work. I must remember to thank her.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			That would certainly be a nice gesture, sir.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			Well, much as I expected. I don't know if you had an opportunity to look through it, Tony, before thoughtfully bringing it into me, but it is quite an urgent message from Firefly, our network head in Berlin.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Yes, I had time just to glance at the codename as I came in. Firefly is under deep cover. Has something quite important happened to make him break it like this?
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
			Well that was the first thought that crossed my mind, Tony, certainly. It looks as if his network has been penetrated by an enemy agent.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Oh no.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			Yes, I'm afraid so. All his men have been arrested. Glow-worm was shot attempting to cross over into the west and Firefly himself is hiding up somewhere at a safehouse in the east.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			So the whole network has been blown?
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			That's right. It's a thundering nuisance.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			It certainly is. Thundering.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			I'm severely vexed, I don't mind telling you.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			I expect a coffee would come in welcome then.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			Well it certainly couldn't hurt, could it?
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
			No. Not just one. I'll get Valerie onto it.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
			Thank you so much, Tony.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
			You're very welcome. Makes to go. Turns from the door. Let's hope it's not going to turn out to be one of those days, eh, Control? Like Thursday.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
			Oh! That's all we need! I don't know! See you later then, Tony.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
			Alright.
		'}]

[{'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ladies and gentlemen, we were going to do a
		sketch for you ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But we're not now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, we're not going to do it for you, now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Or ever.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Or probably ever. Unless this country radically
		changes direction.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Looks unlikely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Which does indeed look unlikely. The reason
		we're not going to do this sketch is that it contains
		a great deal of sex and violence.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A great deal.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Lots of sex and violence.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. During the sketch, Stephen hits me
		several times with a golf club.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Which of course wouldn't matter except that I hit
		Hugh very sexily.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's the trouble, you see. He does it so
		sexily. I wish you could see it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And then the sketch ends with us going to bed
		together ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... violently.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Extremely violently. Now this raises problems.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not for me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Me neither, but Sir William Rees-Mogg didn't like
		it a bit, did he?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well there was one bit he liked.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, that's true. He did like it one bit. But he
		didn't like a lot of other bits.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But I don't want you to think that Sir William's
		remit with the Broadcasting Standards Council
		is so sweeping as to be a kind of government
		thought police.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. The concern is primarily for standards.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Standards.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	For the sake of our children.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So, in a generous spirit of give and take, Sir
		William has taken our sketch.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And we've given it to him.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And he has written one for us to do instead.
		Which is free of any gratuitous sex and violence.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And shows due and proper regard for decency and
		standards.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Promoting family life and protecting our children.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sir William has called his sketch simply
		"Bitchmother, Come Light My Bottom".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And we're going to do it for you now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	"Bitchmother, Come Light My Bottom", by Sir
		William Rees-Mogg.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': " Oh yes, my wife wears the trousers. No question. But we're hoping to get a second pair some time next year.
	"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is dressed as, and therefore in dramatic terms 
  is, a barber. Hugh enters the shop.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Good morning sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  Yes sir, I do believe we're in for a spell as they
    used to say in the music halls. Not too hot, but
    not too mild neither..
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Mmm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Re the weekend just past, might I enquire as to
    whether sir was in receipt of an enjoyableness, or
    did events prove themselves to be of an otherwise
    nature?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Very pleasant thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  Thank you sir. Very pleasant. Good. Then in
    presumption of sir's answer, I may take it that
    sir was for that period without the boundaries of
    Lincolnshire, wherein, I understand, it rained like
    a bitch.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  No, I was nowhere near Lincolnshire.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir, I am uplifted to hear such news.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  My wife and I spent the weekend in Hull.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir is married?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  I had literally no idea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Well never mind ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Will sir at some future time, as yet unspecified,
    forgive me for not having immediately
    congratulated him on his joyousness in the good
    tidings department?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Of course. I didn't expect you ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Would sir perhaps consider it to be beyond-
    boundingly forward of me, on behalf of all the
    staff here, to send a bouquet of flower-style
    objects to Mrs Sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Well that's really not necessary.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir, since I began as a barber, not thirty-nine
    years ago, the phrase "not necessary" has been
    neither more nor less than as a spur to quicken my
    actions.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Well thank you, that's very kind of you ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Alright sir. To business. Being one of the
    shrewdest sirs it has been my privilege to meet,
    you are no doubt keen to exploit the social and
    financial advantages inherent in having a hair cut?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  A haircut, that's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Of course. A hair cut is a hair enhanced if sir will
    fail to slash my throatlet for being so old. Now the
    hair in question is ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  The hair presently under advisement belongs
    to ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  What do you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  What do I mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Haha. I sneak myself towards the suspicion that
    sir has me cast as the mouse in his ever popular
    cat drama.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  What are you talking about? It's my hair. I want
    you to cut my hair.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  Ah. So sir's own hair is the hair upon which this
    entire transaction is to be founded?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Well of course. Why would I come in here to get
    someone else's hair cut.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir. Please set fire to my legs if I am trying to
    make haircutting seem more glamorous that it
    really is, but may I just say this - you cannot be
    too careful in my position.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  Indeed sir. Once and only once, I cut a
    gentleman's hair against his will. Believe me when
    I say it was both difficult and impossible.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  No, well it's my hair I want cut.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Your hair.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  The hair of sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Excellent. Then let us proceed to the next and
    most important of stages. Which one?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Which one what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  Which of sir's manifold hairs would he care to
    place in my professional care for the purposes of
    securing an encutment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Well all of them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  All of sir's hairs?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir is absolutely sure?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Of course I'm sure. What's the matter with you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  I seek not to question the drasticity of sir's
    decision, only to express the profoundness
    of my humblings at the prospect of such a
    magnificent task.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Well, all of them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  All of them. My word.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Is that a problem.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  By no means. I merely hope that sir can find
    a moment in his otherwise hectic schedule to
    appreciate that for me to cut every one of sir's
    hairs represents the snow-capped summit of a
    barber's career.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Well you've done it before, haven't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  Indeed, sir. I once cut all the hairs on a
    gentleman's head in Cairo, shortly after the War,
    when the world was in uproar and to a young man
    everything seemed possible.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Once?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  It would be pointless for me to deny that I was
    fitter and better-looking then, but let us hope
    for sir's sake, that the magic has not entirely
    disappeared up its own rabbit hole. We shall see.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Wait a minute. Wait just one cotton-picking
    minute here.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  You've cut someone's hair, all of it that is, once
    since the war?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Would sir have preffered that in the sphere of total
    hair cuttation, I was to him a virgin?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  That I can respect.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  The desire that we should both of us embark
    upon this voyage as innocents, wide-eyed travellers
    in a foreign land, unknowning of our destination,
    careless of our fate - to emerge somewhere, some
    day, bruised, tender, a little sad perhaps, but
    ultimately and joyously alive.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Goodbye.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir is leaving?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yup.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Might I be favoured with an explanation as
    to why?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Because I don't believe you have the faintest idea
    as to how you're going to end this sketch, and I
    simply don't want to be around when you try. It's
    going to be painful and embarrassing for both of
    us, and to be honest I'd much rather it was only
    painful and embarrassing for you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  But sir!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Sir could not be more mistaken if he tried. I know
    precisely how this sketch is going to end.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Go on then.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  It might take time.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yes, time and pain and embarrassment. Goodbye.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  You bastard.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Here we go.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  The number of times I've hung around while
    you've stumbled on to some pathetic ending.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  You see? You're completely stuck.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
  No I'm not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Forty-five seconds. I can end this sketch in forty-
    five seconds.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Yeah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  OK. Forty-five seconds.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  If sir will resume the seatedness of his posture.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Alright.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  Can I assume that sir is close to the level of
    maximum comfort?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
  Forty seconds.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
  I will now fetch the necessary tools.
    Stephen exits.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
  Haha. It's going to be a chainsaw or some
    bloody ... tscch.

    Hugh looks at his watch. Stephen does not re-enter. 

    Long pause. Hugh realises he has been left holding 
  the baby.

    Fuck.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh and Stephen are sitting in a TV studio. There is 
	a table lamp. Hugh has an annoying accent.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now, Mr Nude, you claim ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right, I do claim, I do ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, you claim to be able to bend spoons with
		psychic energy ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Psychic energy, yes, that is the method I have
		chosen, to bend spoons, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How long have you had this ability?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	How long, precisely, that's absolutely right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Indeed, you are very sympathetic, thank you. It's
		very difficult when people are not sympathetic, but
		you are very sympathetic.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Can you do other things with spoons, apart from
		bend them?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes of course I can. I can do anything with
		a spoon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Can you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Indeed I can. Give me a spoon, and I will give you
		the world.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well that's a very impressive claim, certainly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's alright. Well Mr Nude, we have some
		spoons here. Perhaps you'd care to give us a
		demonstration?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I am not a circus freak, you know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I realise that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Some people think I am a freak. I am not a freak.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I'm sure that nobody here ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	"Freak!" They sometimes shout at me in the street.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Do they really? That's awful.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But you are very sympathetic.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would you care to have a go at bending this
		spoon for us?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you, yes I will bend this spoon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ladies and gentlemen, Mr Nude is now going to
		bend this spoon using psychic energy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right, now is when I'm going to bend it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Go ahead, Mr Nude.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh quite plainly bends the spoon with his hands.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you very much, you are all very
		sympathetic.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well the spoon is certainly bent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course it is bent. Of course it is. I bent the
		spoon, so, of course it is bent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, that much is clear and without argument.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Forgive me, I am very tired now. To bend a
		spoon is very tiring, and I have bent too many
		spoons today.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How many spoons have you bent today?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Four spoons today. It is too much. I am not a
		freak, you know. I am a human being.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Forgive me, Mr Nude ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But from where I was sitting, it looked rather as if
		you just bent the spoon with your hands.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What are you saying?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm saying that ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What is this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a bent spoon.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh quite, the question is how did you bend it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't know how much I like you now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, I'm sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Before I thought you were very sympathetic ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I hope that ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But now, I think you are not so sympathetic. Now,
		I don't like you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm sorry to hear that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	At all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Are you sure it isn't "fraud" that people shout at
		you in the street, rather than freak?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It is you who make the claims. I have always been
		honest. I bend the spoons with psychic energy, I
		have told you. I never claimed to be able to bend
		them with my hands. That is your claim.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And you did bend it with your hands.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The spoon is bent, that is enough. Perhaps it does
		flow through my hands this psychic energy of
		which you claim. It may be. Certainly the spoon is
		bent. Therefore I bent it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I can bend a spoon with my hands too.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I have never said that my powers are unique.
		Always have I striven to teach the world that
		anyone may bend a spoon. My book is not
		expensive.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Stephen bends a spoon.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	There.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	To think I found you sympathetic. I hate you now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well next week I shall be examining the claims of
		a man who says that in a previous existence he was
		Education Secretary Kenneth Baker and I shall
		be talking to a woman who claims she can make
		flowers grow just by planting seeds in soil and
		watering them. Until then, wait very quietly in your
		seats please. Goodnight.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Simultaneously) If viewers living in the Matlock
		and Buxton areas of Derbyshire would be so kind
		as to inspect their cutlery drawers at home they
		will find that they contain a bent spoon and an
		unused Weetabix special offer coupon. I can also
		reveal that everyone in the town of Datchett over
		the age of fourteen has a slight itch just above the
		right thigh which they are scratching as I speak.
		Thank you.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen and Hugh are sitting in swivel chairs, with 
	haircuts. They look and sound nearly as revoltingly 
	smug, smarmy and unpleasant as real critics.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Simon Clituris, you watched that sketch ... I
		assume you were disappointed?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well frankly, I thought it was predictable.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You predicted it, did you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Absolutely, and I think that's why it was
		predictable. Their choice of targets was
		predictable ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Estate agents ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Where?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The target of that last sketch was estate agents.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I didn't notice that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And of course their choice of language was
		predictable ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Precisely. English was a sadly predictable language
		for them to have chosen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Which is a shame.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A great shame. If you don't speak it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A bigger shame if you do.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hahaha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hahahaha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But I suppose one could have predicted it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I suppose so. Can you predict what their next
		sketch will be?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh lord, yes. A parody of "Treasure Island".
		Bound to be.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Cut to something that is as far from being a parody of 
	Treasure Island as is emotionally possible.'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
		I can remember exactly what I was doing when I heard the news. I was listening to the news.
	'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen and Hugh are being dramatic businessmen.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Calm down John, we're not going to get
		anywhere ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't tell me to calm down. Dammit Peter, I want
		answers, and I want them fast.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Answers? A bit late for all that, don't you think?
		(Drinks)
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What the hell's happened to you Peter? You know
		as well as I do, there's no such word as "a bit late
		for all that".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Agreed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So shoot. What've we got?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Marjorie wants control of Derwent Enterprises,
		and from where I'm sitting, she's going to get it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Marjorie? Jesus, Peter, Marjorie's just a kid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Tell that to the board.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Watch me. I might just do that. (Drinks)
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good luck to you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Meaning?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They'll laugh in your face, John. Like they did me.
		Marjorie's got them eating out of her hand.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alright. Then I'll go to old man Derwent himself.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Come off it John. No one's even spoken to old
		man Derwent in years. The man's a recluse. It's
		hopeless I tell you. Marjorie's won. And she hasn't
		even fired a shot. (Drinks)
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Listen to me, Peter. Marjorie may have won the
		war, but she hasn't won the battle.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit John, you're up to something. I've seen
		that look before.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're damn right I'm up to something.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Dammit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What are you up to?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Something. I'm up to something.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I thought so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I want you on my team for this, Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit John, I'm yours, you know that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I haven't finished. It's absolutely mandatory that
		you buy into my way of working. Things could get
		a little hairy in the next forty-eight. (Drinks)
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You know me, John. Hairy is as hairy does.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good to hear. Call O'Neill for me, will you? Get
		him to postpone the meeting.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What shall I tell him? (Drinks)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Shouting) Tell him any damn thing you like - just
		buy me some time!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit John, it's good to have you back.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You'd better save the pretty speeches for later,
		Peter, we've a long night ahead of us. (Drinks)
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just like old times, eh, John?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sure, Peter, sure.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Dialling) You know it's funny. I drove through
		High Wycombe just the other day ... (into phone)
		Hello? Peter here. Get me O'Neill.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And fast.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And fast. (pause) Say again? Dammit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	O'Neill's out of town and can't be reached.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Dammit to hell and back.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Damn blast and double damn.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Damn.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Want me to try Amsterdam?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Come on Peter, you're not thinking straight.
		Amsterdam's too obvious. Marjorie was never
		obvious. That's why I loved her.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Drinks) By God here's a turn-up. I never thought
		I'd hear an old warhorse like you talk about love.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Love's nothing to be afraid of, Peter. You don't
		need a Harvard MBA to know that the bedroom
		and the boardroom are just two sides of the same
		ballgame. I wonder -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Try me. Shoot.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Put it together. A block of part-paid ordinaries
		funnelled through Geneva. A carefully staged
		release of IDL preference stock through the back
		door underpinned by a notional rights issue.
		Who'll be wincing then? (Drinks)
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit John, it's starting to add up. Want me to
		try Sydney?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Come on Peter, stay awake. He'll be in Australia
		by now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Dammit sideways. Wait a minute. Will they trace it
		back to us?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A ploy like that? It'll have Seagrove's handwriting
		all over it, Peter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And back again. But that still leaves us with
		Marjorie.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Dammit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Whispered mysteriously) What's she after?
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No point in asking that, Peter. I gave up trying to
		understand Marjorie a long time ago.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah. Women.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Marjorie isn't women, Peter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, of course not, John. Forgive me. I meant no
		offence.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Something I've always wondered. How did you
		keep Nancy so long?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've never been Nancy, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, your wife.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh Nancy. You know. Rough with the smooth. You
		work at it. Do your best. Never enough time. Keep
		on grafting, long hours, you think you know but
		of course you don't, cover all the angles, they talk
		about stress, I tell them I'm married to it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Am I right in thinking that you have a daughter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yup. Henrietta.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Did he? Did he really? That must have hurt. Hurt
		like hell on a jetski.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You never had kids of your own, I believe?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're wrong, Peter. You're so wrong.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. I beg your pardon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We're sitting in my children at this moment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I may have misheard that, John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The company, Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I gave everything to this company. (Suddenly
		shouting) Dammit New York should have rung
		by now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Relax, John. It's still early.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I know, Peter. But It's not going to stay early
		for long.
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen goes to the window.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	New York'll come through, John. I know they will.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Looking out of the window) I hope so. There are six
		million people out there, Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really? What do they want?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who knows? Peter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I say we go with it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Agreed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	If New York rings, we give them affirmative.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'll tell Susan.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now let's get the hell out of here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sure?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yeah. I don't think even we two can sustain this
		level of high intensity work without coming down
		for a space.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit you're right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Besides, I could use a drink.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Stephen (Gordon) and Hugh (Stuart) are sitting at 
	a table in a Greek restaurant. Music plays in the 
	background.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah, I like to eat Greek at least once in a time,
		Gordon. It's a plain cuisine, simply prepared.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yeah, well I'm not averse myself, Stuart.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Substantially partial to a plate of Greek, as it
		happens. Substantially partial.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Good. (Indicating menu) We won't worry about this.
		I'll chat to the top over-waiter personally. This is
		just for the walk-in punters.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right you be.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Listen to that bazooka music, Gordon. East meets
		West.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Love it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There's a lot to be learned from the Greeks, you
		know. After all, they gave us the word "civilization".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I thought that was the Romans.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ethnically the same peoples, Gordon. Also the
		word "economics". Sharp folk, your Greeks,
		Very sharp.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And the word "genoymeen".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	They gave us that as well. I suppose we must have
		just given it back, almost immediately.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Tough folk, your Hellenics. Hard as the crags and
		boulders that shape the islands and hills of their
		landscape.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Tssch. Do you know I wouldn't be surprised if
		there was a lesson in there somewhere?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Certainly there is. I've often thought of putting out
		a paper on the correlation between landscape and
		business acumen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Great subject, Stu. You could set fire to some
		arses with a paper like that. The Institute of
		Executive Salesmen would go ape crazy on all
		fours for a theory of that sort.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I think so, Gordon, I think so. Take my own
		case. Myself, way back when, my folks hailed
		from Yorkshire. You see? Limestone uplands,
		unforgiving moors and scarred dales. An
		uncompromising, beautiful, hard and wide nurse
		of men.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But you were born in Surrey.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The limestone's in my blood. You can see it in
		the way I do business. Where you from first off,
		Gordon?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Lincolnshire.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Huh. You see? Flat, sodden, yielding, chalky,
		cautious, indecisive, always late for meetings ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well Lincolnshire's flat, Stu, yes. But I wouldn't
		say it was always late for meetings ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Ignoring him) Yeah, maybe I'll put that paper out
		after all. Maybe I'll do that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Service is a bit slow.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You see, that's the typical lowlander's reaction.
		That's got Lincolnshire written all over it. You've
		got to understand that the Greek does things at
		his own tempo, Gordon. Natural rhythms and
		cycles, deep within them. The Yorkshireman in me
		respects that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well we don't want to be late for the basketball
		game, Stuart.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Shouting) Service here! Let's get some action at
		this table!
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Waiter arrives. A cheery Greek figure.'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Good afternoon, my lovely friends.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	OK, kalli spera.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Ah. Is lunchtime. You mean kalli mera.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well yes, in some dialects, obviously. Now ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	To piato tees meras chtopothi.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good, good. So ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The dish of the day is octopus.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know that, Gordon. Well aware. Where was the
		octopus caught?
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Where was it caught? What a question. In the sea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. It should be OK then Gordon, if you want
		to have that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	So ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well thelo parakalo dolmades kai filetto souvlaki kai
		nero pagomeno kai ena boulaki retsina.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Entaxi. Kai ya sas, kyrie?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What would you like, Stuart?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The same. Definitely. The er ... parakalo.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Auo.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Certainly, gentlemen.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Waiter exits.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And we'd better order up some wine while
		we're at it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I did that, Stuart.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, of course you did, yeah. I was miles away.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	He's a bit forward isn't he? All that "lovely
		friends" stuff.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well what he's done, Gordon, is recognise a
		kindred spirit. He's spotted the craggy moorlander
		in me and he knows that he and I have been
		nourished by essentially the same granite. Ergo,
		we're clients to be treated with respect, not your
		usual walk-in, quick turnover merchants.
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Waiter enters, with plates.'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Dolmades for my two beautiful English gentlemen,
		I think.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Great.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Looks good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Is very good, my special friends.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Waiter exits.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Tucking in) Ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What is this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well it's dolmades.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Dolmades?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Stuffed vine leaves.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Stuffed vine leaves? Is he trying to take us
		for a ride?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a classic Greek dish.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Classic Greek ... What am I, a peasant or a busy
		executive?
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Waiter enters.'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Everything alright, my absolute darlings?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fine thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My colleague doesn't like dolmades.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	But you ask for dolmades.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	He didn't know what it was.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I knew what ... hahahaha. Everything's just fine,
		thank you.

		Waiter exits.

		Let's get out of here, Gordon. This is just a
		tourist trap.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In Stevenage?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Why not?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But this is good, Stuart.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wake up, Gordon, wake up! Jesus, they must have
		seen you coming a mile off.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't you want your dolmades?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Do I want to push a stuffed vine leaf through my
		face? No, incredibly, I don't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I'm starving, so if it's all the same with
		you ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(He drinks some wine) Oh that's it. This wine is
		corked.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It can't be. It's got a metal top.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't get clever. Just taste it. (Banging table)
		Waiter!
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Delicious.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Delicious? It's got something in it.
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Waiter enters.'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Yes, my excellent friends?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(To Hugh) It's resinated.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Exactly. Waiter, this wine has resinated in
		the bottle.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Yes. Is retsina.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's supposed to be like that, Stu. They add pine
		needle resin to it ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yea, thanks very much for your input Gordon,
		but I hope I know my wines. I didn't fork out on
		an encyclopaedia of world wines for nothing.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Retsina. Is very good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's delicious, Stu.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Pause) Well I hope you're going to invite me to
		the wedding.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Give me a pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You two are getting married, presumably?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Stuart ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, obviously a six-year friendship goes out the
		window if you're going to start siding with some
		Greeko against me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	I think maybe everything is not so good for my
		two lovers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(To waiter) You can cut that out right now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Listen Stu ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No you listen, mush. While you were marking time
		with linguaphone courses of the ancient world, I
		was pounding the streets of Tiverton learning the
		selling trade.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Stu ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	While you tanned your hairy arse on the nude
		beaches of Crete or wherever it was, stuffing vine
		leaves with a bunch of perverts, I was getting my
		masters degree in the university of hard knocks
		and tough surprises. Well mister - I make no
		apology. To you or your fancy lover boy. (He makes 
		for the exit)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Stu! Where are you going?
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	I can bring you an omelette, if you like, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Forget it. I've had enough, Gordon. I'm going out
		for an honest British kebab.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
		What I always say to myself is,
			"what would Lester Piggott have
			done in this situation?"
	
	'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is in an SAS uniform, behind the desk of an 
	Army Careers office.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So you'd like to join the Special Air Service?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, yes alright.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's more like it. Height?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How tall are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. Nine foot six.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nine foot six. Good. Weight?
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Silence.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Weight?
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Silence.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm waiting.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good. You'd be surprised how many applicants
		are trapped into revealing how heavy they are. And
		you weigh?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Three tons.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Three tons. Sure about that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just over.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alright. Just over three tons. It's as well to be
		accurate in these matters. Saves complications later
		on. So. Any particular disabilities?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've got no sense of taste.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In what? Films? Music?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Food. I can't taste food.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh dear. That might be a problem.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Might that be a problem?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I've just said it might. Never mind, let's press on.
		Any special skills?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I look good in black.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Excellent. How old are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ten and a half.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Shoe size?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Twenty-eight.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Quirks?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Muddling up my height and my shoe size. I mean
		my shoe size and my height. See? I did it again.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well that seems to be OK. How are you at making
		small talk?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Weather and traffic?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That sort of thing.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I can hold my end up.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Correct. Now, are you aware of what the SAS is
		all about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. Well originally, the SAS was formed as an
		elite, crack, secret, crack secret assault force, to
		work behind enemy lines during the war.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Of course our role has changed somewhat since
		then. Nowadays our duties are to act primarily as
		a masturbatory aid for Lewis Collins and various
		back-bench MPs.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg you pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm afraid so. A worrying number of today's
		parliamentarians are quite unable to achieve sexual
		gratification without fantasizing about the SAS.
		So basically, we have to go round the place being
		secret and crack and elite, so that these people will
		be able to keep their marriages intact.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Doesn't sound very exciting. Have you got
		anything else on your cards?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, the BBC are advertising for someone to go
		into that room over there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Which one?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Pointing) That one, just over there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Alright. I'll give it a go.
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh enters room for next sketch.'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's very hard to undo it, though.
		So you have to be absolutely sure.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen and Hugh are sitting on stools.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So, Hugh, I believe you've found something of
		interest in one of your magazines.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right, Stephen. It's a brochure for the
		Collingwood Hospital.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's a private hospital, isn't it, Hugh.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right, Stephen. Important point.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And it's in London, England, if I remember serves
		me correctly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's precisely where it is, Stephen, yes. What
		excited me, however, as I was looking through this
		brochure was not where the hospital is, but the
		services it offers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Medical services, I presume.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They do limit themselves by and large to the
		provision of medical services, Stephen, yes, I dare
		say they're keen to consolidate in that area before
		moving out into other leisure activities.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That must be sound business practice, in
		anyone's book?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. But anyway, this brochure ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ha. I'd almost forgotten.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well that would have been a shame, Stephen,
		because this brochure contains a full list of the
		Collingwood Hospital services, and it includes a
		complete section on the kinds of operations you
		can have, if you're ever down that way.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would you care to read some of them out, Hugh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course, Stephen. Just glancing down the page,
		I find everything from appendectomy to bone
		marrow replacement, from organ transplants to
		heart surgery.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, no shortage of choice then, Hugh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. There's something there for
		everyone. It really is a mouthwatering selection.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	When are they open?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well this is one of the great things about
		the Collingwood. They're open twenty-four
		hours a day.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Weekends?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Weekends and Bank Holidays.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So the Collingwood Hospital might be a good
		place to take the family?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Absolutely, Stephen. There are plenty of
		operations that are specially tailored for children.
		For example, having their legs straightened.
		Mums everywhere I'm sure would love to go for
		one of their hip replacements, and for Dad ...
		well how about some of that heart surgery we
		mentioned earlier?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That sounds like a heck of a weekend. But Hugh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We haven't mentioned prices.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course. Prices vary, Stephen, according to the
		operation you choose ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'd imagine they would.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well they do. Basically they start at around four
		thousand pounds for a tonsilectomy ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... and can go up to as much as sixty thousand
		for an eight hour operation on the brain.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So, really, whatever your financial status, there's
		something at the Collingwood Hospital for you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. There is one proviso I'd add to that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You should have quite a lot of money.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good point. Whatever your financial status, as long
		as you've got a lot of money.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And if you haven't? Or if you want to save money?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, my advice would always be ... get yourself
		a stout pair of walking shoes and get out into the
		beautiful countryside.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thanks, Hugh. Plenty of choices there.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I killed her because she said she
		wanted to marry Noel Edmonds.
		Until then, she really had been a
		model daughter.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is a police sergeant, writing down the 
	particulars of an arrest at the station counter. Hugh is 
	on the other side, looking sheepish.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And the vehicle belongs to you, does it sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And your name is?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Hold on a second. (Hugh gets a lighter out of 
		his pocket) Ready?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My name is Derek ... (Hugh drops the lighter onto 
		the counter)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What are you doing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's my name.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This. Derek ... (Hugh drops the lighter again)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's your name?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What? Derek (Stephen drops the lighter) ... is
		your name?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What kind of name is that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's my name.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Unusual, isn't it, Mr ... (Drops lighter)?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If I had a pound for every time someone's said
		that ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And how do spell ... (Drops lighter), Mr ...
		(Drops lighter)?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's as it sounds.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Uhuh. Yeah but I wonder if you'd mind actually
		spelling it for me, would you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I mean, can't you just ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'd be very grateful. If you wouldn't mind.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	N-I-P-P-L hyphen E.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nipple.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nipple.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Nipple? Where? What are you talking about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	N-I-P-P-L-E ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hyphen E.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hyphen E ... spells Nipple. In my book. It does
		not spell ... (Drops lighter).
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Have you gone mad? What's the matter with you? I
		thought the modern policeman was supposed to be
		a highly trained law enforcement unit. You can't
		even spell.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alright, Mr Nipple, address? Hugh looks around. What's your address?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you talking to me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You want to know my address?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Or do you want to know Mr Nipple's address,
		whoever he is?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your address please, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Alright. My address is Number twenty-two ...
		(Hugh tapdances, slaps Stephen) ... Kings Lynn.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now watch it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Just watch it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Watch what, for heaven's sake?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You do realise, do you, that assaulting a police
		officer is an extremely serious offence?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, I imagine it probably is. Very serious. But
		telling a police officer your address, on the other
		hand, is probably not very serious, is it? Or is it?
		Perhaps the law's changed since I last looked.
		Perhaps the Home Secretary has had to take
		stern measures against the rising tide of people
		giving their address to policemen whenever they're
		asked to.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Alright. Alright. My fault. Ask a stupid person and
		you get a stupid answer.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, can I just check this with you, Mr ... (Drops 
		lighter) ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Just to make sure I've got this right. Your address
		is ... number twenty-two ... (Tapdances, punches 
		Hugh) ... Kings Lynn?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, no, no! What's the matter with you? Are
		you deaf? It's ... (Tapdances, slaps Stephen) ...
		Kings Lynn.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh I'm sorry. I though you said ... (Tapdances,
		punches Hugh) ... Kings Lynn.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I didn't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My apologies sir. I can't read my own writing.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well get a typewriter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	If only we could afford it. Actually, at some
		angles, this almost looks like ... twenty-two
		... (Tapdances, hits Hugh with a cricket bat) ...
		Kings Lynn.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That was too hard.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh I'm sorry sir. You're right. We really should
		get a typewriter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That was too hard.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well sir, you must admit that it's an unusual
		address for anyone to get the hang of ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Never mind the fucking sketch! That was too hard.
		That really hurt.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh diddums. Did the nasty actor hit the poor little
		twerp ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fuck off. Hugh exits.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(To camera) He's just a child really.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
		Until you've been there, you
		don't really have any idea
		what it's like - I shouldn't
		think. I'm not sure, I've never
		been there.
	"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "Stephen is sitting at his desk in the spies' office. Hugh 
	enters carrying a cup of coffee. He puts it down on 
	Stephen's desk."}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello, Murchison. Nice to see you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Whoops! You gave me rather a fright, Control.
		Sorry - I nearly upset your coffee there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No harm done, I can easily mop up that very small
		drop and it was very kind of you to bring me some
		at all. I'm most grateful.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It was no trouble, I was coming in anyway and I
		though "why not bring in a coffee for Control? It's
		eleven o'clock, I expect he'd welcome a cup."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Greatly appreciated.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I checked with Valerie and she said you like a little
		bit of milk, not too much, and no sugar. I hope
		that's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's exactly how I like my coffee, Murchison.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Anyway I ought to tell you why I came in.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mm, yes. Was there something you wanted to tell
		me? Or perhaps you wanted to ask me a question?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well a bit of a mixture of both really, Control. Do
		you remember we decided to put a tail on the new
		Cultural Attache at the Russian Embassy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, I do remember. I remember the very day we
		talked about it. We thought he might be a spy
		working for the KGB, and I said, "let's follow him
		around and see if he does anything that might look
		suspicious".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. We gave him the Codename Big
		Bad Wolf, and you decided that it would be good
		to put Philip and his F division in charge of the
		surveillance.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, Operation Coathanger if memory serves me
		correctly. You were sitting over there - it was quite
		a rainy day and Philip was standing by the desk,
		I think.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Though if you remember it was before you
		moved your desk round this way, so he would have
		been over there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh yes. I must say I do prefer it like this. I
		don't think I'll go back. I can see all the door and
		have quite a nice view over St Giles Circus.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. That must be nice. Anyway, it looks as if the
		Big Bad Wolf probably is a spy after all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh dear. Well we certainly feared as much. Just as
		well we took the trouble to find out. It shows how
		it's always worth checking things up, isn't it? Has
		he been meeting known KGB agents then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, he certainly has. As you can see.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh stands there. Stephen puts his hands out and 
	Hugh gives him a blue folder.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Looking at the folder) I must say I like this folder.
		Didn't the old ones used to be blue?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes. It was Valerie's idea to change to blue. She
		thought it would brighten the place up a bit.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very nice too. (Reading) "Big Bad Wolf has a
		Meeting with Colonel Andreyev in John Lewis's."
		Did Philip take this photograph himself, do
		you think?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Coming round to look) It certainly looks like Philip's
		handiwork.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You can't see which department they're in. I hope
		Big Bad Wolf isn't stealing any of our secrets or
		trying to persuade out agents to defect.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That would be galling, wouldn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I tell you what. You leave this one with me,
		Murchison.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you going to tell the Minister?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'll certainly have to do that, yes. Meanwhile Philip
		had better keep up his surveillance.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Would you like me to tell him? I'll be seeing him
		later today.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would you? That would certainly save me the
		trouble.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No problem at all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thanks.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're welcome. Anyway, I'd better get back to
		my office now. The Prague desk has been in a bit
		of a flap.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Uh-oh. Mustn't keep you then.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'll let you know if anything else crops up.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That would be appreciated. And thanks again for
		the coffee. It tasted very nice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really such a pleasure. See you then, Control.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bye bye, Murchison.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Hugh enters an electrical goods shop. Stephen is behind 
	the counter.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hello. I'd like to buy a toaster.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What sort of toaster are you looking for?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What sort of toaster are you looking for?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I see what you mean. Well, ideally I'd like one
		that's good at toasting bread ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... but can also be used as a weapon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A weapon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A weapon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh I see what you mean. Yes, a weapon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mmm. Call me an unrestrained arsewit if you
		like ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Perhaps later.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	As you wish. Why would you want to use a toaster
		as a weapon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Why would you want to use a toaster as a weapon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	These are uncertain times. We live in a shifting
		quicksand of international tension, forever dancing
		uncertain and fantastical steps on the brink of war.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Christ.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I think the optimum choice in the circumstances
		would be some kind of lightweight throwing
		toaster.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A lightweight throwing toaster?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Affirmative. Then I could use it as a weapon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Forgive me if I seem to be labouring the point,
		but wouldn't it be simpler to use a weapon as a
		weapon, and use for the toaster for toasting?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've already got a weapon.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well doesn't it work?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not as a toaster.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well let me assure you, all our toasters work as
		toasters.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But not as weapons?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	'Fraid not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Huh. Well that's not going to be much good when
		they come parachuting into Carshalton.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg you pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who is going to be parachuting into Carshalton?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	They are.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who is "they"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I dunno. I'm not interested in politics.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I didn't have this problem with my bed.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mmm. Your bed is a weapon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	In the right hands, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A lightweight throwing bed?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't be stupid. It's a seek out and destroy bed.
		Modified for counter-insurgency operations.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Aha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Perfect for the rough terrain surrounding the
		Carshalton area.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The bed shop was most helpful.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I dare say, but this is a kitchen appliance
		shop. If you want weaponry, I can't help feeling
		you'd be better off going to a specialist.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What sort of specialist?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't tempt me to answer that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What do you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nothing. Nothing. I could suggest a garlic-press, I
		suppose.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Semi-automatic, gas-cooled, hand-to-hand,
		hunter-killer garlic-press?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, no, it's not much of a weapon really. Unless
		you're worried about garlics parachuting into
		Carshalton.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't at this time have garlics targetted as a
		priority threat.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Had you thought of a down to earth, honest to
		goodness kitchen knife?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A kitchen knife?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.

		Produces knife.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't be stupid. You could have someone's eye
		out with that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I thought that was the idea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh no. No no no. You misunderstand me. My
		whole life is based on the principle that I will
		never be the aggressor.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All I want is to be prepared.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	To be prepared?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	To be prepared for when they come parachuting
		into Carshalton ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And also for the moment when I suddenly feel like
		a piece of toast.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You unrestrained arsewit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're welcome.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I definitely think the Queen
		ought to give one to Esther
		Rantzen. Definitely.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is pacing the corridor of a hospital maternity 
	ward, looking nervous. Hugh puts his head out of a 
	door, wearing a white coat.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mr Conway?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah (He looks down the corridor) You are ...?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mr Quick.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mr Quick, right, thank you.
		
		Hugh exits.
		Pause.
		Hugh enters.
		
		Mr Arthur Quick?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Noel.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Noel Quick.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Noel, yes of course. And your wife is Mrs
		Mary Quick?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Shirley.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Shirley, yes. Shirley Quick. Thank you.
	
		Hugh exits.
		Pause.
		Hugh enters.
		
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mr Quick.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Have you come far?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, well, we're just off the ring road. About
		twenty minutes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, nice, nice. I say, hasn't your wife got
		splendid hair?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Has she?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yes. Fantastic.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, I suppose it is rather lovely, yes. I hadn't
		really thought ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well you should think, Mr Quick. You should. It's
		lovely hair. Lovely think, blonde hair.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	She's got brown hair.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Mmm. Lovely.

		Hugh exits.

		(Shouting off) Brown hair.

		Hugh enters.

		Lovely thick, brown hair, yes. To be quite frank
		with you, that's some of the best hair I've seen in
		a long time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're a lucky man, Mr Quick. I'm telling you,
		that is world-class hair.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is there any chance of seeing her, Doctor?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You just can't wait, can you? I don't blame you.
		With hair like that waiting for you, who wants to
		hang around in a draughty old corridor?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well quite.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Excuse me.
	
		Hugh exits.
		Pause.
		Hugh enters.
		
		Yes, I always think brown hair looks tremendous
		on ... a quite short woman.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, possibly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Possibly?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course, my wife's very tall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
