	Ah. You'd say she was very tall would you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very.

		Hugh exits.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Off) Very tall. She's very tall, with brown hair.

		Hugh enters.

		Yes, right. Of course she's tall. Yes. I was thinking
		of her being quite short, because of course she's
		lying down at the moment. So she only comes up
		to my waist. From my point of view, you see, your
		wife is very short ... and very wide. But I expect
		that when you're at home, she stands up quite a
		lot, and so then you're bound to see more of her
		tall side.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Can I see her?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, you can't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Why not.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, because there's a wall in the way.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. Can I go in and see her?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Aha. It's not advisable, frankly. Patients who've just
		had their tonsils out, are always a bit ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Tonsils? She's come here to have a baby.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Excuse me.

		Hugh exits.

		(Off) She's come here to have a baby, for Christ's
		sake!

		Hugh enters.

		A baby, right. That's a lovely idea. Is it your first?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes it is, as a matter of fact. We've been trying for
		quite a long time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I bet you have - with hair like that, phwor, eh?
		Had any luck so far?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What do you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	With babies. Have you had any luck?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well yes, that's why we're here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course, of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Surely she must have had it by now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Who?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	My wife. Surely she must have had the baby
		by now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh er ... hold on.

		Hugh exits.

		(Off) Well where is it? Well haven't we got
		any? Tscch.

		Hugh reenters.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes she has.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	She has? That's brilliant! Is it a girl or a boy?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's ... it's a boy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A boy! Cor! Can I have a look at him?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er ... here I am, Mr Quick.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What do you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er ... I am your son. I was born about twenty
		minutes ago. Sorry, I should have mentioned
		it earlier.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're my son? What are you talking about?
		Where's the baby?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm the baby, Mr Quick. Unfortunately I was born
		with a strange disease called Stimtirumtumtum
		which means that I look and sound like an adult
		even though I'm only twenty minutes old. It's very
		rare, but strangely enough it's also quite common.
		Muriel Gray has got it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Muriel Gray?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes. Only a trained doctor would know that she's
		just six months old.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're mad.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Maybe, Mr Quick ... father. But you know, I blame
		the parents.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Can I see my wife now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mother? Of course. We can be a family at last.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Shut up.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, I always say that fathers should be present
		when their wife's tonsils are being taken out.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Typical comprehensive school office. Stephen is a 
	headmaster. He looks worried. There is a knock at the 
	door. He looks up.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Come.

		Enter Hugh.

		Ah, Terry, come in, come in.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well now, do you know why I sent for you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not really? Not really? Well, let me see. Firstly,
		let me congratulate you on winning the School
		Poetry Prize.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mr Drip tells me that it was the most mature and
		exciting poem that he has ever received from a
		pupil. Don't suck your thumb boy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm not, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, no. It was just a piece of general advice for
		the future.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now Terry. Terry, Terry, Terence. I've read your
		poem, Terry. I can't pretend to be much of a
		judge of poetry, I'm an English teacher, not a
		homosexual. But I have to say it worried me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, worried me. I have it here, um: "Inked Ravens
		of Despair Claw Holes In The Arse Of The
		World's Mind", I mean what kind of a title is that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's my title sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	"Arse Of The World's Mind"? What does that
		mean? Are you unhappy about something?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I think that's what the poem explores.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Explores? Explores! Oh it explores does it? I see.
		"Scrotal threats unhorse a question of flowers", I
		mean, what's the matter boy? Are you sickening
		for something? Or is it a girl? Is that the root of it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, it's not something I can explain, sir, it's all in
		the poem.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It certainly is all in the poem. "I asked for answers
		and got a headful of heroin in return." Now.
		Terry. Look at me. Who gave you this heroin? You
		must tell me: if this is the problem we must do
		something about it. Don't be afraid to speak out.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well no one.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Terry. I'm going to ask you again. It's here. "I
		asked for answers and got a headful of heroin."
		Now Terry, this is a police matter. Speak out.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir, no one has given me heroin.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So this poem is a lie, is it? A fiction, a fantasy?
		What's happening?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, it's all true, it's autobiographical.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Then, Terry, I must insist. Who has been giving
		you heroin? Another boy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, sir, you have.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I have. I have? What are you talking about, you
		diseased boy? This is rank, standing impertinence.
		I haven't given anyone heroin. How dare you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, it's a metaphor.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Metaphor, how metaphor?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It means I came to school to learn, but I just get
		junk instead of answers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Junk? What do you mean, the JMB syllabus is
		rigidly adh -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's just an opinion.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh is it? And is this an opinion too? "When time
		fell wanking to the floor, they kicked his teeth".
		Time fell wanking to the floor? Is this just put in
		to shock or is there something personal you wish
		to discuss with me? Time fell wanking to the floor?
		What does that mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's a quotation.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A quotation? What from? It isn't Milton and I'm
		pretty sure it can't be Wordsworth.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's Bowie.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bowie? Bowie?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	David Bowie.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh. And is this David Bowie too: "My body
		disgusts, damp grease wafts sweat balls from sweat
		balls and thigh fungus", I mean do you wash?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Then why does your body disgust you? It seems
		alright to me. I mean, why can't you write about
		meadows or something?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've never seen a meadow.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, what do you think the imagination is for? "A
		girl strips in my mind, squeezes my last pumping
		drop of hope and rolls me over to sleep alone."
		You are fifteen, Terry, what is going on inside you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's what -
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's what the poem explores, don't tell me. I
		can't understand you, I can't understand you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well you were young once.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, in a sense, of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Didn't you ever feel like that?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You mean did I ever want to "fireball the dead
		cities of the mind and watch the skin peel and
		warp"? Then, no, thankfully, I can say I did not. I
		may have been unhappy from time to time, if I lost
		my stamp album or broke a penknife, but I didn't
		write it all down like this and show it to people.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Perhaps it might have been better for you if
		you had.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh might it, young Terence? I suppose I am one
		of the "unhappy bubbles of anal wind popping and
		winking in the mortal bath" am I?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well -
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Your silence tells me everything. I am. I'm an
		unhappy bubble of anal wind.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's just how I see it. That's valid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Valid? Valid? You're not talking about a banknote,
		you're calling your headmaster an unhappy bubble
		of anal wind.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, I'm one too.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh well, as long as we're all unhappy bubbles of
		anal wind popping and winking in the mortal bath
		then of course there's no problem. But I don't
		propose to advertise the fact to parents. If this
		is poetry then every lavatory wall in Britain is
		an anthology. What about The Oxford Book Of Verse,
		where's that gone?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Perhaps that's the lavatory paper.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is that clever?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I suppose it's another quotation from Derek
		Bowie is it? I don't understand any more, I don't
		understand.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Never mind, sir. You're a bit frustrated perhaps,
		it's a lonely job.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I am frustrated, yes. It is a lonely job. So lonely. I
		am assailed by doubts, wracked by fear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Write it down.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Eh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Write it down, get it out of your system. "Assailed
		by doubts, wracked by fear."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, yes - you think? "Assailed by doubts and
		wracked by fear, tossed in a wrecked mucus foam
		of ... of ..."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hatred?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good, good. What about "steamed loathing"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Better, you're a natural.

		Hugh slips away.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	"... wrecked mucus foam of steamed loathing.
		Snot trails of lust perforate the bowels of my
		intent. Put on your red shoes, Major Tom, funk to
		flunky ... etc ...

		Fade out.
	
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen, a headmaster, is sitting behind a desk. Hugh 
	enters with Michael, a small boy.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah good morning Michael, good morning
		Mr Smear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, we'll dispense with the good mornings if you
		don't mind. I haven't got time for good mornings.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	As you wish. You wanted to discuss something, I
		believe?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I think you know why I'm here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't think I do.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(To Michael) Tell him.

		Michael looks embarrassed.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tell me what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Tell him what you told your mother last night.
'}, {'speaker': 'Michael', 'text': '
	Sexual intercourse can often bring about
		pregnancy in the adult female.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You heard that, did you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I'd like an explanation, if it's not too much
		trouble.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	An explanation of what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	An explanation of how my son came to be using
		language like that in front of his mother.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I imagine that this is something that Michael
		learnt in his biology class, isn't that right?
"}, {'speaker': 'Michael', 'text': '
	Yes, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes I thought so. With Mr Hent. Glad to see
		some of it's sinking in, Michael.
"}, {'speaker': 'Michael', 'text': '
	Thank you sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well I must say this is a turn-up and no mistake.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I didn't imagine that you'd be quite so barefaced
		about it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	About what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I came here today to make a complaint about
		my son being exposed to gutter language in the
		playground. I am frankly staggered to find that this
		is something that he's actually been taught in a
		classroom. I mean what is going on here?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We're trying to teach your son ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh are you? Are you indeed?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What? How to embarrass his parents? How to
		smack himself with heroin?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I assure you Mr Smear, we have no intention ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Call yourself a school?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't actually call myself a school, no.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You ought to be ashamed of yourself. Filling a
		young lad's head with filth like that. Well let me
		tell you something. About the real world. You're
		here to provide a service.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Quite right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Quite right, yes, well I'm not happy with it. I'm
		not happy with the service you're providing.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Would you rather that Michael didn't attend the
		biology course?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Certainly I would, if those are the kind of lies I
		can expect to hear repeated at the dinner table.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	They're not lies, Mr Smear.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh aren't they? Pregnancy is brought about by
		sexual intercourse?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh Lord save us. So you agree with that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course. It's true.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	True my arse. It's nothing more than a disgusting
		rumour put about by trendy young people in
		the sixties.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Trendy young people in their sixties?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The sixties. In the sixties. That's when it all started.
		People like you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mr Smear, sexual reproduction has been part of
		the biology syllabus for many years.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't care about your blasted syllabus. What
		good is a blasted syllabus out there?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Out where?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The Arkwright Road?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Arkwright Jungle, I call it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, what would you rather we taught your son,
		Mr Smear?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I would rather ... I would rather you taught him
		values, Mr ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Casilingua.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Casilingua. Values. Respect. Standards. That's
		what you're here for. You're not here to poison my
		son with a lot of randy sextalk.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So Michael is definitely your son, is he, Mr
		Smear?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Certainly he's my son.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Then it's safe to assume that at some stage you
		and your wife have had sexual intercourse?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Pause) Right.
	
	(Hugh starts to take off his jacket)
	
		That's it. I'm going to knock some sense into
		you myself.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're going to fight me now, are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes I bloody well am. I'm not going to stand
		for this.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do you mind if I do? (Rises to his feet)
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Talking like that in front of the boy. You're a
		bloody disgrace.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mr Smear, let me ask you this. How could
		Michael be your son, if you haven't had sexual
		intercourse?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Michael ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Michael is my son in the normal way.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In the normal way?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And what is the normal way to have a son, in your
		opinion?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If you're trying to trick me into sexy talk ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The normal way to have a son is ... to get
		married.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Buy a house and get properly settled in.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Furniture and so on, and then ... wait for a bit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Make sure you eat properly. Three hot meals a
		day.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So Michael just sort of turned up, did he?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Er ... well of course it's a few years ago now, but
		yes I think one day he was just there.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And you and your wife have never enjoyed sexual
		intimacy of any kind?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, it's very hard for you to believe isn't it, that
		there are still some people left who can bring a
		son into this world without recourse to cannabis
		and government handouts?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I really don't know what to say.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I bet you don't: It's not every day a consumer
		stands up to you and makes demands is it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not of this nature no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, well. Welcome to the harsh realities of the
		market-place, Mr Casilingua.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	OK. Well, what would you like me to do?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's obvious isn't it? If I go into Littlewoods and
		tell them I'm not satisfied with a cardigan, say,
		they'll change it for me. And gladly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You want another son?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Certainly I do. Mine is soiled now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I'm afraid we haven't got any spare sons
		here, just at the moment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well what have you got of equal value?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Um - there are some locusts in the biology lab.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Locusts, hmm. Do I have your assurance that one
		of these locusts will not embarrass Mrs Smear at
		table with foul language?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think I can go that far.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well that's something. How many of them
		are there?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Two ... at the moment.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What d'you mean, "at the moment"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, it's just that these locusts are married,
		they've bought the cage, and some furniture, and
		they're having three meals a day.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hot meals?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Warmish.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So Mrs Smear might be a grandmother one day?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very possibly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Pleased) She'd like that.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
		A good smack in the face. She deserves it.
	'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh is a young and surprisingly handsome chat-show 
	host on a young and surprisingly awful Channel Four 
	chat-show. He is behind his desk.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(In reference to whatever sketch has finished) Well that was the unmistakable sound. Right, my next guest
		wrote his first novel back in 1972, the year of loons
		and flares and Suzi Quatro and the Glitter Band
		and all that stuff. He's been writing ever since, got
		a new one coming out now. Bit of a cult dude with
		the Saporo and sushimi set, so let's say a big "hi!"
		to Richard Morley!

		Enter slightly nervous and serious looking Stephen 
	to absurdly brash music. Hugh does ludicrous jive 
	handshake.

		Right, Richard, welcome, sit down, take the weight
		off your paragraphs.

		Stephen looks bewildered by this peculiar joke.

		So tell me, this novel, what's it called?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The novel I've just written is called The Emperor of 
		Disgust.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The Emperor of Disgust. Sounds pretty heavy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Heavy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What's it about?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You haven't read it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, for the viewers, you know. They haven't,
		obviously. It isn't published till tomorrow is it?
		How can they have done!!!

		Hugh punches Stephen on the arm.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh, I see. Well it isn't very easy to tell you the
		plot precisely because it is rather complicated.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Highbrow stuff I'll bet. Where's it set?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Set? Well the action of the novel takes place over
		several different centuries and a number of different -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Tell me, do you use a word processor? Thing I've
		always wanted to know about writers, you know,
		how they set about it. Pencil, pen, typewriter.
		All that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I use a word processor as a matter of fact. I
		used to use a typewriter, but -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How many novels then, have you had, in fact,
		published?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The Emperor of Disgust will be my seventh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Seventh? You take it pretty seriously, then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, yes indeed I do. I do take it seriously. Very
		seriously. It's my job you see. My living.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Right. Yeah. Tell me, where do you get
		your characters from? From real life?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well usually I suppose they're an amalgam,
		you know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You gonna put me in one of your books then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I think I might actually.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Thrilled with the idea) Yeah!?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. I really think you are one of the most
		repellent and flatulent-minded people I've ever
		met. In many respects ideal fodder for the novelist.

		Hugh laughs in an "isn't this geezer just brilliant?" kind of a way.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know what you're laughing at, I find you
		mindless, vapid and irrelevant.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Still laughing) Seriously, Richard, what's the -
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I am being serious, you repulsive ball of spittle.
		And who the hell told you you could call me
		Richard? You're rotting in hell and you haven't the
		faintest idea of it, have you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The last book you wrote ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Last book I wrote! You haven't a clue about the
		last book I wrote have you, except from what that
		daffy researcher you sent round tells you? Your
		head is crammed with so much pappy drivel and
		greasy bigotry and brash ignorance that there isn't
		room in it for one single idea, is there?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This is brilliant.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh it's brilliant is it? It's "good television" I
		suppose. It shows you at the cutting edge of
		dangerous broadcasting. You're about as dangerous
		as a chocolate "Hob Nob".

		Hugh mugs to the camera.

		Look at you, sitting there like a ... like a fat,
		smug ... a fat smug ... (Breaking out of character 
		and talking to someone off camera) Sorry I've
		forgotten the next bit, "a fat smug ... "
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Also addressing someone off) Vince, we go live on air
		in ten minutes, I thought he knew his lines. What's
		going on?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Sorry, I'm a bit nervous.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Coaching) "a fat smug git who's just won a ..."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(With Hugh coaching) Oh yes, a fat smug git
		who's just won a BAFTA. Have you any idea how
		degrading and demeaning to the human spirit
		people like you are?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Great, then I'll ask you where your book is on
		sale, how much it costs and we'll play you out.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Alright.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Then I'll do a bit of chat, "blah-di-blah-di-blah-
		di-blah" and bang, bang, bang. And, what's next?
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Sex and violence, really. That kind
		of thing. We're a small company,
		but things are very busy at the
		moment.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "Doctor's surgery - yes I know, but I'm afraid that's 
	where we are."}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh is having his chest listened to.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Say "ninety-nine".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ninety-nine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good. Say "thank you".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Say "breasts".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Breasts.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mmm. "R".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	"R".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, if you'd like to do your shirt up now Mr
		Pepperdyne.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Everything as it should be?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Nothing too serious, you'll be glad to hear. You say
		that you've been having a little trouble breathing
		at night?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Been bringing up any sputum?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er, not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Any yellow or green phlegm ... blood?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tightening of the chest?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well a little I suppose.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Headaches?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Apart from the children, you mean? Not really.
	
		They both laugh weakly.
		
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. I want to try you on a course of these:
		one twenty times a day. Have you ever taken
		them before?
		
		Gets out a plain cigarette from a drawer.
		
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Um - what is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a simple nicotinal arsenous monoxid
		preparation taken bronchially as an infumation.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Infumation?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, you just light the end and breath in.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What, like cigarettes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You know them, then? Yes, actually, it's a bit hard
		to admit, but they're basically a herbal rememdy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, herbal cigarettes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right. A leaf originally from the Americas I
		believe, called tobacco.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But medicated.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Medicated? No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	These are ordinary cigarettes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But they're terribly bad for you aren't they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I hardly think I would be prescribing them if they
		were bad for you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Twenty a day?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, ideally moving on to about thirty or forty.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But they give you lung cancer and bronchitis and
		emphysema.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Where on earth did you get that idea?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Everyone knows that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Are you a doctor?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, but it stands to reason doesn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What on earth are you talking about? "Stands to
		reason." You wouldn't even know what a pair of
		lungs did if a doctor hadn't told you. It's taken
		mankind thousands of years to work out what
		the heart is for, what a blood vessel is, what the
		kidneys do, and now you're telling me because
		you've read a few weedy magazine articles that you
		know more about the human body than a doctor?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well no, but - it can't be natural, can it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Perfectly natural leaf.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes but setting light to it and inhaling the smoke, I
		mean ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	More natural than Baked Alaska or nylon socks.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes but you don't inhale nylon socks. At least
		I don't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You wear them next to the skin.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But you can't seriously be recommending
		cigarettes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Why the buggery sod not? A bit of leaf smoke to
		loosen the lungs, ease that tightness and clear the
		head. Perfectly sound.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I suppose you're going to tell me that cholesterol
		isn't bad for you next.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What's cholesterol?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's ... well, you know -
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes I know perfectly well what it is, but I don't
		suppose you'd so much as heard of it until a few
		years ago. You'd die without the stuff.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes but too much is bad for you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well of course too much is bad for you, that's
		what "too much" means you blithering twat. If
		you had too much water it would be bad for you,
		wouldn't it? "Too much" precisely means that
		quantity which is excessive, that's what it means.
		Could you ever say "too much water is good for
		you"? I mean if it's too much it's too much. Too
		much of anything is too much. Obviously. Jesus.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But I thought the balance of informed medical
		opinion held that -
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You thought, you thought. You didn't think, did
		you? Cigarettes are healing, natural and effective.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If you don't mind I think I'd like a second
		opinion.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's your privilege.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Pause) My second opinion is that they are also
		cheap, nutritious and stylish.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And if you're interested in a third opinion they're
		soothing, harmless and sexy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, I must say that does seem to clinch it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Alright then. So twenty a day, rising over the week.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And the tightness in the chest?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Should disappear completely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Tremendous. Well you're the doctor.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're the doctor.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Whatever gave you that idea?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well I mean - you did.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	God, you are pathetic aren't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Um.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm a tobacconist. Isn't it obvious?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But the -
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, it looks more like a doctor's surgery than a
		tobacconist's.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Why?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Why? Because you're the kind of idiot that falls
		for that sort of thing. It's the same reason that
		cosmetics sales staff wear white coats, because
		pratts like you think a Swiss name and something
		called a "skin treatment" must be better for you
		than a tub of cold cream which is all you're in fact
		getting. You're a credulous git, Mr Pepperdyne. A
		stethoscope and a plausible manner doesn't make
		me a doctor. I'm a conman and you're a moron.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You are a doctor then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Could be. What do you think?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You really want to to know?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'd be fascinated.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I think you've taken a reasonably good idea and
		overworked it. I think what started out as a fairly
		interesting and amusing statement about our
		susceptibility to received ideas has become
		something vague, ill-thought out and rambling.
		And I think it's time to finish it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well do you? I think you've comp -

			Blackout 
	
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh and Stephen are on set.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We'd like to do a sketch for you now entitled,
		quite simply, "Jack Nimnock Goes Shopping In the
		Heart of Norwich".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right.

		They each go to one side of the the set and start to walk 
	towards each other. As they pass they recognise one 
	another.
	
	Jack! Jack Nimnock! How are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Neville! I'm fine, fine. How are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh mustn't grumble. So what are you up to now?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh this and that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right. Right. So tell me, how's Mary?

		Hugh looks blank. Stephen speaks sotto voce.

		Mary and I are divorced.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mary and I are divorced.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Divorced? I'm sorry to hear that, Jack. When did
		this happen?

		Hugh again looks blank.

		When did this happen?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A couple of days ago.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Sotto voce) Years.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Sotto voce) You were divorced a couple of
		years ago.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A couple of years ago. Not days, Neville, as I
		initially suggested, but years.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well this is terrible news, Jack, terrible. Whose
		idea was it, if you don't mind me asking?

		Hugh looks blank again.
		
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The divorce. Was it your idea or Mary's? (Sotto 
		voce) Mine.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yours?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yours?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So it was your idea?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So it was your idea?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. How did Mary take it?

		Hugh looks blank yet again. Stephen starts to look 
	annoyed.
	
		(Semi sotto voce) Not too badly at first.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not too badly at first.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Semi sotto voce) But I think she's pretty low at the
		moment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But at the moment I think she's pretty low.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And how about you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Erm ... don't tell me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You had a nervous breakdown.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh yes, I had a nervous breakdown and went
		into shock and when I recovered I found I'd
		completely lost my voice.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Memory!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Memory, I'd completely lost my memory -

		Pause.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Under) And now I can't remember a thing ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Under) I know, I know, that was a pause. (Out 
		loud) And now I can't remember a thing about that
		period of my life.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's terrible, so had Mary been cheating on
		you then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Whispering) I've forgotten.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Whispering) So have I.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, you've forgotten.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I see. I've forgotten. She might have been but
		I just can't ... um ... persuade?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Hissing) No, remember!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	November. I'm a ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Walking off) Git.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm a git. I'm a git, that's right -

		Embarrassed at Stephen's disappearance.

		- right, well cheerio then Neville. It was good
		seeing you after all these ...... er ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Off yelling loudly) Years!!!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Years! That's right.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Hugh is a beggar. Tatty beard, old raincoat - pretty 
	sordid. He has a small cloth cap on the ground and 
	is playing the mouth organ. Stephen, dressed like a 
	plutocrat, passes near him. He stops in amazement
	and stares at Hugh. Hugh starts to get rather 
	discomfited by this.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What on earth are you doing? What on earth are
		you doing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What do you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is that cloth cap there for?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's for the money.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Money? What money? I mean, what are you doing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm busking, aren't I?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Busking? Busking? You're busking? What do you
		mean you're busking?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I play the mouth organ and people give me money.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Money? They give you money? For playing the
		mouth organ? People give you money for playing
		like that? They actually give you money? They
		pay you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Some people do. No harm in that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No harm in that? No harm in that he says. People
		are prepared to give you money for standing on
		a pavement and blowing through spittle? It's
		unbelievable.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Look if you don't like it, you don't have to listen
		or give me anything.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't like it? How could I like it? It's revolting.
		It's the most disgusting and pathetic noise I've
		ever heard. And people give you money for it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's kindness as well, isn't it? They're just
		being kind.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Just being kind? But surely if they were just
		being kind they'd put a bullet through your head,
		wouldn't they? That's what I'd call being kind. Put
		you out of your misery.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm not that miserable. I quite enjoy it. People are
		nice to me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not miserable? Not miserable? How can you be
		not miserable, look at you, your clothes are in rags,
		you smell disgusting, how can you be anything
		other than miserable?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're very insulting, you know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes of course I know. Do you think I wasn't aware
		of the fact? Of course I'm insulting. I'm very
		insulting indeed, especially to smelly, squalid poor
		people who play the harmonica badly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	We share the same planet, why can't you
		let me be?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Share the same planet? What are you saying,
		"share the same planet"? The planet I inhabit is
		full of restaurants, fast cars, high level finance,
		holidays in Barbados and fine wine. Your planet
		is full of bottles of meths, howling harmonicas,
		smelliness and grimy doss-houses. It's not the
		same planet at all. How dare you suggest that it's
		the same planet?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You may not think they're the same planet but they
		are. You couldn't have one without the other.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What are you talking about couldn't have one
		without the other? What are you talking about? Are
		you saying I depend on you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Course you do. All your wealth is entirely propped
		up on the rotting hulk of my poverty - and one
		day it will give way and you'll come crashing
		down with it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Rotting hulk? Have you gone mad? Is this
		communist talk? Are you a communist? Do you
		want me to call a policeman?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's not a crime to be a communist. Anyway
		I'm not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Not a crime? Not a crime? Have you gone howling
		mad, not a crime. This is 1988, of course it's a
		crime. Communists are the enemy of democracy,
		they are criminals.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well what's so good about democracy?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What's so good about democracy? What's so good
		about democracy he asks? It's freedom of speech
		and thought and belief, that's what's so good about
		it, you degraded heap of smelliness. Now get out
		of my way before I set fire to you. Get a job, clean
		yourself up. It's demeaning to have a pile of litter
		playing the harmonica at one.

		Stephen turns and moves off.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Behind him, removing beard) Wait!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Wait? Wait for what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Pointing straight into the camera) You see that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What? See what? What have you done with your
		beard, what is the matter with you? Have you gone
		mad? See what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Laughing) You don't recognise me, do you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Recognise you? No I don't recognise you. Of
		course I don't recognise you, why should I?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Do you ever watch a television programme called
		"On The Streets With Bibby"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	"On The Streets With Bibby"? Oh, the one with
		the hidden camera, you mean?
		(Suddenly terrified) My God, you're not Robert
		Bibby are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Sinking down back onto the street) No, but I might
		have been.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
		Until you've been there, you
		don't really have any idea
		what it's like - I shouldn't
		think. I'm not sure, I've never
		been there.
	"}]

[{'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Father?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've been thinking.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You know how you said that Mother had gone to
		live with Jesus?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I don't think that can be right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Because I saw Mother last night.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. In Asda. And the man she was with was
		nothing like Jesus at all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Putting down newspaper) Look, Jeremy, I think it
		may well be time that you and I had a little talk.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Aren't we having one now, then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, yes, as a matter of fact we are. That's quite
		right. Good. How old are you now Jeremy?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thirty-one.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thirty-one, eh? When I first told you that Mummy
		had gone to live with Jesus, how old were you
		then, eh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Twenty-seven.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, well, goodness me, there we are you see.
		Twenty-seven. Time flies doesn't it? My goodness
		word me yes. There you are. Well now. When I
		told you what I told you it was a little bit of a fib.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You told me a fib.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well it was to spare you hurt, son. You see
		Mummy didn't go to live with Jesus at all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	As I rightly guessed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	As you rightly guessed. What really happened was
		that Mummy died.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Died?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. She died.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But I saw her in Asda.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, you saw someone who looked a bit
		like her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You had to know sooner or later.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How did ... how did Mummy die then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a sad story but you should know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I killed her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You killed her?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Why?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Why? Because she was screwing everything in
		trousers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Returning to paper) You see?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, Daddy.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Lavatories. Love them or loathe them. They're
		here to stay. We use them, we lavish our affection
		on them: we clean them, polish them, some of
		us spend up to half of our lives in them. We read
		specialist lavatory magzines, spend money on the
		latest models with air-conditioning, stereos and
		two-speed wipers. Some of us even race them -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Whispering) Cars.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You mean cars, not lavatories.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Studying script) Oh yes. Cars. How much do we
		know about them? We sit in them once a day and
		trust them to carry our effluent away, safely, cleanly,
		efficiently. Whether they're porcelain, plastic
		or fibre-glass, lever or button flush we expect
		them to -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Lavatories. You mean lavatories.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	T!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The beginnings of the modern lavatory were
		humble enough. In 1793 Johannes Krell of Leipzig
		constructed the first simple metal cabinet, using
		inert gases condensing to cool the cabinet to three
		degrees centigrade. The first dew-bin, or salad
		crisper started to appear in lavatories -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Fridges. You're talking about fridges.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh yes. Fridges. Like them or loathe them, you
		can't ignore them. Everyone's talking about them.
		Whether you're buying or selling a property,
		sooner or later you'll come in contact with a
		fridge. Their commission is an important part of
		your house budget -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Estate agents. You're talking about estate agents.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Estate agents. You can't live with them, you can't
		live with them. The first sign of these nasty,
		purulent sores appeared round about 1894. With
		their jangling keys, nasty suits, revolting beards,
		moustaches and tinted spectacles, estate agents
		roam the land causing perturbation and despair.
		If you try and kill them, you're put in prison: if
		you try and talk to them, you vomit. There's only
		one thing worse than an estate agent but at least
		that can be safely lanced, drained and surgically
		dressed. Estate agents. Love them or loathe them,
		you'd be mad not to loathe them.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's better.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I just loved the Beetles. They had
		hundreds of different kinds. Blue
		ones, black ones, yellow ones, two-
		tone, cabriolet. They had one with
		fuel injection.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is sitting behind a desk with an "information" 
	sign on it. Hugh enters.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. Can I help you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Your face my arse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, I said can I help you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh. I'd like some information, please.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'd like some information, please.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. What information would you like?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I don't know. What have you got?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What information have you got?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, all sorts.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Such as?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Such as ... the average weight of a rabbit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well I never knew that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I never knew rabbits had an average weight.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Have you got any other information?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course. But you've got to ask me questions,
		you see.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And you'll tell me the answers ... ?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	... if I ask the questions. Right. What's the
		name ... ?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What's the name of the man who taught me
		Geography at school?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm afraid that's hardly the kind of thing ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Aha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tscch. Alright. His name was Colin Drip.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Drippy, you used to call him.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Drippy. Cor, that takes me back a bit. Now, there
		was a bloke in our class - tsch, what was his
		name ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Adams, Attersham, Bennet, Connor, Fredericks,
		Hodson ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hodson! That's it, that's it. Ned Hodson. Blimey,
		he used to drive old Drippy up the wall. D'you
		know what he used to do?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. Cor. I wonder what happened to him?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	He married a girl called Susan Trite, and they
		now live in Fenton, near Worcester.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't think I ever met her.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes you did. July the fourth, 1972, you sat next
		to her on a twenty-nine bus down Garboldisham
		Road and she told you about the Bay City Rollers.
		You were in love with her until the following
		Wednesday.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hm. You've got quite a lot of information, then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We try to provide a service. Anything else?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes please. Can you tell me ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Can you tell me how to be happy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How to be happy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How to be happy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm afraid to say that information may be
		restricted.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. You do have it, though?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But it's restricted?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm afraid so. Sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Contented?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, any information on how to be contented?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh I see. Yes, we've got information on that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Can I have it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm afraid it's a secret.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, go on.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Alright. The secret of contentment is ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't ask questions.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen addresses the camera.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You know, some of the funniest things that happen
		in television never actually make it to the screen.
		They're the out-takes, or bloopers, that we all get
		so embarrassed about. Here's one of my all-time
		favourites, from an edition of the Open University,
		recorded in 1979.
		
		Cut to:

		Possibly black and white scene of Hugh standing in 
	front of a blackboard with a lot of incomprehensible 
	symbols on it. He is looking appallingly early seventies,
	paisley, loons etc.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So that if we increase the non-reflexive integers
		in the equation by a marginal quantity denoted
		by D5, we can see that the parallel quantities D7
		and D3 are inverted in the same direction, which
		gives us a resultant modular quantity of minus
		0.567359. Now this should begin to give us a clue
		as to where the next ...
		
		Stephen enters, dressed as a floor manager, also in a 
	paisley shirt and wide flares. He is laughing.
	
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sorry Brian.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's alright. What's happened.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You said "0.567359".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I didn't, did I?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. (Laughing violently) It should have been
		"0.567395".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh no. Oh I don't believe it.
	
		They both laugh hysterically. We hear a succession of 
	bleeps as thy swear good-naturedly about the stupidity 
	of the mistake.

		Cut to:
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Wiping his eyes) Marvellous, bloody marvellous.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	My wife and I were thinking of
		going to Ireland personally, to see
		what all the fuss is about. But
		we couldn't face having all the
		injections.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is behind his desk in the spies office when 
	Hugh enters.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Morning Control.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh. Hello Tony. Come in.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you, I will come in, just for the now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I expect you've heard the news?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well everything is in quite an uproar. You know
		what rumours are.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, it's terrible isn't it, how they spread? I don't
		know. I sometimes think that if I believed every
		rumour I heard I'd be believing some things that
		aren't true at all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	T.

		Slight pause.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Anyway, you'll have to forgive me if I yawn a bit
		during today, what with one thing and another I
		didn't get too much sleep last night.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Poor you, you must be exhausted, or very tired at
		least, or is that wrong?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No. I am tired, that's quite right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	So perhaps you might tell me exactly what
		happened, Control, unless you're too tired.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, I'd be happy to fill you in, that way you won't
		have to rely on departmental rumours, will you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. And that would be a great convenience.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, we picked up Costain last night.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I gathered as much from the rumours, but I
		wasn't sure whether it was absolutely true, so it's
		good to have it confirmed from you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I can imagine. He came very quietly, I think he
		had guessed that we suspected him of being a
		traitor for some time now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Which we had, hadn't we?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. When was it we first came to suspect him?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hoo, well I can't remember exactly, but it was
		certainly some time ago.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Before last spring, I should think.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Around there definitely. certainly no later than
		the fourteenth of May, because that's my birthday
		and I remember saying that catching Costain and
		putting his out of harm's way would be the best
		Christmas present anyone could ever have.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I remember you saying those exact words, Tony.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But any old way, you managed to arrest him then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. He was taken to the ninth floor and I had the
		job of interrogating him.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's never a pleasant task is it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's one of the things I least enjoy having to do
		as a matter of fact Tony. It's very difficult when
		someone doesn't want to tell you things and you
		have to think up ways of making them tell you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, that can call on all your know-how, can't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Costain I'm afraid really didn't want to tell
		us anything. But I thought it would be much
		better if he did because if he's been working for
		the Russians for the last twenty years it's quite
		important that we know everything that he's
		been up to.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That way we know which of our secrets have been
		given away and which ones are safe.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's exactly right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Is the Minister pleased that we've caught
		him at last?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, while on the one hand Tony, he's delighted
		that Costain is behind bars, on the other hand he's
		extremely anxious to avoid any publicity. And on
		the other hand he's ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've got three hands there, Control.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Whoops, I wasn't counting very carefully, was
		I? Well, let's say he's also rather cross that we
		allowed a Soviet agent within our own ranks to go
		undetected for so long.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A mixed reception then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I think that's a fair way of describing it, yes. So
		all in all it's been a pretty tiring forty-eight hours.
		Well, forty-four to be more accurate. But it seems
		like forty-eight, I can tell you. Well, forty-six or
		seven at least.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Tell you what, Control - if you're feeling that
		tired, do you think a cup of coffee might perk
		you up?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh I say, Tony, that's ever such a super thought.
		I'd just love one.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Coming right up.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're a lifesaver, Tony and that's a fact.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And I tell you what, Control ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mm?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm going to make it a good and strong one.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Doh!
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen sits behind a desk, addressing the camera.
	There is an exceptionally cute puppy in his arms,
	probably a golden labrador.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	This puppy, Snipper, is in most desperate need
		of help. Four months ago Snipper's mother died,
		and only three days later her father was killed
		by a hit-and-run driver, Barely five months old
		and an orphan, Snipper was also faced with the
		embarrassing and painful affliction of incontinence.
		It's a condition that we in the West don't talk
		much about: shame keeps millions of sufferers
		silent, but Snipper's incontinence was a source
		of great distress to her and rather than come to
		terms with it, she ran away, to London. It was
		on the way to London that Snipper was assaulted
		and abused by an older dog. You can imagine the
		effect this would have on an innocent puppy bitch
		like Snipper. She was totally confused, bewildered
		and hurt. We think that it is around that time that
		she was struck with traumatic amnesia, a total
		loss of memory. This, apart from anything else,
		made it very difficult for her to know where she
		was and what she was doing. She drifted into a
		life of scavenging and prostitution, selling her soft,
		furry young body just in order to stay alive. That
		was the life that she was living when we at the ASTL
		found her. We were able to give her food, warmth,
		and more than that - love, the one thing that
		has been denied her in her short and tragically
		unhappy life.
		
		Snipper is taking an interest in life now. Her
		memory is slowly returning, which is how we've
		been able to piece together the details of her life,
		and with luck she will be able to lead a normal,
		happy and fulfilled life. But there are thousands
		of Snippers in Britain and we desperately need
		your help to carry on the work we are doing. We
		are an entirely independent charity, we receive no
		government funding and rely on public generosity
		to keep us going. If you're the kind of person who
		would like to help a Snipper then please send your
		donation, however large, to me, Stephen Fry, care
		of the BBC, instead.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
		So I told them to stuff it.
			But they said it had been dead
			too long.
	'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen and Hugh are in the swivel chairs again, being 
	revolting.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well of course what I found particularly
		disappointing was their choice of ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Did that work for you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Their choice of ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No it didn't. I felt it was a mistaken choice, a
		misguided choice, a badly chosen choice.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	They could have chosen better?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think so. And of course, if they had chosen
		better ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Which they didn't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well of course not. But if they had, their
		limitations would have ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I was going to ask you about that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But you didn't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I was going to.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well then, yes. Just so limited, you see. And that
		was bound to limit them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So they were limited by their own limitations?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nicely put.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you. That leads me on to another question.
		May I?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Thanks. I wonder, is there a sense in which you're
		not completely revolting?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No sense whatsoever. I've looked hard for a sense,
		but at the end of it all I've come up senseless.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Does that I wonder tie in with ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Precisely my point. Could one say, from any
		critical standpoint yet devised, that you are any
		distance at all from being utterly repulsive.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ah. Now that's interesting.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh dear. Wasn't meant to be.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Never mind. There'll be other opportunities
		I'm sure.

	
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It only takes about ten minutes
		apparently, and when you
		come out, you look exactly like
		Keith Harris.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(To camera) My guest tonight is someone who in
		1987 caused a sensation by becoming the first
		woman to undergo a complete and successful
		sex change operation. In August of that year she
		entered the Pert Frool clinic in Dusseldorf as
		Melinda Coppice, author, broadcaster and mother
		of three. Two weeks later she left that clinic as
		Michael Coppice. His bestselling account of the
		operation, the painful decisions leading up to it,
		the painful incisions during the course of it and
		the aftermath of fame that resulted from it have
		made Michael Coppice a household name. Let's
		meet him now - ladies and gentlemen, Michael
		Coppice.
		
		Enter Deborah, completely normal woman. Shakes 
	hands with Hugh. They sit. The sofa they sit on is 
	dangerously soft and yielding: every now and then they 
	are out of physical control because it's so squashy and 
	hard to maintain balance in or on.

		Michael. Welcome.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Thank you. Great pleasure.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So. Michael. How would you say your life has
		been since the operation?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Well, I have to say firstly that everyone, my
		family, my friends, the people I meet have been
		enormously supportive since the operation that
		transformed me into a man. Both my ex-husband
		and my present wife have been tremendously
		understanding.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You now have a wife?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes indeed. With two children.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You are able to have children?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Oh yes. I have fathered a wonderful pair of twins.
		It was a total gender change, the operation.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And how successful would you say that operation
		has been?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Well, you can see for yourself. One hundred
		per cent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ye-e-es. How would you describe, as perhaps the
		only person in the world in a position to be able
		to do so, the difference between the sexes, then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	In a way it's hard for me to answer that, Clive: you
		see although I have been completely transformed
		into a man, I am still a transvestite. Hence the
		women's clothes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You are still a transvestite?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Yes. More properly a transexual. Rather a good
		one, I think you'll agree. You'd never know I was
		a man would you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No. No, I don't think I would. Does your wife
		object to your transexuality?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	She seems to understand and support me fully.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well let's meet her and find out. Ladies and
		gentlemen. Welcome now please Michael's wife
		Lucy Coppice.

		Enter Stephen as manly as ever. Man's clothes.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Welcome Lucy. (They kiss)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Thank you. (He squeezes Deborah's hand)
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We were talking about whether or not you
		objected to the fact that your husband is a
		transexual.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh good Lord no. I'm one myself.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You are?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. It's my ambition some day to have an
		operation like Michael's and become a man.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	And I'm going to change myself back into a
		woman and we'll marry again.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you worried that this might upset and confuse
		your children?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh no, the twins are very aware of what's
		going on.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are they identical twins?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	That's right. A girl and a boy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Um - identical twins must surely be of the same
		sex ... er ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, well Simon dresses as a girl and Lucy is a
		complete tomboy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But what sex were they originally?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Um ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Do you know, we can't remember.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen answers the door to Hugh who is dressed in 
	incredible futuristic gear.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello, I come from the future.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Annoyed) What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I come from the future.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do you? Do you, indeed?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's substantially correct, yes. I come from a
		time in advance of your own.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And what century exactly would you be from, I
		wonder?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I come from the twentieth century.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So not significantly far advanced then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, no. I come from a time five minutes ahead.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Five minutes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Five of your primitive minutes. Goodbye.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What. You're going now?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No message from the future?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	There are laws, time laws we dare not interfere
		with, lest we meddle with our own destinies.
		Farewell. I may say I'm sorry that I can't return it.
		Please accept my apologies.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Return what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What you lent me. It was burnt up in the time-
		jump. Still, as you rightly said, it was only Habitat
		anyway.

		Exit Hugh.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Still standing in doorway) Well, frankly.

		Enter Hugh wearing deerstalker and cape, looking very 
	late Victorian.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good morning. If it is morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You again.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't think we've met.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This is my first time in this neighbourhood.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh don't be ridiculous, I was talking to you just
		five ... minutes (Voice trails off) ... ago.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Something wrong?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, no. Probably just a day dream. How can I
		help you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well the thing is, I'm a bit lost. I know this'll
		sound like the ravings of a complete imbecile, but
		you must believe me. I'm a time traveller.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, yes. From the future.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Puzzled) No, from the past. Five minutes ago I
		projected myself five minutes into the future,
		into your time and I was wondering who is Prime
		Minister now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Margaret Thatcher. Look ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah, really? Still? Some things never change. Has
		anyone invented a way of opening a packet of
		"Hob Nob" biscuits without tearing their nails yet?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, look just what exactly -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Is Noel Edmonds still alive?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Surprised) Not that I'm aware of. Look, is this
		some kind of practical joke?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well I must go before I catch up with myself.
		I think next time I shall try going forward a bit.
		Farewell.
		
		Exit Hugh.
		
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bye then. This is getting very difficult to follow.
	
		Enter Hugh dressed as normally as he ever is.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And where are you from?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This is going to sound quite unbelievable but I
		come from ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	.. the funny farm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Never mind, what time are you from then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	North Finchley.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	North Finchley, call it Barnet.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	When?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	When are you from?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you alright?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I - I think so, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm collecting.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Collecting.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What for?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This blinkered, hidebound, reactionary government
		has no vision. I plan to build a machine. A
		machine that will enable man to travel ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Through time, yes, yes, very clever.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No. To travel to central London without getting
		caught in the traffic. The principle is simple: using
		ruthenium and polonium as energisers, I intend
		to build a prototype machine which will leap over
		traffic queues as if they weren't there. Simply
		key in the coordinates of the street you want and
		hey presto. Can I get a grant from the morons in
		government? No sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You don't think there might be any unfortunate
		side-effects?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What do you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Such as time-travel for instance.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Laughing) Oh I don't think so, you've been
		watching too many TV sketches.
		
		Stephen looks into camera puzzled for the briefest of 
	brief seconds.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Tired) Alright then, how much do you want?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, it's not money. It's just that the transducer
		needs a lampshade.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I knew you'd think me crackpotted, but it's true.
		Just a simple common or garden lampshade,
		so that the gallium plate can reach P state in a
		picosecond and then instanly revert to an N state
		which ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, yes alright. I'll get you a lampshade. (Goes in)
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Calling after him) Thank you! Thank you so much!
		You're a friend of science.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Coming out with lampshade) There you are.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Marvellous. Bless you. I have the machine round
		the corner. It will take only five minutes to fit and
		then - London's traffic problem solved in a stroke.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I shall return your lampshade.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't worry, it's only Habitat anyway ... (Voice
		trails away)

		Exit Hugh.

		Stephen pauses for a while and looks into camera.
		
		I'm sure, logically, something weird should happen
		now, but I can't work out what.

	
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Smelling a bottle) Oh I say, that's rather good. Oh yes. Where did you get it?
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Stephen is behind the reception desk of an old people's 
	home. Hugh enters."}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're not very old.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sorry?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I say you're not very old.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, I ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	This is an old folk's home, you see, and
		consequently we do ask that people wishing to
		stay here are, at the very least, old. It's in our
		charter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't want to stay here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh. Then I must instantly demand that you
		pardon me. Have we been talking at cross
		purposes do you suppose?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Possibly, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Whoops. My fault, quite dreadful of me. You'd
		better start again then.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I wondered if ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're not very old.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	This is an old folk's home, you see, and
		consequently ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, I don't want to stay here. I've come to see
		my aunt.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh. No. Oh no. What a shame. She died.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Who did?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Your aunt. If you'd only been a few hours earlier.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
