	Wait a minute. You don't know who I am yet.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't have to. We only had one aunt, you see
		and she passed away last night. Oh, we shall
		miss her indeed. Her cheerfulness, her sense of
		fun ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hold on. Do you mind if we just check the name
		first, to make sure we're talking about the same
		person?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If there's the slightest chance that it'll help you
		to confront some of the painful unanswered
		questions that must be weighing upon you at this
		most difficult of times, then all of a surely.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Please don't thank me, nephew.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wh ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I do this job because I love it. How many people
		can say that? Less than a dozen I fancy rotten.
		Yes, here it is. Room 14, aunt, died at ten o'clock
		last night.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, what was her name?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fourteen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, her name.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well now, I don't think we actually have a record
		of her name. There isn't much space on these
		cards, you see? I keep on saying to the Trustees
		- did I say "saying"? Beseeching on bended legs,
		rather - "give me bigger cards" but ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What was her name?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well before you rush headlong down that tree-
		lined avenue, let me just say that we're very much
		given to using nicknames, here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Nicknames?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Indeed, yes. To myself and the rest of the
		staff your aunt will always be remembered as
		"fourteen". Sounds a bit informal, I know. But
		that's our style here. We leave formality very much
		outside on the doorstep, together with a cheerful
		note to the milkman. From the day she arrived,
		"fourteen" just seemed so right somehow.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Are you saying that a woman died here last night
		and you don't even know her name?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I know it's hard sometimes for an outsider
		to enter a home like this, and it is a home - did
		I mention that? Did I make that abundant? - and
		straight away understand what it is we're really
		trying to do here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	My aunt's name is Amanda Thighkiss.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well there you are, you see. Amanda Thighkiss.
		How could we have called her that? It's so cold,
		so unfriendly. And you can see how small the
		cards are. I'd lucky to squeeze "A. Thigh" on
		one of these.

		Deborah, as a very old lady, appears next to Stephen.
	
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Please ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Whoops! Hahaha ...

		Stephen tries to push Deborah's head down.
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Just a piece of bread, a biscuit, anything.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Aunt Amanda?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	(Popping up) Neville! Oh thank God!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you alright?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Standing in front of her) Oh dear. Oh dear,
		oh dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What's the matter?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	I'm starving. Have you brought any food?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear. I'll never forgive
		myself for this. You should have been spared this.
		I'd give anything for you to have been spared this.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You told me she was dead.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Who was dead?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	As if the shock of the news was not enough,
		you've now had to see this. I'm so sorry. So
		very sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What are you talking about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm sorry that you should be confronted with the
		body in this fashion. It's all very distressing.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Body?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Still, spiritually she's in a better place now. Let's
		be grateful for that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She's standing right there.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well of course her body is right there, but her soul
		... Who knows what beautiful journey ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Please, Neville, have you got any food?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Food? No. Are you hungry?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	I haven't eaten since lunchtime yesterday.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Lunchtime yesterday? What's the matter, don't you
		feed people here at all?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Of surely course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You do?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Indeed yes. Our guests have had more hot dinners
		than you've had ... than you've had.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Then why hasn't my aunt been fed since
		yesterday?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ah. You're a stranger to death, I can see. Let
		me just say, as simply as I can, that it is deeply
		unusual to give food to dead people.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Unless, of course, it is specified in the will.
		Otherwise we tend to look upon it as a needless
		extravagance. However, if it is your wish ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What are you talking about? My aunt is not dead.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Are you a medical person?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Look, she's standing there, talking and
		breathing ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	(Faintly) Aaagh ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	... just ... and you're telling me that she's dead.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I can readily understand that the effect of the
		shock taken with the friendly brightness of our
		decor would make it hard for you to grasp ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	She is not dead. (To Deborah) Are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh I know how much you want to believe it.
		Otherwise how could you stand the loss? But you
		see, I too have lost. When dear old fourteen died,
		a little part of me died with her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Did it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, I shall be burying that little part of me this
		afternoon after a simple but affecting ceremony in
		the garden. Would you like to come?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Look. Why do you keep saying that she's dead?
		Just tell me ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, if it won't be too painful ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No go on. I'm keen to know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Brave, brave nephew. What happened was this. I
		sent out a final reminder, thirty days after the last
		payment fell due, and believe me, even at that
		stage I still hoped that all might be well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wait a minute. Payment for what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Why, room and board. Payment comes due on
		a monthly basis. Most of our guests favour an
		arrangement whereby ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You mean she hasn't paid her bill?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Sadly, no. We're all so very sorry. My deepest and
		most heartfelt condolences to you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How much?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your very pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How much does she owe?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A very tragic one hundred and nineteen pounds
		and seven pence.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Getting out cheque book) Well for goodness sake,
		(Writing) one hundred ... nineteen pounds and
		seven ... pence. There.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Taking it without looking - his gaze is fixed on 
		Deborah, who has started to eat the desk blotter)
		
		Fourteen! Can it be true? Can I be believant of
		my eyes! I'm sure I saw ... (To Hugh, briskly)
		Would you mind putting your card number on the
		back?
		
		Hugh does so and hands over the cheque.
		
		Yes! She moves, she stirs, she seems to feel the
		breath of a life beneath her keel. It's a miracle! A
		miracle!
		
		A porter enters wheeling a conspicuously dead person 
	on a trolley.
	
		Number twelve! Look at this! Number fourteen
		has come back to life! Oh wonder of wonders!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Now come on, that woman really is dead.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	On the contrary, sir. She has a standing order.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Wrinkling nose in disgust) Oh
		that's horrid. That's really
		horrid. Disgusting. Is it Welsh?
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Enter Stephen, holding a human brain.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ladies and gentlemen, I wonder how many of
		you know what this is? Well most of you will know
		that it's a brain, a human brain, but can you guess
		whose brain it is? I should tell you first of all that
		for some time I've enjoyed a bit of a reputation
		as a practical joker, you see, and what I've done is
		this. While Hugh was asleep in his dressing room,
		I crept in and very carefully removed his brain,
		being sure not to wake him up. This is Hugh's
		brain. He'll be coming on in a second, let's see if
		he's noticed anything's amiss ...
		
		Enter Hugh, laughing cheerfully.
		
	
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hahahaha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello, Hugh. What have you been up to?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've just been watching that Noel Edmonds show,
		it's so funny. Just brilliant. Completely brilliant.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ha. Are you feeling alright?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, fine, fine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And then I saw a bit of an interview with Kenneth
		Baker. That man is fantastic.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do you think so?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, he's wonderful. He's just what this country
		needs. He's firm, courageous, and his views on
		education are so enlightened, so sophisticated,
		so utterly enthralling. Well, he's an enthralling
		person, of course.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(To audience) It's great, isn't it? We can see the
		difference, but poor old Hugh hasn't noticed a
		thing. (To Hugh) D'you recognise this?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's a cauliflower.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hahaha. A cauliflower. Hasn't he been a sport,
		ladies and gentlemen? So what are you going to
		do now?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I thought I'd write a letter to "Points of View".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Dear oh dear oh dear. Perhaps I've gone a bit far.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I'll tell you this for free
		... (Pause)
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Mother (Deborah Norton) and father (Hugh) standing
	at font with baby. Stephen is the vicar. Hugh is very
	much the modern thrusting executive.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I baptise thee Rupert Jeremy James -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, hold on a minute.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're right darling, Nicholas is better. Nicholas
		Thomas Geoffrey.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nicholas Thomas Geoffrey.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	You can't have Nicholas Thomas: that's a very
		ugly rhyme.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're right. What was the other one we liked?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Timothy Nicholas Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, Nicholas Timothy Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Dipping finger in water) OK. Nicholas Timothy
		Peter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's a shame to lose Jeremy though, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	I still like Duncan.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Duncan Jeremy Nicholas or Nicholas Jeremy
		Duncan?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Look. I have got a wedding in ten minutes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're being paid aren't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Puzzled) No ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Nick's idea was Peregrine.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Oh darling, you can't call a baby Peregrine.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, Peregrine Jeremy Duncan ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	I know it sounds silly but I've always loved Dick.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Erm ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Now Dirk's due for a revival.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Duncan Dirk Dick.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Rather fetching.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Duncan Dirk Dick, I baptise thee in the name
		of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy
		Ghost, Amen. We receive this child into the
		congregation of Christ's flock and so sign him
		with the sign of the cross (Signs with finger on 
		forehead) and in token that hereafter he shall not
		be ashamed to confess the faith of Christ crucified
		and manfully to fight under his banner against
		sin, the world and the devil, and to continue
		Christ's faithful soldier and servant unto his life's
		end. Amen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No it's still not right ... I don't know ... hold
		on, what about Tweeble?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Oh darling ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's our nickname for the little blighter
		anyway, so why not?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Tweeble Timothy James, I like it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, Tweeble Timothy James.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm sorry, it's Duncan Dirk Dick, I've just
		done it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, undo it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Undo it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	This is a Holy Sacrament of the Church, not a
		bleeding hotel reservation, you can't just undo it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're beginning to annoy me, buster. Look at
		this card. (Holds up white card) What does it say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	"Christening service".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Service, notice - not rudeness. It doesn't say
		"Christening rudeness".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I wasn't being rude.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just bear in mind that there are plenty of other
		religions you know. Some of them, I may say,
		offering much greater range and value.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Not to mention carpets. Look at this.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So come on. Hand him over.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hand him over. We'll take a look at the Mosque
		on Arlington Road, if it's all the same to you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But I haven't finished the service!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The rudeness, you mean? Well you should have
		thought of that before.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Look, you can't just walk out half way through.
		Think of the child!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Screw the child. Haven't you heard the news?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I've heard some news, but I doubt if it's the
		same news that you're ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	There's a revolution going on. Enterprise,
		initiative. Those who can't trim their fat go to
		the wall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What wall?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What wa ... ? You just don't know what I'm
		talking about do you? I'm talking about the
		way you're running this flea-bitten, one-horse
		operation. Take this building. All this equity
		tied up for what? A couple of weddings a week.
		Pathetic. God, I'd like to get my hands on this
		place. I could really do something. Shopping
		arcade, four luxury flats, brasserie downstairs. It's
		a criminal waste.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Getting annoyed, puts baby in font to use both hands
		to speak - no one notices) Look, matey, this is a
		church, not a dealing room. I am not interested
		in your creepy theories about enterprise and
		initiative. This place is founded on ideas a bit
		more permanent than the Dow Jones Index.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah. Something a tadge classier than "buy long,
		sell short and get into gilts".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Uhuh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The Church will be here long after your little brat
		has grown up, ripped a few people off and died
		unloved in his Spanish retirement villa.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Portuguese, actually. And there's no need to be
		so beastly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I'm sorry, but people like you really piss
		me off.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've got a big mouth, mister. So what's your
		pitch, your scam, your angle?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well look at you. You fight and deal and cheat
		all your life to get enough money to spend a few
		years wobbling your fat old bodies round a beach
		or a golf course, but what provision have you
		made for after your retirement?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	After my retirement?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm talking about heaven.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Heaven? Isn't that where the Gilroys went,
		darling?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Devon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	After a hard life, don't you think you ought
		to treat yourself to a little long-tern security?
		I'm talking about lifestyle, status, comfort, and
		peace-of-mind.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	(Nudging Hugh) Don't trust him, Pudding.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Give me space, give me space.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	She's right, think about it, Pudding. Think about
		it. Talk to your independent spiritual adviser.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hmm. He may have something.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And if you won't treat yourself, have a thought for
		Duncan Dirk Dick. Give him a chance to get in
		on the ground floor.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Darling, and no disrespect to you, Vicar, but what
		I'm thinking is this. How about a mixed portfolio,
		whereby we spread him through Judaism, Islam,
		Hindu and so on, maintaining a firm base in the
		Church of England?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	It does sound safer.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Exactly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Alright. So. Duncan Dirk Dick, I baptise
		thee in ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Well then it ought to be something like Duncan
		Isaac Sanji.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Duncan Abraham Sanji would be nice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Oh how about Duncan Abraham Naresh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right. Do it yourselves. There's the water, there's
		the hymn book. I'm off for a slash.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "Bank manager's office. Stephen sitting behind the desk.
	Hugh enters, looking quite needlessly repellent, folders 
	and things tucked under his arm."}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Rising) Mr Lully?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Glad you could see me at such
		short notice.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not at all, come in, sit down. Coffee?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How do you like it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Decaffeinated, jug method, low mineral content
		filtered spring water, not quite brought to the boil
		with semi-skimmed milk and one Nutrasweet.
		Unstirred.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. (Intercom) Mark?
'}, {'speaker': 'Voice', 'text': '
	(Intercom distort) Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do we still have that chemistry set in the office?
'}, {'speaker': 'Voice', 'text': "
	(Intercom distort) 'Fraid not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right, one coffee then please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Voice', 'text': '
	(Intercom distort) K.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So, Mr Lully, you'd like a loan?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's pretty much the size of it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You mention in your letter that you're starting
		up a business and that you're interested in taking
		advantage of our new "Gredo" start-up package.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's correct.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, now first things first. What exactly is the
		product you're hoping to market.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ah, yes. Brought some samples along as a
		matter of fact.

		Hugh gets out two small sachets.

		Haven't actually settled on brand names yet. But
		there's basically two products. The blue sachet is
		cocaine and the red is heroin.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	My own market research and some work
		undertaken by the packaging and graphics team
		has revealed that cocaine is thought of as a fresher,
		brighter product, hence the blue, and heroin is
		warmer and more passionate, therefore red. You
		disagree? I'd value your input.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're planning to distribute and sell drugs?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	On the button. The market's there, I'm ready to
		go, and let's face it - Europe's open for business.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ye-e-es.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Problem?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Possibly. Possibly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know what you're going to say. It's a market
		that up until now has been hedged about with a
		lot of rules and regulations, and let me tell you
		this. When I first began to look at this market,
		I thought to myself, "hey, I'd be better off
		manufacturing red tape". Hahaha!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Red tape, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But thank God, times are changing. Whole
		new markets are opening up, and I'm ready to
		play them.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The demand is there, no question.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Uh huh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The most exciting thing for me is that it's such a
		young market.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Immensely young. Consumer profiling indicates
		the twelve to fifteen-year-old segment. And if we
		can instil in them product loyalty, that's got to be
		good news.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Aha. But ... but ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know what you're going to say. "Do they have
		the income?" right? Well, what I always say is, "if
		the product's right, they'll find the income." Their
		mother's handbags, car stereos, old age pensioners,
		wherever.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mmm. I meant, well ... I hesitate to use a word
		like this. I know it's old-fashioned. But do you
		think it's strictly moral?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is it moral?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Moral?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm not sure if I've actually got any precise figures
		on that ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, I actually mean ... is it moral to do this at
		all? You know ... children and so on.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well. Let me turn the question round and ask you
		this. Would you rather we stood by and watched
		the Germans, the Dutch, the South Americans
		take our market share? Where's your precious
		morality then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Up a gum tree without a paddle, that's where it is.
		The question is this. Either you believe in market
		forces or you don't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well actually, I'm afraid to say I don't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You don't?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. I used to of course, when I was a child, but
		like everyone else, I discovered as I grew older that
		it was all made up.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Made up?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. I can still remember the exact moment. It
		was Christmas Eve. I can't have been more
		than about thirty years old. I couldn't sleep, so I
		crept downstairs and heard my parents laughing
		about market forces, and saying that they'd have
		to break it to me sooner or later. Bit of a blow,
		I can tell you. And then two years after that, I
		discovered there was no such thing as Father
		Christmas either.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're kidding?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh sorry, did you ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes I did. Tscch.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Growing up, eh?
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
		Well, you haven't paid
			me yet.
	"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen and Hugh are having a chat in a setting yet to 
	be decided.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Interested in politics at all?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Interested?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's my hobby.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Crikey yes. Politics? Oh yes. Of course it's mostly
		a weekend thing I'm afraid, but come Sunday, it's
		down the end of the garden and politics, politics,
		politics. In answer to your question, yes. I'm a
		bugger for politics.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What do you think of Nigel Lawson?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Nigel ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Lawson.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Lawson, yes. (Long pause) What d'you think
		of him?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	He's a twerp.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, thank God for that. I thought he might have
		been a friend of yours or something. Yes, he's a
		twerp. What a twerp. Tscch.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	At least you know who he is.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't actually, to be honest.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You don't?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Not who he is, no. I've always just thought of him
		as a twerp. Never bothered to look any deeper
		than that. It's the shortage of time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	He's Chancellor of the Exchequer. Just.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. Is he? The old bastard. Nigel Lawson,
		the Chancellor of the Exchequer? What a
		twerp. Tscch.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(To camera) Perhaps you can see what we're trying
		to do here. Hugh is trying to act the part of a man
		who doesn't know very much about politics. (To 
		Hugh) What do you think of Douglas Hurd?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Douglas Hurd. Er ... pretty lukewarm about him,
		to be honest.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah. Bit of a twerp. But ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(To camera) Hugh is pretending not to know who
		Douglas Hurd is.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... you know, it takes all sorts to make a world.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	D'you think?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh definitely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You don't think that with fewer twerps, you could
		make a better world?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh you've got to keep the number of twerps down,
		yes. You can't let them run out of control.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tell me something. Did you vote at the last
		election?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh they haven't banned them as well, have they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Was that the last election? Never going to be any
		more, ever again? Tscch! And I missed it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(To camera) I suppose what we're trying to say
		with this sketch is, can democracy really work
		as long as the people who vote are kept, or keep
		themselves, in ignorance of political affairs?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Is that what we're trying to say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Blimey.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Because let's face it, doesn't the constitution of
		the present government show, more clearly than
		a thousand pictures ever could, that the people of
		this country haven't the faintest idea who they're
		voting for?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are we trying to say that as well, with this sketch?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Turning out to be quite an ambitious sketch, then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You've got to aim high in my view. So, you don't
		really know anything about Nigel Lawson or
		Douglas Hurd?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So I think this has gone some way towards
		proving ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Mind you, I don't see why I should.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They don't know anything about me. Do they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I mean, you say I don't know anything about
		them, so how can I vote, but I say they don't know
		anything about me, so how can they vote ... to
		make laws about me?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mmm. That would be quite a good point, if it
		weren't so pathetic.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I see. We're not aiming that high, then? We
		don't want to say too much with this sketch?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But there's so much more we could say.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Perhaps, but I'm afraid that time, the old enemy
		has beaten us again, and we can only say that
		the pen of my aunt is bigger than the patio of
		my uncle.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Huh. Quite a pen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Quite an aunt.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	On the bottom. Right on
		the bottom. Saying "Made In
		Korea". I don't know what made
		him say that.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen enters a surgery. Hugh is sitting behind a desk.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello, Doctor.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ah, come in. Look, you're the last, do you mind if
		this is very quick?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Er ... no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Alright then, how can I help?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Very fast) Well Doctor, the fact is that I've got a
		bit of a pain in the bottom.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Just as fast, if not faster) A bit of a pain in the
		bottom, I see. How did this happen?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I was out shopping this afternoon, and across
		the other side of the road a bomb went off in
		a shop.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A bomb? Good heavens!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, and anyway, the whole pane of glass in the
		window of the shop next to me blew out.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The whole pane?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, and anyway, a bit of the pane flew out and hit
		me in the arm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The arm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. So I dropped my shopping, unfortunately on
		the foot of a horse that was standing in the street.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A horse?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. A horse. Are you deaf? And the horse shied
		and just as I was bending down to pick up my
		shopping this horse kicked me in the other arm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The other arm? I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So I went over to a doorway and sat down. But
		I didn't look where I was sitting, there was glass
		everywhere, and as I sat down I got a bit of glass
		right in the palm of my hand.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Palm of your hand?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes and I had this bottle of strong acid in my bag
		and unbeknownst to me I spilt some on the step
		when I stood up, sharply, from the pain of the bit
		of pane of glass in the palm of my hand.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I see, you spilt some acid.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So then I caught the bus home.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You caught the bus home.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, you are deaf. And on the bus I sat next to
		this pervert. He took out this enormous carrot, and
		at knife point he ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good Lord.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	He made me put it up my nose, while he watched.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Heavens.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So I ran out of the bus, which was moving, so I
		landed with a great bump and grazed my knee.
		But eventually I got home.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And I rushed to the bathroom because I was dying
		to go, you know ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mmm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But I rushed out of the bathroom, because there's
		no toilet in there, and I went into the lavatory
		instead. But there wasn't any paper.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So I had to get some from the cupboard. I then
		went upstairs to change, and there was a wasp in
		my new pair of trousers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, a wasp!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, so I killed it. Then I went downstairs and
		watched television.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mmm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And it was that Paul Daniels, who's a bit of a pain
		in the bottom. Doctor, what can you do about it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Doh!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Doh!
'}, {'speaker': 'Both', 'text': '
	Doh!!!
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I said to him, he must have
		been about fourteen, then. I
		said "Son, you can't carry on
		forever just hanging onto your
		mother's apron. She's going to
		want it back one day."
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	A woman answers the door. Hugh is standing there, in 
	a raincoat and pork pie hat.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good evening, Chief Inspector Venice, Burnham
		CID. May I come in?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Of course you can, dear. It's your house.
		
	She turns and walks away, leaving the door open.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You stupid woman! You stupid bloody woman!
		Come back here! Are you mad? I could be
		anybody! I could be a maniac!
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	You're my husband, dear.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How do you know that? I mean how do you know
		that? Have I produced any identification?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, exactly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	But ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ask to see my warrant card.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	(Sighs) Can I see your warrant card, dear?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Certainly madam. A very wise precaution, if I
		may say so.
		
	Hugh produces warrant card, and holds it under 
	her nose.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Good, now do you ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well look at it! You haven't even looked at it!
		Jesus, I could have bought this in Whitechapel,
		for all you know. I could be a maniac with a fake
		warrant card.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Alright. "Chief Inspector ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't leave the door open! God almighty! Use the
		chain, woman! What do you think it's there for?
		
	She closes door. Hugh stays outside which she reads 
	the card.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	(Off) "Chief Inspector Venice, Burnham CID."
		She opens the door again.
		Now come in and have your dinner, dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Come in where?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	The kitchen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry. I have no authorisation to enter the
		kitchen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	You don't need it. It's your kitchen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Our kitchen, dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Our kitchen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You know perfectly well, I cannot enter our
		kitchen without your special permission.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	You have my permission.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Haven't you forgotten something, dear?
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	We agreed that we would both get telephone
		confirmation of the other's identity, before either
		of us gave special permission.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Oh Christ.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Here's the telephone, dear. And remember. Better
		safe than cut up into tiny pieces by a maniac
		pretending to be me.
		
	She dials.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Burnham CID? Have you got an Inspector Venice
		in your department? (Pause) Thank you very much
		indeed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	They've never heard of you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Damn. Anyway, what's for supper? Smells great.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	They've never heard of Inspector Venice.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Probably just a joke. We're always having jokes,
		down the station.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	You're not a policeman, are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No. No, I'm not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A maniac.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Desmond Lynam. Yeah, Desmond
		Lynam. Roughly equivalent to
		Malcolm Muggeridge in old money.
	'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '	Deborah is sitting on a sofa watching television.
	Suddenly there is some extremely violent hammering at 
	the door. We hear Stephen and Hugh off.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Off) Just turn the handle.
		
	More crashing.

		(Off) Turn the handle. What's the matter
		with you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Off) Nothing.
		
	More crashing.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Off) All you've got to do is ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Off) Look, I've carried this bloody thing all the
		way from the car park, I'm not going to just turn
		the handle and walk in.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Off) All right, well I'll turn the handle.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Off) Do what you like. I'm smashing this bloody
		door in.
		
	The door opens. Stephen enters the room.

		(Off) Close the door, close the door.
		
	Hugh stays in the doorway and smashes the door to 
	pieces with a sledgehammer.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	(Scared) What do you want?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mrs Catherine Popey?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes? What? Who are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Sorry to disturb you madam, my colleague and I
		are making some routine door-to-door enquiries
		in this area. D'you mind if we come in?
		
	The door is finally off its hinges.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Finished.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Well, why didn't you ring the bell?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You see, I knew this would happen. She's now
		asking why we didn't ring the bell.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We thought you were out.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, that's the wrong answer. That's the wrong
		answer.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	We didn't want to disturb you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. No no no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	If we had rung the bell, there would have been no
		point in my having carried a sledgehammer all the
		way from the car park.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Pause) Yup. Looks like we may have got away
		with that one. Now Mrs Popey, is your husband
		at home?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your husband. Is he at home at the current time?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	I haven't got a husband.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You haven't got a husband? I see. Right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well when do you expect him back?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No. No. That's the wrong question.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes it is. Now then ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	When do you expect her back?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now then Mrs Popey, please excuse the
		incompleteness of our records. Computer trace
		indicates that you are currently the holder of a
		husband.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Well I'm not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're not. Well I'll have my colleagues amend
		the record accordingly. Now then Mrs Popey.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Your husband's been a bit busy lately, hasn't he?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Been giving us the proper runaround.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	He's scum. That's what he is. He's a scumbag.
		A great big bag of scum, he is, scumming around
		in a big bag. That's what he is. And he always
		will be.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	I haven't got a husband. I'm not married.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You can take the scum out of the bag, but you
		can't take the bag out of the scum.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Boil in the bag scum, that's what he is.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yeah, my colleague has perhaps adopted a rather
		more forthright tone than I would have chosen,
		but then I like to think that's why we work so
		well together. Because we compliment each other,
		you see.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, we compliment each other beautifully. Watch
		this. You're looking very smart today.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Thank you. That's a very nice haircut.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You see? Teamwork. Now then. To business, Mrs
		Popey. Your husband has ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	For heaven's sake. How many times do I have to
		tell you? I haven't got a husband.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well now ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Twenty-five.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Excuse me for just a moment, would you, Mrs
		Popey? (To Hugh) What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She's got to tell us twenty-five times that she
		hasn't got a husband.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Why?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Once for every day in the week.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yeah, that doesn't quite work.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Doesn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Alright. Once for every year he's going to spend
		inside. The scumbag.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Look, I don't know who you are, or why you
		want to speak to a husband I haven't got, but I'm
		telling you ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh, we don't want to speak to him.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Don't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No no no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No no. Speak to him? No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If I may say so, I think you've been watching too
		many films, Mrs Popey.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Well whatever. The point is, I haven't got a
		husband and therefore do you think it's possible
		that you might actually have the wrong house?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No no no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No no no no no no no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No. You see, we've already been there.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Where?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	To the wrong house. We've just come from the
		wrong house, just now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My colleague is absolutely right, as it happens
		Mrs Popey. We have, just this minute, come from
		the wrong house. So that argument doesn't really
		stand up, I'm afraid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. That argument falls straight over.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And just lies there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now since you claim to be alone in the house,
		you won't mind us having a quick look around?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	How quick?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very quick.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Help yourself.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Thank you.

			Stephen and Hugh wave their heads about, stupidly.

		There. That didn't hurt, did it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It did actually.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Just whatever you do, don't wake up my son.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I beg you pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah so do I. I beg it as well.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	My son is asleep upstairs. I'd rather you didn't
		wake him.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now wait a minute Mrs Popey. Wait just a minute.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Whoah there, boy! Whoah!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hold on one second. You have a son?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well now Mrs Popey, we may be stupid, but
		we're not clever. How do you come to have a son
		without having a husband. That sounds mightily
		ingenious.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	He was a sailor.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mmm. In the Navy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	No, with the Nat West.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I see. Well, we'll leave that for the moment. This
		son of yours, he's upstairs, you say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes, asleep.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What, tired, is he?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm not surprised he's tired after the merry dance
		he's been leading us.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, a very merry dance indeed he's been
		a-leading us of. Highly merry. Ha, ha, ha, it's
		so merry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I think we'd better have a word with this son of
		yours, Mrs Popey, if it's all the same to you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Only if you promise to leave as soon as you've
		finished.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course Mrs Popey. We'll leave just as soon as
		we've finished being here.
		
	Deborah exits.
		
		What a charming woman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Charming. Delightful. A really super woman.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	She's taken it so well.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This is it, you see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Too well, perhaps.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I didn't want to say, but yes, she may have
		taken it too well.
		
	Deborah reenters, carrying a cot containing a 
	small baby.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	This is my son William.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Aha. You've been a bit of a naughty boy, haven't
		you, William.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ask him what he's done with the stuff.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now then William, what have you done with the
		stuff? (To Hugh) What stuff?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't know. It was a trap.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	He hasn't fallen for it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Pause) Scumbag.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Who are the great hat-wearers of
		today? There aren't any, you see.
		No one for the kids to look up to.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Headmaster's study. Stephen is behind a desk. Quite 
	a public-schooly sort of study, but not overdone. Not 
	actually window seats and old English Gothic windows,
	but quite cosy nonetheless. Enter Hugh dressed as a 
	schoolboy. Grey uniform, darkish tie. Dull appearance."}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah, Bamford, come in, come in.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So, Bamford. First day at St Gray's, eh?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Getting on alright?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Shy) Not too bad thank you, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Not too bad thank you, sir. Not too bad thank you,
		sir. Good, good. Good, good, good. You'll find it
		strange at first I dare say.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's a bit hard to find my feet, sir, yes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Really, well we'll have to do something about
		that. Some sort of name-tape sewn into them may
		help. But the first few days are always a little
		bewildering.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mind you Bamford, if you were to believe
		everything you read on the television you'd think
		new boys spent their days being roasted in front of
		fires and having dessert fruits pushed up their ...
		their ... there couldn't be less truth in that, could
		there, Bamford?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, sir. Quite right. Schools like ours have survived
		because they've moved into the modern age,
		Bamford. Progress, Bamford.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Progress isn't a dirty word, you know. Arse is a
		dirty word, and so, to some extent, is labia. Learn
		that, Bamford, learn and obey.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, sir. I will.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But progress is the towel that rubs us dry. Each
		soft cotton flick of progress can penetrate the
		darkest, dampest corners of our mired and filthy
		selves, and polish us clean.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I didn't know that, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well Bamford, now you do, now you do. Good.
		Oh good. First class. Fine. Splendid. Sp-len-did.
		Excellent. Eccelente.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Um, was there anything else?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hm? Yes, yes indeed there was anything else.
		There's a rumour going around the Lower Fourth
		that you have an uncle who is a Member of
		Parliament.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A Labour Member of Parliament, Bamford.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now, on the whole, boys are a pretty healthy,
		tolerant and forgiving lot, Bamford. But they
		can be cruel. You can answer this next question
		with perfect frankness, it won't transgress that
		schoolboy code we masters know and respect
		so well. Have you been teased at all about this
		unfortunate relationship?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well sir, not teased exactly ... more, well,
		beaten up.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I see. I'm sorry you saw fit to sneak on your
		schoolmates, Bamford. That disappoints me. I
		shall overlook it this time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're a new bug after all. Do you know why they
		have been ballyragging you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I must say, I'm a bit puzzled by it, to be frank, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, you see, in my history and general study
		lessons I sometimes speak about Socialism and I
		expect that's made something of an impression on
		your classmates. Their political zeal may have got
		the better of them.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You see, I tell the boys, Bamford, and this may
		come as quite a shock to you, that while socialism
		is all very well in practice it doesn't work in theory.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I didn't know that, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. Quite a thought isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And that's why they punch me in the face a lot,
		is it sir?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well Bamford, they know that the real evil of
		socialism lies in it's treatment of people as units.
		It discounts the individual, Bamford. It's the grey,
		dull uniformity of it all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And the - have you got your top button undone,
		Bamford?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, yes, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(As if reciting a catechism) "The top button to
		be done up only on Crimson Days or on the
		Thursday preceding exeats, otherwise the middle
		button unless you have a note from matron to say
		you have a veruka in which case the bottom button
		may be done up, but only if the left sock is rolled
		halfway down between patella and Achilles tendon
		on a line previously drawn by Mr de Vere."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sorry, sir, I forgot.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alright. Don't let it happen again. Where was I?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Grey dull uniformity of it all, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. Yes, exactly. Regimented lines of soulless
		automata, putting state before self, sacrificing
		everything for "the good of the state" - it's a
		nightmare. That's the drawback of socialism, it
		discounts the - the what, boy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The person, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, the individual! Get it right. The individual
		is paramount in any political system - your hair
		is two thirds of an inch over the collar, see Mr
		Buttaris for a licking - individualism is all. Alright,
		Bamford. That's all. We shall all make a mighty
		effort to overlook your uncle for the moment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good. And cheer up, eh? I know you'll do your
		best, what?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'll try, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right, boy. For the good of the school, eh?
		For the good of the dear old school. After all, we
		can point with pride at our history as the finest
		comprehensive in Durham, can't have you letting
		the side down. Off you go.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Getting cane out of drawer) And send Scargill minor
		in, would you?
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen and Hugh are in the swivel chairs again.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Simon Clituris, you saw that. Thoughts?
		Inferences?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, you see they fell into the old trap, the
		old trap of going material that is essentially
		self-referential.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	By saying the term "self-referential", you
		mean ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I mean to present myself as an impressive, even
		perhaps interesting, person.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ng. Ng. Aren't you getting a little tired though of
		humouresque material on television that is about
		television?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Very tired. Exhausted.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I think there's something very incestuous about
		people who make love to close blood relations.
		Perhaps it's just me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You see I wish, I wish they'd come to me
		when they first wrote that sketch. I could
		have just pointed out to them where they had
		gone wrong.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	This was my feeling exactly. Just nudged them
		gently in the right direction. It's all they needed.
		There's some talent there.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Would you have said that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, not talent perhaps. I don't think they'd make
		very impressive critics for example.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They always put out these things without
		consulting us first. I mean we're here to help.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	To help and to criticize. I'm sick up to the back
		stomach with the kind of comedy that has such
		utter and profound contempt for people like us.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You see it's interesting isn't it, if you compare
		that sketch with the work of someone like Diana
		Suckleigh.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah. Now, you see?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Diana is observant, she's real, she's truthful.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Always truthful. Very beautifully truthful and real.
		Very actual.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I mean it doesn't all work.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She makes mistakes, but then which of them
		doesn't?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right. We can't all be critics, for goodness'
		sake.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What you've got to do is boil
		them, for about ten or twelve
		minutes, and then slice them
		down the middle. But these
		judges nowadays are soft. Far
		too soft.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	The spies' office. Stephen is pacing up and down 
	frantically."}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh enters.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hullo there Control. Something up?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Still walking) Well, it's a strange thing, Tony, but
		I've been advised that in order to stay fit I have to
		walk at least ten miles a day.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But you've always been as fit as a flea, Control.
		Or a fiddle anyway. "One of the fittest men in the
		service" you've been occasionally referred to as.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Look at this.
		
	Stephen brings out a pedometer.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's what I asked myself when the doctor gave it
		to me. It's a pedometer.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A pedometer?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, it measures how many miles I walk. Mrs
		Control is jolly careful to make sure that I put it
		on every morning, worst luck.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hah. Still, I'm sure Mrs Control has your best
		interests at heart.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, that's true. Selfish of me to grumble. After all
		Tony ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's for my own good she's being quite so firm about it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Any golly way, you don't want to listen to my woes
		I dare say, Tony.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, I don't know, they're quite interesting.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What brings you to the seventh floor this morning?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, do you remember the Minister asking us to
		jolly well hurry up and find out who was behind
		all these bombs that have been going off in
		government departments of lately?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do I remember, Tony. Yes indeed, I most certainly
		do. A top priority investigation was demanded as
		I remember. Surveillance, tailing, tapping, no limit
		to the budget. "Let's pull out all the stops on this
		one, Control, if you'd be kind enough", he said.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Quite a to-do.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I was going to ask you Tony. I put you in charge
		of that operation, have you come up with anything
		yet that might be a useful lead, or better still
		concrete information that could lead to some
		arrests?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, that's the very reason I popped in and
		surprised you at your walking, Control. I've just
		had a report from Commander Henderson of
		Special Branch.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's the Scotland Yard branch founded
		earlier this century to deal with subversion and
		counter-insurgency.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's the exact one.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I imagined quite strongly that it would be.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes. And they say that with some of our agents
		working undercover alongside them, they've
		arrested a cell of men and women who they believe
		they can prove are definitely responsible for the
		whole sorry wave of unfortunate and exasperating
		bomb attacks.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It was a sorry wave wasn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It certainly was.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well that is good news I must say.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I thought you'd be pleased.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm most pleased Tony. Well done. Full marks.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Calls for a coffee wouldn't you say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It most certainly does.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'll fetch you one.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, Tony. It's my turn to fetch you one.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well goodness, thank you Control.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No Tony, thank you. White no sugar, I think it is.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes please. This really is excessively kind of you
		Control.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh please don't mention it Tony. Besides ...
		(patting his pedometer) ... the extra walk will
		impress Mrs Control!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Back in a mo, Tony.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Righto Control. I don't mind the wait.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No it would not be nice. It
		wouldn't be nice if all towns were
		like any town, let alone Milton
		Keynes.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh is reading a poem.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Underneath the bellied skies,
		Where dust and rain find space to fall,
		To fall and lie and change again,
		Without a care or mind at all
		For art and life and things above;
		
		In that, there, look just there,
		No right left up down past or future,
		We have but ourselves to fear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hugh, you chose that poem. For God's sake why?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I chose it for a number of reasons, Stephen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. The most important one being ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Can I perhaps turn that question round and say
		"because it was short".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The poem?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. I chose that poem because it
		was short.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And that's significant?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well of course. With the pace of modern life
		being what it is, it seemed to me that most
		people just haven't got the time to spend on long
		poems, and this would therefore ideally suit the
		short-haul commuter or the busy housewife. This
		is a poem that can fit neatly into the most hectic
		of schedules, and leave time for other sporting or
		leisure activities.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So that represents quite a boon to the modern
		poetry reader?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh an enormous boon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well of course we're always on the lookout for
		enormous boons. And I presume it's reasonably
		safe?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Absolutely safe. This is a poem you could leave
		around the house in absolute confidence.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Excellent. Presumably though, there must be
		shorter poems than that one?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh good heavens yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good heavens yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good heavens yes. There's a poem by Richard
		Maddox called "Institutions" that I can read for you
		now, if you like?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Here is it. "Li."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That is short.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's very short indeed.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Too short perhaps?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Possibly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But I suppose that might just suit the busy senior
		executive who can only snatch a moment between
		meetings, and so on?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well that's right. That's certainly the market that
		Maddox was aiming for.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now at about this time, many people are going to
		be thinking about their summer holidays. Are there
		any poems that you might recommend to a family
		going on, say, a two-week get-away day leisure
		bargain break weekend away leisure holiday-break?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well first of all, let me give a warning to any
		families planning to take poetry on holiday
		with them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And that is?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Be careful.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sounds like good advice to me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Check with your travel agent to see if there are
		any specific customs regulations regarding poetry,
		and if you're travelling outside the EEC, wrap
		up warm.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Any particular advice on how to carry poetry, when
		travelling abroad?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, I would say it's definitely worth getting a
		proper travelling poetry bag.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A travelling poetry bag?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. You can buy one of these at most big High
		Street travelling poetry bag shops.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Great. Now I think you've got one last poem for
		us, before you go?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I certainly have. This is "The Rest of My Life" by
		R.P. Mitchell.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The R.P. Mitchell?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. A R.P. Mitchell.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	This poem is fairly solid, but at the same time, not
		too heavy. I think it's quite stylish.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So it might suit, say, a young couple starting out in
		the catering business?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	If you like. "Forward and back,
		Said the old man in the dance,
		As he whittled away at his stick,
		Long gone, long gone,
		Without a glance,
		To the entrance made of brick."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thanks very much.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen is getting out a couple of glasses and a bottle of 
	whisky in the kitchen of his house. Hugh is sitting at 
	the table looking faintly embarrassed.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We'll wait for the ladies to get back from the
		theatre shall we?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, yes - good idea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know what they see in it myself. Sitting
		there in the dark watching a lot of old nonsense.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh well, they seem to enjoy it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know about you, but I go to the theatre to
		be entertained.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, I think they do too.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	If I want to see a lot of swearing and pretentious
		drivel I can stay at home.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Still, anyway. They've been looking forward to it
		for a long time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Pouring out the drinks) Right. Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've been looking forward to this, as a matter of
		fact, Matthew: this opportunity for a frank talk.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. Good. It's always nice to have a good - water?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thanks.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Adding water to Hugh's drink) - chat, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mm. How long have I known you and Sarah now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hoo, ch. What, must be nigh on.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	More I should think.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. Possibly even more.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You and Sarah are quite a couple.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, I'll tell you this, Dominic. I don't know
		where I'd be without Sarah.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Amazing woman. I think I love her more now than
		when I first met her. Be nothing without her. Lost.
		A shadow. Nothing. A blank. A zero.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	God I love her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Thing is. Mm. Well. You know Mary and I
		have been going through a sticky patch lately?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Surprised) No. No, I didn't know that. A
		sticky patch.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What sort of sticky patch?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, just a general sort of, you know, sticky
		patch really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh dear. Nasty things sticky patches.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	They can be, certainly. You and Sarah have
		never ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What? No. Not us. We're a team. Never had a
		sticky patch between us. Do you know in the
		fifteen years we've been married, I've never so
		much as looked at another woman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, except my mother of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Um ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But then you have to look at your own mother,
		don't you. Rude not to. And I know Sarah's
		the same.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She's never ... ?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No. She'd never betray me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She'd never, for instance, have a ten year love
		affair with, say, your best friend, for the sake of,
		say, argument, say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Sarah? No. She'd rather cut the legs off her
		favourite table. Faithful as the day is long.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Anyway. This frank talk.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You had something you wanted to say?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fire away then.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	This isn't easy. It's just that - well, that ten year-
		old love affair I mentioned -
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mary.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh no. Don't tell me. You've discovered that your
		wife Mary has been having an affair. Dominic, I
		don't know what to say.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, no. Mary wouldn't betray me, I know that -
		that's what makes it all so difficult.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I was going to say. I was pretty sure Mary and I
		have kept it pretty discreet.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's the other way round, I - what?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What did you say just now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh nothing. Just that I was sure Mary and I had
		been far too discreet for you to notice that we've
		been having a wild affair under your very nose
		for the last - twelve years I should say. At the
		very least.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You and Mary have been ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh God yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But you said you would never look at another
		woman apart from Sarah and your mother.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And Mary, obviously. That goes without saying.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, that makes what I was going to say a lot
		easier then.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It may interest you to know that your beloved
		Sarah and I have also been having an affair for
		... well for eleven years anyway.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon? You and Sarah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, I thought that might shake you up a bit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You pair of deceitful, two-timing -
		Enter Sarah and Mary.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': '
	Hello, you two.
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': "
	Look at them both, up with the whisky bottle. I
		don't know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mary. Darling, is it true that you and, that the
		pair of you have been ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Sarah, tell me. It isn't true that the two of you have
		... is it? Tell me it isn't.
		Sarah and Mary look at each other and sigh.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': "
	We were going to tell you anyway, weren't we
		darling?
"}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': '
	Yes, we were. Tonight in fact.
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Mary and I have been having an affair for the last
		fourteen years.
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': '
	A very passionate affair.
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Strikingly passionate.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': "
	I don't know how you found out.
"}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': "
	(To Mary) You didn't leave the thingy lying around
		did you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, I meant you and Dominic. You and Dominic
		have been having an affair for the last eleven
		years at least.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And you and Matthew, Mary.
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Oh that. Well that was just a diversion really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh was it? Well, Dominic, it makes it a lot easier
		for us to tell them, doesn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It certainly does. It may interest you to know that
		Matthew and I have been - how shall I phrase it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bed-mates?
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Lovers?
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': '
	Sex-friends?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Joy-partners?
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Bliss buddies?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, well, any one of those for the past - what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hoo, it's got to be at least eighteen or twenty
		hasn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, for the last eighteen or twenty years.
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Well.
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': '
	Frankly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': "
	So. you're saying that we have all been to bed
		with each other.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That seems to be about the size of it, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': '
	Though seperately.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, seperately, obviously.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In every possible combination.
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Well. What a kerfuffle. What a business.
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': "
	I don't know what to say.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It is something of a how-do-you-do, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well. So. What do we do?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I should have thought it was obvious.
'}, {'speaker': 'Mary', 'text': '
	You mean ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': '
	Only thing to do?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Sarah', 'text': "
	Let's all go to bed.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. Right.
		They all trot off to bed.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Smelling a bottle of something 
		and handing it back) I don't
		know. Kenneth Baker perhaps.
		Nicholas Wychell?
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen enters a caf. Hugh is behind the counter,
	wearing an apron and wiping the counter.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'd like a tuna sandwich and a tea, please.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So would I, to be perfectly honest.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I don't know about the tuna sandwich -
		maybe a doughnut - but I'd certainly like a tea.
		I'm dying of thirst.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh dear, well, can I have one as well?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A tea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're asking me?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, ahaha. I think there's been a bit of a
		misunderstanding. I don't actually work here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh I'm so sorry. I thought ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, the apron and everything ... yes. No I don't
		work here. No no no. Haha. That's quite funny
		actually.
		
	They both look down the counter, as if to find 
	the owner.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ... is it closed?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't think so. They'd have put the sign up.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, I thought it said "open".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah, I think it's open. Cor, I could murder a
		doughnut, couldn't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Actually yes, a doughnut would be nice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I was thinking maybe I could just take one, and
		then leave the money on the side. What d'you
		reckon?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a possibility, I suppose.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	'Course, I don't know how much they are.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Errm ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, if you don't work here, why are you behind
		the counter?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
