	I'm an undercover policeman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Phwor. Those doughnuts are driving me potty. I'm
		going to have to put them away in a minute.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right, yes. You're not very far undercover, are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	How d'you mean?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, I mean what's the point of being undercover,
		if you're going to tell me that you're undercover?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Quite a long pause) Actually, that's quite a
		good point.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What you're saying is, I shouldn't have told you
		that I was an undercover policeman?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Precisely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah, that's a good point. Because basically, you
		now know that I'm a policeman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	So the whole reason for me putting on this apron
		and standing here since eight o'clock this morning
		... is, well, wasted really.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'd have thought so. I mean, it's none of my
		business.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No no no. Don't ever say that. Don't ever say it's
		none of your business. No, we need the public to
		come forward. Believe me, we're very grateful.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not at all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Of course, we also need the public to shut up and
		not tell anyone else that I'm a policeman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Good. That is a very good point, though. Don't
		say you're an undercover policeman. Yeah.
		Thanks.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, are you waiting for some criminal or
		something?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right, funnily enough, yes. I'm waiting for a
		criminal, and when he enters the premises, let me
		put it this way, he can expect a warm reception.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. That should be exciting.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	People often say that, but no, it's not exciting. It's
		ninety-nine per cent routine legwork.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're not a criminal by any chance, are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh good. Because I'd have had to give you a
		warm reception if you were.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But then of course, I probably wouldn't tell you
		if I was.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah. Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now that I know you're a policeman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I get you. You wouldn't tell me, because you
		now know I'm a policeman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. That's if I was the criminal.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Right. Are you the criminal?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But the point is, I might be.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh hold up, you've gone all strange again. You
		just said you weren't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But I might be.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This is getting stupid.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Not really. You see, if I was a criminal, I wouldn't
		tell you that I was. If I wasn't, I also wouldn't
		tell you that I was. So just because I say I'm not,
		doesn't mean I'm not. A criminal.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Slippery sod, aren't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You read a lot of books, I suppose?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, you know ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	One of my regrets about the police force. No time
		for reading.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mmm. Pity.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Do you want to share a doughnut with me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Er, no thanks.
		
	Hugh breaks a doughnut in two, and gives one half to 
	Stephen.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There you go.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, really I won't thank you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There you go.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Take it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No!
		
	Hugh pushes half the doughnut into Stephen's face.
		
		What are you doing?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Giving you half this doughnut.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't want it!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You think I'm stupid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Just because you've read books and I haven't, you
		think I'm stupid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No I don't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If you didn't want a doughnut, you'd say you
		wanted a doughnut. So just because you're a
		criminal doesn't mean that I don't have to give you
		a doughnut, because you've said you didn't want a
		doughnut in the first place which is actually what
		you'd say if this doughnut was a policeman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're mad.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Mad am I? Your first mistake. I never told you I
		was mad. I told you I was a policeman. But you've
		just said that I'm a mad policeman. How could
		you have known that, without me telling you? So
		I must have told you. Except that I didn't, so how
		do you know?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's obvious.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've got nothing against where I
		live now. It's just a bit detached.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh is a judge in a full-bottomed wig. Stephen is 
	counsel with a full bottom. He is cross-examining a 
	female witness, Deborah.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, Miss Talliot, you expect the court to believe
		that on the evening of the fourteenth of November
		last year, the very year, I would remind the court,
		on which the crime that my client is accused of
		committing took place, you just happened to be
		walking in the park?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	That is correct.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That is what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Correct.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh it's correct, is it? I see. Am I right in
		understanding, Miss Talliot, that the American
		writer Gertrude Stein was a self-confessed
		Lesbian?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	I believe so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You believe so? Gertrude Stein remains one of the
		most celebrated American female novelists of the
		century, Miss Talliot. Her lesbotic tendencies are
		a matter of public record.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But you only "believe" that she was a Lesbian?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	Well, I've never really thought of it much. I
		haven't read any of her works.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Miss Talliot, there is a bookshop not two streets
		away from your "flat" where the works of Gertrude
		Stein are openly on display.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes; "oh". And yet you would have us believe that
		somehow, on the many occasions on which you
		must, in the course of your duties as a woman,
		have passed this shop while shopping, failed
		entirely to enter and buy any book published by
		this openly Sapphic authoress?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Mr Foley, I'm afraid I really fail to see where this
		line of questioning is leading us.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	With your permission m'lud, I am trying to
		establish that this witness has been guilty of
		weaving a tissue of litanies, that far from being the
		respectable president of a children's charity and
		ambassador's daughter that my learned friend the
		counsel for the prosecution would have us believe,
		she is in fact an active, promiscuous and voracious
		Lesbite.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I see. Carry on. But I must warn you, Mr Foley,
		that if you attempt to ballyrag or bulldoze the
		witness I shall take a very dim view of it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your lordship is most pretty.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Very well then, you may proceed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Are you aware Miss Talliot -
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	It's Mrs in fact.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh. Oh, I do beg your pardon. If you wish to
		make so much of it, then I will certainly not
		stand in your way, "Mrs" Talliot, if that is how you
		prefer to be known.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	It is how my husband prefers me to be known.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your husband the well-known Bishop?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A bishop in a religion, the Church of - ah -
		England, I believe it calls itself, which owns land
		on which houses have been built, houses in
		which it is statistically probable that private acts of
		Lesbian love have been committed?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mr Foley, I fear I must interrupt you again. I
		myself am a member of this same church. Are we
		to imply from the tenor of your thrust that I am a
		Lesbian?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your lordship misunderstands me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I hope so. I hope the day is far distant on which
		I could be accused of making love to a woman!
		Ha, ha, ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Certainly, m'love. I never meant to imply ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Attraction to women, however, repellent as it may
		be to persons of sensibility, is not in itself a crime.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I love your lordship.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We must therefore remember, Mr Foley, in our
		enthusiasm to get to the bottom, that Mrs Talliot
		is not on trial, she is a witness. However depraved
		and wicked her acts of lust, they - in all their
		degenerate and disgusting perversion - are not the
		subject of this assize, bestial as they may be.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I am yours for ever, m'dear.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Please continue.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I do not wish, "Mrs Talliot" to submit the court to
		any more details of your sordid and disreputable
		erotic career than is necessary. I merely wish to
		enquire how it might be that you expect a jury
		to believe the testimony of a monstrous bull-dyke
		of your stamp against the word of a respectable
		businessman?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	I am merely reporting what I saw.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What you saw? What you saw through eyes
		dimmed with lust? What you saw maddened by
		the noxious juices of your notorious practices?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	What I saw on my way back from the parish
		council meeting.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is it not a fact that the words "parish council" are
		an anagram of "lispian crouch"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Er ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You hesitate, Miss Toilet!
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	I was ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You stand condemned out of your own soiled and
		contaminated mouth.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	I -
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No further questions.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You may stand down, Miss Lesbian.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Oh. And will you be in for tea tonight, Jeremy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Certainly, mother. (Louder) Call Sir Anthony
		Known-Bender.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course crime is bound to
		be on the increase. If you're
		the kind of person who wants
		to start a satellite broadcasting
		channel, but you can't get a
		licence, crime is the obvious
		alternative.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh, American, is standing, Stephen, English, lies on 
	a couch.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you at ease and relaxed, Mr Lloyd?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, very. This is a very comfortable chair.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That is no accident, Mr Lloyd. It was designed by
		a friend of mine, to my specifications, purposely to
		relax you and place you fully at your ease.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well it is very comfortable.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My friend will be delighted to hear that. Now,
		Frank - I shall be calling you Frank through the
		duration of these sessions. Okay by you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I have found that that also helps relax you into a
		state where you feel able to talk freely with me. Is
		it working?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good. Now ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My name is Jonathan, I don't know if that -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Good. Already we're finding out new things. Now
		Frank, I want you to take a deep breath through
		your mouth.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Doing so) Haah!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Fine. Now I'd like you to breathe out through
		your nose.
		
	Stephen snots slightly in obeying this request.
		
		In through the mouth, out through the nose. Do
		you know what this is called, Frank?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Breathing.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's nice. Frank, this is called inter-oral, extra-
		nasal respiratory relaxant therapy, and - as the
		name implies - this an American technique.
		Good and calm and regular. Frank, I want now that
		you should allow your mind to take you backward
		in time. Think yourself back and back and back.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Have you gone back?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've gone back. What do you see in your mind's
		eye, Frank?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The Spanish Armada.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Frank, you may have gone back too far there. I'm
		talking of your memories Frank. Your childhood
		status. I want to investigate all the sense data
		of your infancy. Go back to when you were in
		second grade.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Second grade.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know what that is. I've never understood
		it when people talk about grades and semesters
		in films.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	OK Frank, maintain your respiratory rhythms and
		let's turn then, if we may, to your dreams. You
		dream, Frank?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes I do, yes as it happens, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You do? Well that's fine. Are you able at this time
		to recall to the surface of your conciousness any
		recurrent nocturnal dream sequences for me?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I do have one recurring dream as a matter of
		fact.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well now, let's take time off Frank, to analyse that
		sequence together.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It is rather a strange dream.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Is it Frank, a dream of an erotic nature I wonder?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh. Well I'd still like to hear it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	As I say it's a bit odd.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ordinarily, Frank, the more bizarre or outre the
		dream, the more readily susceptible to positive
		interpretation is thusly renders itself to become.
		On the converse side of the bull-pen, simpler
		dream experiences are more resistant to explication
		and offer a much more complex morphology to
		the professional inquirer bold enough howso to
		venture therein.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But hey, Frank! That's my problem. You've got a
		dream, let's share it. What do you say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Are you sure this is going to get us anywhere?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Depends where you want to be, Frank.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Where do you want to be?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I want -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I want to be there too, Frank. I want to take you
		there. (Putting his arm on Stephen's shoulder) Don't
		be scared. Do I scare you, Frank?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You sure about that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, a bit perhaps.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Incredibly loudly) I'm going to kill you!
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Starting) Jesus!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That scared you, didn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. Yes it did, actually.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good, I like to know the thresholds within which I
		have to operate. Putting my hand on your shoulder
		did not scare you. Shouting loudly in your ear that
		I was going to kill you, did. Those are my limits.
		My ceiling and floor if you will.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do you want to hear this dream or not?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I very much want to hear this dream, Frank. I do
		really. Shoot.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, I'm in a corridor -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Frank, I have a small tape-recorder here. Do you
		mind if I - ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, no. Good idea. This is quite a complicated
		dream.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm in a big building. I think it's a hospital ...
		
	Hugh switches on his tape-recorder: pop music comes 
	out. Hugh taps his feet and joins in the singing.
		
		What are you ... ?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Please continue, Frank.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I think it's a hospital, but it isn't. It's some kind
		of institution. There's a big staircase, a uniformed
		man at the top. Janitor or something. He beckons
		to me ... look, I can't concentrate with this
		going on.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Turning it off) I do most sincerely beg your
		pardon, Frank. Please continue.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, anyway, the janitor beckons to me and then I
		wake up.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You wake up. I see. Now this sounds ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And almost immediately I'm chosen for a
		bathroom wall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Frank, I've never thought of myself as a stupid
		man, but even so I think I'm going to need a little
		help understanding that last sentence. You were
		chosen for a bathroom wall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well the thing is, you see, I haven't woken up at
		all. I've only woken up in the dream. I wake up
		and find that I'm the colour blue.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The colour blue.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right. And somebody chooses me for their
		bathroom wall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I see. And do you then become the colour of
		that wall?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No. As it happens, I'm a particular shade of
		blue that's very difficult to get in the shops. The
		bathroom wall ends up with a bit too much green
		in it. But we get on reasonably well.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The colour of the bathroom wall and I get on
		pretty well. There are no hard feelings.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I see. This bathroom, Frank. Does it belong
		to a lady?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Er ... yes, I think so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And she likes to bathe in this bath in this
		bathroom?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I suppose so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you attracted to her?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well no. I'm the colour blue, how could I ... ?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But she's attracted to you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	She chose you, Frank. Out of all the other
		colours, she chose you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There you go. She was attracted to you, Frank.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	She chose me because I reminded her of
		the colour of a bruise she once had on her
		inner thigh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Now we're getting somewhere, Frank. You
		remember being the colour of this bruise?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Vaguely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This is an interesting sequence, Frank. What
		happens next?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I tell you how my dream continues, I think.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I find myself in the corridor in a large house just
		outside Taunton and Prince Edward is running
		towards me, he's about to bowl a cricket ball at me
		and I haven't got a bat. Prince Edward is running
		in to bowl and I haven't got a bat. What does
		that mean?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just may be a little early to say yet, Frank.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But suddenly I find it isn't Prince Edward after all,
		it's Bob Holness.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Come again for me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bob Holness. You know, "Blockbusters". Bob turns
		to me and I catch sight of his face, it's a twisted
		grinning mask of contorted harted and frenzy. I
		look down and I find I have got a bat. I didn't
		have a bat when it was Prince Edward but I did
		when it was Bob Holness. Why? Why? Am I mad?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mad? Frank, "mad" is not a word I like to use.
		Let's just say that half of us is always "mad",
		disordered, wild and the other half is sane,
		rational, in control.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh I see. You mean there's two sides to every
		person?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, I mean the two of us. Half of us is sane,
		that's me, and the other half is mad, that's
		you, Frank.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I must say you seem rather unorthodox. The last
		man I saw just gave me a couple of fillings.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Dentistry has made many advances, Frank.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Obviously.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah I've been there once
		or twice, but I didn't much
		like it. There's another one
		on the A12 which I think
		is better.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen addresses the camera, the way he often does.
	He is talking to Dr Marjorie who is a distinguished- 
	looking woman, wearing a badge that says "Say no to 
	madness".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Every day in Britain, more than ten million
		people are mad. That's the worrying conclusion
		contained in a report just published entitled "Is
		Britain Turning Into a Nation Of Mad People?"
		Dr Mijory Marjorie is with me now. Dr Marjorie,
		just how serious is this problem ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	It's very serious in ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Wait a minute, I haven't finished.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Sorry.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... in real terms?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	(Pause) OK?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, go on.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	It's very serious indeed. In 1957, when records
		began, we were I think, the sixth maddest country
		in Europe. Whereas last year's figures show
		that now, Britain, I'm afraid, leads the European
		Community ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And it is a community, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Yes ... Britain now leads Europe in terms of
		being mad.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's a worrying trend certainly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	You're very kind.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not at all. Now, Dr Marjorie, in case any viewers
		have just this moment tuned in, would you mind
		having this whole conversation all over again?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Fine with me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is Britain turning into a nation of mad people?
		Dr Mijory Marjorie is with me now. Dr Marjorie,
		how serious is this problem, in real terms?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Not particularly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not particularly what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Serious.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. Right. When we talk about Britain being
		one of the maddest countries in Europe, exactly
		what sort of madness are we talking about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	All sorts really - from the kind of madness that
		leads people to put on a hat whenever they get
		into a car, to the really extreme madness shown by
		people who write to "Points of View".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Interesting. That's quite a broad basket of
		madness, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': "
	I think we've been pretty thorough.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right. Now, for those viewers who have only just
		tuned in right this second, I think it might be
		worth you investing in a copy of the Radio Times,
		don't you? So that you can plan your viewing
		properly. After all, you wouldn't start reading
		a book at chapter five, would you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	You would if the first four chapters were rubbish.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh be quiet. Now turning to the causes behind
		or beneath or even slightly to one side of Britain's
		increasing madness ... in a sense, what are they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	Well, we examined a number of factors ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sorry, who is "we"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	My mother and I.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	... and a woman called Alice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Deborah', 'text': '
	And we came up with some very interesting
		results. Essentially, madness is like charity. It
		begins in the home.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Christ that's interesting.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
		... Haha ... round the ring
			road ... hahaha ...
	'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh and Stephen are in white tie, drinking brandy,
	perhaps in a clubby sort of place. Maybe a portrait of 
	Hitler above a mantelpiece.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Gayle?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, Leonard?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How are we going to do it, I wonder?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How are we going to make Fascism popular in this
		country? Popular and exciting.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh that. Yes. That's become something of a
		madness with you, hasn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I believe it has become something of a madness
		with me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And yet, if anyone were to ask me, I would never
		say you were a mad person.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I believe I pay you well enough for that service?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Indeed yes. I didn't mean ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Perhaps it's that little touch of madness that keeps
		us all sane.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. I doubt it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But how are we to do it? How are we to make
		Fascism exciting and important?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We must reach out to the young people.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You think?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Certainly. After all, the young people are the
		cornerstone of our society. The young people
		are the future.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Or at least they will be.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. They are.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are they?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. They will be the present, but they are
		the future.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well well. So how can we make fascism live
		among the young people?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We could advertise.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Gayle, my dear old mucker, what are thinking
		of? Advertise?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I am thinking, Leonard, that we must use today's
		tools for today's job.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Go on.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	If we are to be successful.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In our venture.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's it, I'm afraid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I see. And what are today's tool, in your opinion?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh there are so many tools around today. Look
		at advertising. Pop music. Films. Magazines.
		Everywhere images of sexuality and coolness.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Coolness.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Coolness. Hipness. Laid backness. Not being a
		pratness.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And so we must make fascism ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Cool.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Cool.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	First, we must invent a fashion in clothing.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mmm. There must be leather.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Leather, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And lace.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Leather and lace, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	With cotton facings.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Excellent. Already you see, we have a look.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And where shall we find them, these young
		people?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Wherever blood and money and sexy talk flow
		freely, there will you find the young.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And what will we say? How will we persuade them
		to surrender their ice-skating and their jazz music
		and turn to Fascism?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mm. Leonard, I wonder if you're not a little out
		of touch.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Gayle, please. You are my lieutenant. My
		side-plate.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Indeed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Tell me what I must say.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You must say to the young people - Oh young
		people. You who are young and thrusting and
		urgent, there is a beat, a sound, a look that's new,
		that's you, that's positively yes!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They'll laugh at me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	At first ... and ultimately, yes. But in the middle,
		they'll listen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hmm. Alright. Boys and girls, dig what I am about
		to say. Fascism is cool. Fascism is leather and lace
		with cotton facings.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Throw away those transistor radios. Come on
		out from those steamy parlours where the coffee
		is cheap and the love is free. Join us in our
		movement.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And while their bodies jerk and jig to the music
		of those words, we must somehow introduce
		the subject of segregating races and abolishing
		elections.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We could give away sachets of face-cream in our
		magazines.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And for the women?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Gayle. There is no place for women in our
		thousand year order.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But Leonard, women do have certain useful
		functions.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Such as?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	News reading.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Why do you always insist on calling it that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It excites me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Now on the subject of racial purity, perhaps a
		national advertising campaign?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Excellent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I will present it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh but you can't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And why not pray?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Because God doesn't exist.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, I mean - and why not ... (Pause) pray?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Because God does not ... (Pause) exist.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Never mind. Why can't I front this national
		advertising campaign?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Because your grandmother was a quarter Italian. I
		shall present the commercials.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You? You, whose godfather is Jewish?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	At least my sister didn't marry a Welshman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Better marry a Welshman than eat Greek yoghurt.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Rather Greek yoghurt than Cornish ice-cream.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Stop, stop! Don't you see? They are turning
		us against each other. We shall present the
		commercials together.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. Together.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Our slogan shall be - "Good old Fascism. As true
		today as it's always been."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But Leonard, my dear old acquaintance, surely this
		is a new Fascism?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Alright. "New Ph balanced Fascism, a whole new
		world of natural goodness, right there in the cup."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Cup?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Why not?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What about - "Maureen Lipman with some letters
		from you about new Fascism".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Would she do it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't see why not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I have it. "If you thought Fascism was just goose-
		steps and funny hats, then take a look at what
		we've been doing. Available in matchpots too."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Das Sieg wird unser sein, as they say in Germany.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Do you hate anyone enough to give them your last
		pot-noodle?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Fascism. Half the fat, all the taste. That's the
		Fascist promise.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	From Lenor.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's Ideal.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I wish I was young.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Me too.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's just well laid out, you
		see. If you can imagine
		that the four star pumps
		are lined up there, and
		they've got the diesel and
		two star pumps opposite
		... well you see I much
		prefer that.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh is a bank teller. Stephen approaches the counter 
	wearing some sort of mask and carrying a sawn-off 
	shotgun.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Be clever.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Be clever. If you even breathe too loud, I'll blow
		you in half. Now, slowly and carefully, open the till
		and take out all the notes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All the notes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	All the notes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Is your account actually with this branch?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If not, I'll have to make a phone call. Shouldn't
		take long.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If you even look at a telephone, I'll spread your
		brains all over the wall. I'm robbing the bank.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Robbing the ... oh God.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now just take it easy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh God.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mouth shut. Nice and relaxed. Put all the notes
		into this bag.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't kill me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Just do it, alright?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, yes. All the notes ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's it. Nice and easy.
		
	Hugh nervously takes out all the cash, then suddenly 
	stops.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh oh. Wait a minute.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I don't believe it. I don't believe it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Come on, I haven't got all day.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Who put you up to this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Put me up ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It was Carol, wasn't it? I knew it! She's crazy,
		Tscch! Where's the camera then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What are you talking about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're that Jeremy Beadle, aren't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What!?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I didn't recognise you at first. I'll kill her! She's a
		right minx. Oh I feel such an idiot!
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Listen, you twerp, put all the money ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I must say this is brilliant. You people are so
		clever. So when's it going to be on the television?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Look, I am not Jeremy bleeding Beadle! Now put
		the notes in the bag.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	'Course you'll have to bleep that out, won't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Jeremy bleeding Beadle. You can't really say
		Jeremy bleeding Beadle on family television.
		Unless of course "Bleeding" is actually your
		middle name.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Look, I am not Jeremy Beadle. I don't look
		anything like Jeremy Beadle.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well not with that mask on, obviously.
		
	Stephen removes the mask.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Satisfied?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's brilliant.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've got a false head on, have you? That's
		incredible.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If you don't fill that bag and pass it over in ten
		seconds, I'll kill you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I can't wait to see this.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	One, two ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Actually, to tell the truth, I used to prefer "Candid
		Camera" ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Five, six ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You just stole their idea, really, didn't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nine ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I just wish I'd put that other shirt on this
		morning. Still ...
		
	Stephen fires into Hugh's chest. Lots of blood.

		(Dying) You will send me a tape, won't you?
	
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And if you don't like the shape
		you can scoop it out with
		your finger.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Stephen is sitting behind, yes, a desk. On the desk 
	there is what appears to be an architect's model of 
	a fairly pleasing housing estate. Nicely done, trees, a 
	stream, model people walking dogs and so on. Hugh is 
	explaining it."}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And basically I think ... or what I hope I've
		managed to achieve with this design is a new
		direction. The emphasis is very much on the
		quality of people's day to day lives. I know it
		doesn't correspond exactly to the initial brief, but
		I hope you'll agree it has qualities that really set
		it apart from any other contemporary design. Hah.
		That's it really. I'm very excited about it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So what do you think?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ahem. Mr Braganza ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Please be honest.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I will. I will. But first of all can I ask you why you
		chose to depart from the ... er ... shall we say
		traditional ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You mean the old shoe box approach.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The strict, rectangular lines ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right. Shoe box.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well to be honest, Mr Catchpole, that style is out,
		it's dead. Brutalism, modernism, post-modernism,
		all those isms are finished with. We've got to look
		at people's lives.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, quite. The thing is, when we asked for a shoe
		box, we did actually mean a box for putting shoes
		in. We are a shoe manufacturer, you see. And we
		really do need to put our shoes in a box.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I know that. I know that. But by carrying on
		with the same old rectangular prisons, you're only
		stifling the human spirit. I'm trying to free the
		human spirit.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well that's ... that's fine. But you see, I'm left
		with the problem of where to put our shoes. I
		need a box to put our shoes in, you see? I need a
		shoe box.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Need? Who are we to say what's needed, in the
		sense of some fancy design idea that's going to
		blight the lives of generations to come?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't think our shoe boxes have blighted any
		generations.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I wouuldn't be too sure about that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nick. Let me put it this way. To me, a shoe box is
		just a machine for keeping shoes in.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh yes? And to hell with human spirit, that's
		what you're saying.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I know what it is. It's the cost, isn't it? You're
		frightened of how much it's going to cost.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, I'm frightened of where I'm going to put
		our shoes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well forget money. Because there are some things
		that can't be calculated to the last penny. I'm
		talking about human lives.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, you see, I'm talking about shoes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh shoes, shoes. Is that all you think about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	When I'm at work, yes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well then I feel sorry for you. In fact, I pity you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But I'll do you a shoebox, if that's what you want.
		I don't know how I'll live with myself, but if that's
		what you want, I'll do you a nice, safe, ordinary,
		rectangular shoebox.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you.
		Hugh picks up the model.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'll take this away, then.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No no. Leave it here. I think we can find a
		use for it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Some of our workers might want to live in it.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Slapping himself rather hard 
		on the face and looking mad)
		I was beaten as a child
		and it didn't do me any
		harm.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Hello, it's swivel-chair time again.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Simon Clituris, you saw that. What do you think
		was happening there?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well you see, again this was a rather trite, rather
		predictable - I don't know what the word is I'd
		use to describe it really.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Squib?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	If you like. A sort of cod spoof guying take-off
		pastiche parody.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What did you make of the two central
		performances?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'd have welcomed them.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Laughing at this sally) Right, right. I liked the
		clever and original use of words.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh thank you very much.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not at all. Your clever and original use of words
		has been collected into book form recently, I
		understand.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well received?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, you know what critics are like. What do they
		know about the work we do?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Quite so, Quitely so. Quitely so-ington. But
		to return to that spoof cod squib guying of
		conventions. My main worry was that it told us
		nothing of the relationship between the two central
		characters.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right. Some people may have been mildly
		amused by this kind of grotesquerie, but where
		were the truths about relationships in England
		today, now, this evening, this afternoon?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You certainly couldn't see them from where I
		was lying.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, I hated it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Two out of ten for trying, then.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It just wasn't your cup of tea?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. (Picking up teacup) This is my cup of
		tea, in fact.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Actually, I think you'll find it's mine.
	
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The short one has got a
		different accent, but they both
		smell of Noel Edmonds to
		me.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Some sort of period sitting room. Stephen is fiddling 
	with a clock on the mantelpiece. Hugh enters, agitated.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Thomas! Bad news I'm afraid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Just a moment, John. I promised Marjorie I'd
		mend this clock for her. I wonder if you could give
		me a hand.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Big hand?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Little hand.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Anyway Thomas, listen to me. I have some
		bad news.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bad news?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's Marjorie.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Marjorie?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She's had a fall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Marjorie's had a fall?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm afraid so. She was out riding this morning
		on Thunderbolt, and she hadn't returned by the
		time Mrs Mempwaster arrived. It turns out she'd
		had a fall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Calm yourself John. Marjorie has had a fall?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Off a horse?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well of course off a horse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I don't see that there's any "of course" about it,
		John. Girls nowadays are likely to fall off anything.
		Doesn't have to be a horse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, alright. But in this case it was.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	She could have fallen off a chair, a table, a
		pianoforte, anything.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, except that, in this case, she was riding a
		horse when it happened.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	When she fell off?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, you reasoned to yourself, Marjorie has fallen
		from a horse?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Thunderbolt.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thunderbolt, you say?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, Thunderbolt's a horse, alright.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Exactly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Any damage?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Too soon to say. Cavendish is examining her now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That old fool. What does he know about horses?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Cavendish is examining Marjorie.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Marjorie? Is she ill?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. She fell off a horse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Fell off a horse? Then you'd better fetch
		Cavendish.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I have, Thomas. He's in the drawing room.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Horses are very big, John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know they are, Thomas.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You fall off one of them, and anything can happen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Quite.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Pause) Well not "anything".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. Not "anything".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I mean this clock isn't going to become Prime
		Minister, just because someone has fallen off a
		horse. I didn't mean "anything" is that sense.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course not, Thomas. Anyway Cavendish is
		examining her now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You said he was in the drawing room.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	He is. Examining Marjorie.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And where is she?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She's also in the drawing room.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hah. So they're both in the drawing room?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Perhaps I was wrong. Perhaps he's not such a fool
		after all. How is she?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Too soon to say. Sounds like a hell of a fall.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	From the horse?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thunderbolt?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now what the devil is Marjorie doing, falling off
		Thunderbolt?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You know how Marjorie loves to ride, Thomas.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	She was riding Thomas?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No no.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm Thomas, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	She wasn't riding me. Your story's a bit twisted
		there, old fellow. Doesn't add up. You said she
		was riding Thunderbolt.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	She was.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	She was?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But she's not any longer?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. She fell off.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good God.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Where is she?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	In the drawing room.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	She was riding Thunderbolt in the drawing room?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. She fell off at Stratton Brook, where the path
		seperates. That young fellow Cottrell found her
		and carried her to the drawing room.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Stables would have been better, don't you think?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Drawing room's no place for Thunderbolt.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Marjorie.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What d'you mean?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Marjorie's in the drawing room.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	With Thunderbolt?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No. Thunderbolt's in the stables.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh. Well that's alright, then.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's not alright, Thomas. She's had a bad fall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is she hurt?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Too soon to say. Cavendish is with her now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Cavendish? He's a doctor, isn't he?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I wonder if he knows anything about clocks.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I started on the piano and
		then moved up onto the
		mantelpiece.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Stephen is interviewing Hugh, who is a croaky-voiced 
	Richard Harris, stroke Peter O'Toole stroke Oliver 
	Reed stroke my thigh sort of wildman actor.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Did you actually know Burton personally?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yes. Well, in as much as anyone really "knew"
		Burton. Oh yes, I was very fond of "the Burt". He
		was such a character, you see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And of course Elizabeth Taylor ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well now Liz was a joy, a dream, a treasure. If you
		could have seen them together ....
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Did you ever ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yes. Many times. In fact I was best man at
		their wedding.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Which one?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All of them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now Gielgud and Richardson. You must have ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	They never married of course.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, but you knew them?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh good Lord yes. Real characters. "The
		Giel" and "the Rich" used to ask me for advice,
		constantly. They used to call me their "guru".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now around that time, you must have met ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just about everyone, really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good heavens.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yes. I knew everyone, and everyone knew me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's extraordinary.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I really was very lucky.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mmm. What did you think of Simon Condywust?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Simon ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Condywust. Didn't you know him?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yes, I knew him. Yes, everyone knew "the
		Condy". Yes. Amazing character, he really was.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. What about Margaret Limpwippydippydodo?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mm. Now, Margaret was fascinating. I was
		fascinated by her for many, many years.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Was she an amazing character?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. She was a woman. The men were characters.
		Margaret was fascinating.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. Colin FenchmoseythinkIhave?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What a character.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fenella Hahahahahaspuit?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fascinating woman.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Peter Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Now there was a character. They broke the mould
		after they made Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Angela BrokethemouldaftertheymadePeter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Delightful woman.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Cliff Richard?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've just made that up.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen and Deborah are having dinner in a 
	restaurant.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	He gets all misty-eyed and he puffs himself up
		and says - "I do it for country" ... and he
		stabs himself in the head with a pair of scissors.
		So the Irishman says ...
		
	Hugh enters as a waiter, pushing a trolley.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Are you ready for your main courses now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes I think so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Yes please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Excellent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Can I ask you something?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Certainly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How do you do it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Do what, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	How can you hear from the other side of the
		restaurant the exact moment I get to the punchline
		of a joke? You've done it four times since we
		arrived.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Good question, sir. There's actually a tiny
		microphone hidden underneath the ashtray.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And we have a receiver in the kitchen, so you
		know ... It's very simple really.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. I just wondered.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The lamb?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Yes please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Very good madam.
		
	Hugh puts a plate of lamb in front of her.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Where was I? The Englishman ... er ... oh
		hell ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(While giving her vegetables) The Englishman said
		"I do it for the Queen" and jumped out of the
		window ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That's right, yes. Then the Scotsman said "I do it
		for my country" and er -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Stabbed himself in the head with the pair of ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	... scissors, that's right. So the Irishman said ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And you're having the chicken, sir?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tsscch. What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Chicken Lacroix. Prepared at your table.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, thanks very much. The Irishman ...
		
	Hugh removes the lid of some hugh graillon, to reveal a 
	live chicken, preferably clucking.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Oh my God!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What!?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Chicken Lacroix.
		
	Hugh starts to sharpen a knife.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What are you doing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What am I doing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir, I have to make sure the knife is properly
		sharp.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I mean this chicken ... it's alive!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ha. Not for much longer, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	I think I'm going to be sick.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. Something wrong with the lamb, madam?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're not going to kill a chicken in here?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Certainly. This, sir, is Chicken Lacroix. As you
		ordered. "Fresh, plump, baby chicken, prepared at
		your table."
		
	Hugh lifts the knife.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Wait! Don't ... don't kill it!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't kill it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You'd rather eat it while it's alive?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well then ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Stop it! I'm telling you - don't kill that chicken.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Is there a problem, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes there is. You cannot kill that chicken.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Why not, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ... you know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	All the letters we'll get. It's not worth it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Letters?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Who from?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh I don't know. Mad people.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What mad people?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mad people. "Why oh why oh why oh why was
		my six-year-old grandmother forced to watch a
		chicken being hacked to death in the name of
		so-called entertainment?" That kind of thing.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's no worse than being hacked to death in
		the name of so-called lunch.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I know that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	It is, actually.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	I think it is worse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh do you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes well that's fair enough.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Is it? Well let's ask the chicken, shall we? Would
		you rather die as part of a sketch on national
		television, or would you prefer just to go straight
		into a Tesco sandwich, unmourned and unnoticed?
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	That's just how I feel. I'm sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What's the matter with you? It's had a great time.
		We showed it the "Blue Peter" studio, didn't we?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Actually, I'd be happier if you didn't kill it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'd be happier if you didn't kill the chicken.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Happier? What's happiness got to do with it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	To be honest, I never really liked the idea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	"Never really liked"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	I'm not crazy about it either.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh well obviously if everyone's just going to
		go squeamish at the last minute, we'll have to
		call it off.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	On second thoughts, I'll just have a green salad.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A green salad?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Very good, sir.
		
	Hugh takes the chicken trolley and exits.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think that was the right decision.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	So do I.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Anyway, so the Irishman says ...
		
	Stephen is interrupted by violent terrifying screams.
		
		Now what are you doing?
		
	Hugh enters with a plate of salad.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Never heard a lettuce scream before? Frightening
		isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You never knew, did you? You thought lettuces just
		came in little sterilised polythene bags, and grew
		on supermarket shelves. Never occurred to you
		that a lettuce might have feelings, hopes, dreams, a
		family ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bugger the lettuce! Will you let me finish
		my joke!?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I'm sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The Irishman says ...
		
	Cut to whatever.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I like the way it starts.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	An old people's home. Mr Simnock's room. Bed,
	sofa, etc."}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Attendant) Alright, Mr Simnock?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Very, very old northerner) Eh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I say, are you alright, Mr Simnock?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Smimble cocoa.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, you can have your cocoa in a minute. I'll
		draw the curtains shall I?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Eh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I say, I'll draw the curtains - be a bit cosier. More
		cosy for you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Draw the curtains, cosy that. Cocoa.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, your cocoa's coming, Mr Simnock.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Curtains.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Drawing them) There, that's better. Nights are
		drawing in now, aren't they, Mr Simnock? Getting
		more chilly by the day. I don't know, time just
		races by doesn't it? Seems like it was only
		yesterday that it was Christmas. Oh no, what's
		this? You've dropped your magazines.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Didn't like them. Rubbish they were.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'll pick them up for you - let's see, what have we
		got here.
		
	As Stephen bends down to pick up the magazines,
	Hugh cuffs him a mighty blow on the ear.
		
		Ooh, there now. That wasn't very nice was it?
		Hitting me like that. What d'you want to go and
		do that for?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Want me cocoa.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Your cocoa's coming - though I'm not so sure
		as you deserve it, really acting up today like I
		shouldn't wonder. Whatever next? You're a bad
		man, Mr Simnock. I'll tuck you up, look.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ninety-two years old.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right, ninety-two isn't it? Ninety-three come
		November.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ninety-two years old and I've never had oral sex.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I should think not indeed. Oral sex! The idea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Never ridden a camel.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now you're just babbling, Mr Simnock.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've never watched a woman urinate.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I shall get cross with you in a minute, I
		shall really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Never killed a man.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now Mr Simnock, there's a certain man that I
		shall start killing if he's not very careful, thank you
		very much.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Never been inside an opera house. Never eaten a
		hamburger.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're a stupid silly old man and I won't have any
		nonsense.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm fed up, me. Never done anything.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, you're a bit chilly I shouldn't wonder. Your
		cocoa'll be along in a minute.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't want any stupid cocoa.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now don't be contrary - you love your cocoa.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I hate cocoa. Gets a skin on it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not if you keep stirring it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Makes me kek that, makes we want to cat up. I
		want to drink milk from the breasts of a Burmese
		maiden.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know. What's the matter with you
		today, Mr Simnock? I think we'll have to put
		you on extra Vitamin E. Burmese maidens! In
		Todmorden.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've got bad breath you have.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now. Now, Mr Simnock, there's no call to be
		personal, I hope.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Like rotting cabbages.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm very angry with you, Mr Simnock.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're a great Nancy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm not a great Nancy, Mr Simnock, and you're
		wicked to say so.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Great Nancy, Mary-Ann, bum-boy Nance. I bet
		you've never even done it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I won't have you talking like this Mr Simnock, I
		won't really.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You shouldn't be in a place like this, your
		time of life.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Someone's got to do it, Mr Simnock. Dedication,
		though why I bother -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You should be out there having oral sex, killing
		people, watching women urinate in opera houses
		and eating hamburgers on camels. Drinking milk
		from the breasts of Nepalese maidens.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It was Burmese last time.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've changed my mind. Nepalese. Instead you're
		stuck here taking rude talk from an old man.
		You're a Nancy, a great bog-breath Nancy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ooh, you've really upset me today, Mr Simnock, you
		have really. I'm going out to hurry along your
		cocoa and when I get back I don't want any more
		nonsense. Honestly!

			Exit Stephen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Calling after him) You're a screaming Bertie
		and you pong. (To himself) Never seen a woman
		urinate, not once. Tragic waste, that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Re-entering) Now, I managed to intercept Mrs
		Gideon with the tray in the vestibule. So here's
		your cocoa, and don't say you aren't a lucky man
		to get it before the others.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hooray!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	There, that's the stuff isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Cocoa.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. A certain naughty boy said some naughty
		things though, didn't he?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry Brian. Right sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well there. As soon as you see your cocoa you
		mend your manners. I'm not sure I should give it
		to you, now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh please, Brian.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	There you are then. That's better, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Lovely drop of cocoa, that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Berent's: that's the best.
		
	Stephen smiles at the camera.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Advert-style voice-over', 'text': "
	
		Good old Berent's cocoa. Always there. Original
		or New Berent's, specially prepared for the mature
		citizens in your life, with nature's added store of
		powerful barbiturates and heroin.
		
	Hugh collapses with a grin on his face.
	
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Betty had a bit of bitter
		butter and put it in her
		batter and made her batter
		bitter.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen and Hugh are in a black limbo area. Hugh is 
	on a monitor, Stephen is really there.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm afraid that we've now got to ask you to
		do some work, and help us a bit, ladies and
		gentlemen. Use your imagination, as it were.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. For the purposes of this next sketch,
		ladies and gentlemen, we want you all to imagine
		that we're both naked.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. I'm sorry to have to ask this of you. Speaking
		for ourselves, Hugh and I really wanted to go the
		whole way, and actually be naked for this one but,
		unfortunately, we ran out of money.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. The budget simply wouldn't stretch
		that far, I'm afraid. Never mind.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now to help you build up the picture in your
		minds, I should tell you that the sketch is set in a
		church.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Stephen will be playing a Bishop.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And Hugh will be playing the organ.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The organist.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'll be playing the organist.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The organist. Yes. But you'll be playing the organ
		as well?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No. No. That's the whole point. I play an organist
		who can't play the organ.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh God I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Of course. Have I
		ruined it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, frankly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm sorry, ladies and gentlemen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You'd better all stop imagining that we're naked.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes stop. Hold it. It's all my fault. I'm sorry.
		Damn.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A men enters a bar. It was an
		iron bar. No, goes into a bar.
		Walks into a bar, that's it. A
		man walks into a pub, it was an
		iron pub. Henry Cooper used
		to do that one. Tommy. Tommy
		Bar used to walk into that one.
		Oh no, that can't be right.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen addresses Mr and Mrs Audience.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ladies and gentlemen, I think we've got to know
		each other well enough over the weeks now, for
		me to make a little confession. I don't want you
		to be embarrassed by this. I'm not, and it is I
		whose breast is being cleaned, not yours. The fact
		is, I'm not quite as I seem. You see before you
		what I have been kind enough to call a rather
		lovely figure of a super and that's by and breastly
		as it should be. However, and this is where I'm
		going to have to ask you to be excitingly pretty,
		I do have a peculiarity which I feel I must in all
		softness be rather heavenly about just for a divine.
		Like an increasing number of people today, I have
		a pair of nipples attached to my chest, here and
		to a lesser extent here, but, and this is where
		I'm forced to be a little bit more delicious than
		usual, while this one here, Neville, is rosy and
		healthy and everything one could want, this one
		Sheila is bright blue and something of a young
		disappointment. Well there, in a smooth-limbed
		golden-thighed way, we are. You've been patient,
		you've been glossy, you've been surprisingly supple.
		I've enjoyed being fabulous with you. Thank you.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen and Hugh are in a TV studio, talking 
	animatedly - at least Stephen is animated.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, let's talk about instead about flexibility of
		language - linguistic elasticity if you like.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think I said earlier that our language, English -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	As spoken by us -
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	As we speak it, yes certainly, defines us. We are
		defined by our language if you will, then please,
		for goodness' sake, do.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(To camera) Hullo! We're talking about language.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Perhaps I can illustrate my point - let me at
		least try. Here's a question: is our language
		capable, English this is, is it capable of sustaining
		demagoguery?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Demagoguery?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Demagoguery.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And by demagoguery you mean ...?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I mean demagoguery, I mean highly-charged
		oratory, persuasive whipping up rhetoric. Listen to
		me, if Hitler had been English would we, under
		similar circumstances have been moved, charged
		up, fired by his inflammatory speeches, or should
		we have laughed? Er, er, er, is English too ironic
		a language to support Hitlerian styles, would his
		language simply have, have rung false in our ears?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(To camera) We're talking about things ringing false
		in our ears.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alright, alright, do you mind if I compartmentalise?
		I hate to, but may I? May I? Is our language
		a function of our British cynicism, tolerance,
		resistance to false emotion, humour and so on, or
		do those qualities come extrinsically - extrinsically,
		from the language itself? It's a chicken and egg
		problem.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(To camera) We're talking about chickens, we're
		talking about eggs.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Let me start a leveret here: there's language, the
		grammar, the structure - then there's utterance.
		Listen to me, listen to me, there's chess and
		there's a game of chess. Mark the difference, mark
		it for me please.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(To camera) We've moved on to chess.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Imagine a piano keyboard, eighty-eight keys,
		only eighty-eight and yet, and yet, new tunes,
		melodies, harmonies are being composed upon
		hundreds of keyboards every day in Dorset alone.
		Our language, Tiger, our language, hundreds
		of thousands of available words, frillions of
		possible legitimate new ideas, so that I can
		say this sentence and be confident it has never
		been uttered before in the history of human
		communication: "Hold the newsreader's nose
		squarely, waiter, or friendly milk will countermand
		my trousers." One sentence, common words, but
		never before placed in that order. And yet, oh
		and yet, all of us spend our days saying the same
		things to each other, time after weary time, living
		by clichaic, learned response: "I love you", "Don't
		go in there", "You have no right to say that", "shut
		up", "I'm hungry", "that hurt", "why should I?", "it's
		not my fault", "help", "Marjorie is dead". You see?
		That surely is a thought to take out for a cream
		tea on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
		Hugh looks at camera, opens mouth as if to speak, decides against it. Speaks to Stephen instead.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So to you language is more than just a means of
		communication?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Er, of course it is, of course it is, of course it is.
		Language is a whore, a mistress, a wife, a pen-
		friend, a check-out girl, a complimentary moist
		lemon-scented cleansing square or handy freshen-
		up wipette. Language is the breath of God, the
		dew on a fresh apple, it's the soft rain of dust
		that falls into a shaft of morning sun when you
		pull from an old bookshelf a forgotten volume of
		erotic diaries; language is the faint scent of urine
		on a pair of boxer shorts, it's a half-remembered
		childhood birthday party, a creak on the stair, a
		spluttering match held to a frosted pane, the warm
		wet, trusting touch of a leaking nappy, the hulk
		of a charred Panzer, the underside of a granite
		boulder, the first downy growth on the upper lip of
		a Mediterranean girl, cobwebs long since overrun
		by an old Wellington boot.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ner-night.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
		Then Betty took a bit of better
		butter and put it in her bitter
		batter and made her bitter
		batter better. Something like
		that. It was before the next war
		of course.
	'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is at a desk, reciting.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	"Crate, a normil nighman
		Hane a freethy stipe
		You veen where musse is Simon
		Critch botty trees a wipe."
		
		I first wrote the poem from which that verse was
		an extract when my dear wife Enemy died. I wrote
		it again in 1978 after hearing of the death of rock
		music. I'd like with your kind indulgence to write
		it once more. Thank you.
