'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen sits and writes.'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Farmhouse kitchen set. Like a Tyne Tees TV late night 
	religious discussion set. Stephen intrudes on Hugh who 
	is busy reading a book. They are both foully nice.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who told you that you were naked?
		
	Hugh puts the book down and looks smilingly up at 
	Stephen.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I was thinking "who told you that you were naked"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You may have lost me there, Arnold.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, let me explain. I was thinking of that passage
		in the book of Genesis where Adam explains to
		God why he and Eve have covered themselves.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah yes. If I remember that story alright, Adam
		says, "we were naked and we were ashamed".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right, Glenn. And God says ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	"Who told you that you were naked?"
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(As if catching sight of the camera for the first time,
		speaking directly into it) We were just having a
		conversation, Glenn and I, about a passage in
		Genesis that has been intriguing me rather.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It is fascinating isn't it? But anyway, tell me about
		the size of your girlfriend's breasts.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, let's clear up this problem of why God
		should give such a complex reply to what is, on
		the surface, a very simple question.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not as simple a question, in many way, as for
		instance: "are they very big, or only quite big?"
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, fair point. But while not that simple, still
		relatively simple.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That's right, Arnold: simpler certainly than "is she
		very exciting in bed?"
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ng. I think God was saying, "How are you aware,
		Adam, of such a thing as a "state of nakedness"?
		How can that concept mean anything to you,
		unless you have eaten of the fruit whereof I said
		thou shouldst not eat?"
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	My bet is that they are really quite substantially
		large. A fulsome pair of funbags, that's my bet.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	One thing at a time Glenn.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're right. One thing at a time. Let's take the
		left one first shall we? How enormous would you
		say that it is?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Laughing) Ha, ha! Glenn is having difficulty
		concentrating on our Bible Study readings because
		he has something of an obsession with the size of
		my girlfriend's breasts.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Also laughing) I like to put it this way. Arnold
		is having trouble concentrating on our little
		discussions about the size of his girlfriend's
		bazoncas because he is a little too interested in
		analysing passages from the Bible.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We'll sort it out, don't you worry!!
		
	They both turn to each other talking again,
	simultaneously.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Say a forty-eight cup, or bigger still?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A knowledge of good and evil, that is what the
		fruit contained, when Eve took it from the serpent
		... etc.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen and Hugh are somewhere.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Violence: it's a theme we've touched on before
		now in this fortnightly look back on the past three
		days, and I dare say it's one we'll touch on again,
		and we don't apologise for that. Violence is not
		something that is going to lie down and go away.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well put. I suppose Responsibility Television is the
		phrase that best sums up our approach.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What does Responsibility Television mean? Well
		it means that we are immensely concerned that
		nothing we do has a bad influence on our viewers.
		Thus when I hit Hugh, like so:
		
	Stephen hits Hugh.
		
		We have to consider what the effect on the viewer
		might be.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Is a vulnerable, easily-led section of our audience
		going to start imitating this kind of behaviour?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well so far in this series I have hit Hugh on no
		less than a startling seven occasions. You might
		think we had no thought at all as to how the young
		might be influenced by this kind of senseless,
		horrific violence. Would they start to imitate
		it? Hugh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well the interesting and inescapable conclusion
		that we've come up with is yes. Because since the
		series has started to be transmitted I have found,
		walking along the street that I have been hit no
		less than twelve times by complete strangers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So it looks as if the suggestible out there are
		actually imitating my violent behaviour patterns
		and striking you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is that a worrying development?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's not unworrying.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So it might be that the Milton Schulmans of this
		world aren't as incredibly stupid as the appear
		at first, second and thirty-fourth glance. We
		are unwittingly helping to make Britain a more
		violent place.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's beginning to look horribly like it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, let's see if we can't reverse this process. I'm
		going to give you a fiver now Hugh.
		
	Stephen does so.
		
		Would all those stupid enough to be influenced by
		my violent behaviour who are likely to go out onto
		the street and hit Hugh please watch very carefully
		as I now smile at Hugh, hand him another five
		pounds and say "There you are old chap, there's a
		fiver for you. Have a really super time. Oh, look
		here's another one. And another. There you go,
		bless you."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well thank you very much indeed if you don't
		mind me saying so.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I certainly don't mind you saying so, in fact it's
		very kind of you. Here's a fiver.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, thank you I'm sure.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good. Well, I hope you're going to monitor the
		public's behaviour very closely Hugh, and if you
		find people approaching with five pound notes,
		you'll come back on the programme and let
		us know?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I certainly will.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Alright then. Just time now to go over to Devizes
		and catch up with Chris and that giant sauna.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They've got hotter pavements, I
		know that.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	How many times have you walked out in front
		of a bus, been knocked down and killed? Pretty
		frustrating, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, now there's a solution to that problem. A
		company down in Truro in Cornwall have started
		producing these lightweight travelling hats, which
		can be folded very tightly indeed, but when
		unpacked can be thrown away almost immediately.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Which hopefully should eliminate that bus problem
		at a stroke.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That one with Trevor Howard
		in it. And Celia Johnson.
		That one. With a drop of
		mayonnaise.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	A park bench, in a television studio somewhere in 
	Shepherd's Bush's famous London. Hugh approaches 
	Stephen, who is sitting and feeding ducks from a brown 
	paper bag."}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My cheque book is sometimes yellow.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yellow is the colour of some people's front
		porches.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Slipping down next to Stephen) Hello Control.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello Murchison. Sorry to ask you to go through
		that coded exchange.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, it seemed rather odd, because we know each
		other quite well, don't we?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's a true thing to say, Tony, but the fact is we
		can't be too careful at the moment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Did you think perhaps that I might be a KGB
		man with a false head on?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I hadn't entirely ruled it out.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mm. I expect you're wondering why we couldn't
		meet in my office, Tony.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Not really, it's being redecorated, isn't it? I had a
		little peek through the door this morning when I
		was passing. I think I caught a glimpse of some
		rather attractive rolls of wallpaper. A sort of silvery
		stripe, with a textured bit.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. The cornice and moulding are going to be
		picked out in maroon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That sounds very adventurous.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mm. I find that makes a room look bigger. Well
		I've got to put my serious hat on now. Are you
		familiar with the term "mole"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Surely a mole is an enemy agent planted deep
		within an organisation, such as ours, who pretends
		to be on one side but is really on the other all
		the time?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. They are beastly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, very.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, for some time, Murchison, the Minister
		and I have been ever so slightly anxious about
		the possibility of there being just such a "mole"
		working inside our department.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh lor.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. That's why I thought it would be more secure
		if we met here, not in my office.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's a smart and professional piece of thinking,
		Control.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's no good trying to be all private and secret
		if there's a mole listening to you all the time,
		probably laughing up his sleeve at you. If moles
		have sleeves.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So a mole, with or without sleeves. Fff. In our
		department? That makes my blood boil.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mine too. It really is beginning to look like it.
		The Minister and I have decided to call the mole
		"Duncan" by the way.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh. Well I'm afraid that your theory about there
		being a mole may be wrong then, Control.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm busy wondering why that should be, Tony?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, we haven't got anyone called Duncan
		working in the department. I could ask the
		computer to give information on people called
		Duncan until the cows come home, but it is such
		a quite common name. Especially in Scotland,
		I think.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I may not have explained myself too well,
		Murchison. Duncan is just his code-name for the
		time being.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What a devious business we're in, Control.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, I often think that it's a pity that we have to lie
		and conceal the truth so much. It leaves a not very
		pleasant taste in the mouth sometimes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hear, hear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I have to say that I don't envy the mole, though.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, quite. I have to say that as well, Control.
		Because a mole has extra helpings of lying and
		concealing the truth to do.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. We've got quite enough on our plate just
		working for one country, haven't we, Tony?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We jolly well have.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If I had to do all my work twice I should get pretty
		fagged out. I shouldn't have a moment to call
		my own.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Nor me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bother him. Bother Duncan. Bother the Minister.
		Bother the whole damned lot of them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes. Mind you, it's given us an opportunity to get
		out into the fresh air for a change.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's true. And I expect the ducks will be
		pleased.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They'd be jolly ungrateful if they weren't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I've got to have a small talk with the Minister
		now. Can I leave you to finish off feeding them?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Certainly Control, leave the bag with me. You put
		the ducks out of your mind.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thanks Tony. Have done.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	B-bye, Control.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	B-bye, Murchison.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sometimes I think they
		ought to build a ring road
		round the ring road. Ha ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '(Laughs hysterically almost forever)'}]

[{'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, Hugh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, Stephen.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Here we are again.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	More or less.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	More or less?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Last time, if you remember, we were between
		MAPS and BIOGRAPHIES on the other
		side, but now they've changed the whole
		bookshop round.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think I prefer it here.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh so do I.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You get a nice view of the till and the fire exit, and
		we're only a short stroll away from the Leisure
		Interest section.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I wouldn't want to go back, certainly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But anyway, Hugh, here we are again, with another
		collection of comedic ensketchments to thrill, tease
		and sexually arouse our reading public.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	More or less.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	More or less, yes. Wasn't it Big Ron Atkinson who
		said "you can sexually arouse some of the people
		all of the time, and all of the people some of the
		time, but if you want to sexually arouse all of the
		people all of the time, you've got your work cut out
		to a certain extent"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Tsk. I'm thinking of Abba.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Not wishing to interrupt or anything of that sort,
		but isn't it about time we rolled up our sleeves and
		got down to the job of introducing the ladies and
		gentlemen to this book?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Haven't they met?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't think so.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm so sorry. I could have sworn they were both at
		the Hendersons' last New Year's Eve.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What a night that was.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, early evening.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. What an early evening that was.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well anyway, ladies and gentlemen, this is the
		book. Book, say hello to the ladies and gentlemen.

		Slight Pause.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	They seem to have hit it off remarkably well.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh, I think it's going swimmingly.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well if you'll excuse me, I think I'll just nip to the
		lavatory.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hugh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We're in the lavatory.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Of course we are. Tsk.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You were thinking of Abba.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Must have been.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hugh, my old china, I've a question for you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Off you go.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Have I gone mad, or were we supposed to use this
		introduction as a way of issuing a warning?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've gone mad.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If I have indeed gone mad, it's the sort of madness
		in which I have moments of achingly lucid sanity.
		Here's one now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Steady. Don't waste it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I seem to remember being given some advice by
		our solicitors.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're quite right. We were advised, by our
		solicitors, to write out a cheque to our solicitors.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Made payable to bearer, if memory serves.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Memory has served an ace in this instance,
		Stephen. We were asked to write out a cheque and
		advised that it was our duty to warn the potential
		purchaser of this book, this book with which they
		are already making such fast friends ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fast, but within the speed limit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Just.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It was our duty, I think I was saying ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... before you were so attractively interrupted.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... to warn the reader that these sketches are for
		external application only.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	On no account are they to be swallowed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Or performed in public without written permission
		from the publishers, unless and until you are the
		only human being left alive on the planet Earth.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Which, in case you're starting to get alarmed,
		is an unlikely set of circumstances, and not one
		you would expect to come across every day of
		the week.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But that's what you pay these legal johnnies for
		- covering angles that the rest of us wouldn't
		think of.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A humbling thought, Hugh. A humbling thought.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Any other duties we have to discharge, before the
		ladies and gentlemen ask this book back to their
		place for a cup of Horlicks and a snog?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Not really, except for heaven's sake make sure
		you've actually got some Horlicks.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh. That can be embarrassing, can't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Always have the wherewithal to back up your story.
		There's nothing worse than an idle boast.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wasn't it the Swedish pop group Abba who said
		"a man who claims to have Horlicks when he
		hasn't, is no man at all - and certainly wouldn't be
		welcome at Sheffield Wednesday"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It was G.K. Chesterton.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	B'bye.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	B'bye.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think they should call it
		industrial inaction, hahaha, if you
		ask me, hahaha.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen and Hugh are pacing the boardroom.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Dammit Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	John?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Dammit four times round the car park and back in
		for another dammit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Do I get the feeling that something's on your
		mind, John?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Come on, Peter, you know what the hell I'm
		talking about.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	At a guess I'd say that this had something to do
		with the DDL Enterprises takeover bid?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You know it's funny, Peter. Four years. Four hard
		years I've put into building up this Health Club.
		And now I'm supposed to stand by and let a bunch
		of wet-arsed college kids take it all away from me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know, John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If only Marjorie hadn't left us the way she did ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Marjorie? Hell John, you can't go blaming yourself
		for that. You and Marjorie had ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Had what, Peter? A marriage that was nothing
		more than a bad joke, and not even a very
		good one?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You made some mistakes, John, that's all. You
		and Marjorie had different ideas about where the
		company was headed. End of story.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But dammit, Marjorie was good, Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A good wife, or a good business partner?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is there a difference, Peter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I hope so, John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And now, while we're up to our arses in a major
		takeover scrap, she's sunning herself in the South
		of France.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	South of Wales actually, John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, wherever the blue-rinsed hell she is. Oh
		what a damned fool I've been.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	John, listen to me, this is no time for you to start
		feeling sorry for yourself.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But dammit all sideways, Peter ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	John. Do something for me. Take a look out of
		this window.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is this, Peter? Some sort of game?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No game, John. Look out there and tell me what
		you see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see a car park.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well that's funny, John. Because the last time you
		looked out of that window, you saw an idea. Don't
		you remember?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. I remember.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I thought so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I remember thinking that that would be the best
		place for the car park.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit John, I'm talking about the big idea.
		The dream that you and I shared. The dream
		of a health club that would put Uttoxeter on the
		goddamned map once and for all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah, well maybe ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Maybe? Maybe? I don't believe I'm hearing this.
		What the hell's happened to the old John?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We pulled it down when we built the car park.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit John, you're not hearing me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Peter I ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't Peter I me! We've got that close. And you're
		going to lie down and just walk away.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Peter, don't hassle me. I'm tired.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Tired be damned!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A man's got to know when he's licked, Peter. And
		I know the feeling. I've been licked before.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The Lord's Saints preserve us.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Did I ever tell you about the time Marjorie licked
		me? Licked me good and proper? Well I've got the
		same feeling now, Peter, and it's sore. Maybe it's
		time to move on.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	John. I'm going to tell you what I see out of this
		window.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is this another of your games, Peter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Same game, John. Different rules. (Looking out) I
		see Tom and Sally and Debbie ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I thought Sally was off with the flu ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Exactly, John! Exactly! But she's come in today
		because she believes in you! God knows why!
		She believes in what you're trying to do here in
		Uttoxeter. And you're going to just turn your back
		on those kids? You're going to walk away from ...
		dammit, I make no apology, a vision?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Dammit Peter, maybe you're right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're damn right maybe I'm right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Damn, double damn, and an extra pint of damn
		for the weekend.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Daaaaamn!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right, Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Damn?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Get a fax over to Cliff at Harlinson's.
		Extraordinary General Meeting, 3.00p.m. today.
		Call Janet, and see if we can pull Martin in from
		... where the hell is Martin?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	High Wycombe.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And get Sarah in here. We've got an agenda to
		work up.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Welcome back to the fight, John. Sorry if I was a
		little rough on you back there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hell, Peter, I deserved it. I was a damned fool.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And if Marjorie calls ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If Marjorie calls ... (Pause) Tell her I'm busy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	DAAAAAAMN!
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Moira Stewart ... and Jill
		Gascoigne ... neither of them
		wrote back. Can you believe these
		people? I mean how much trouble
		can it be to just bung a pair of
		stockings in the post?
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Kensington dinner party set. Candles, tablecloth, fruit,
	epergne etc. At the head of the table, dinner-jacketed,
	is Susan Digby, played by Stephen. Hugh, similarly 
	DJ-ed, plays Jeremy James Duff, a poncy John 
	Julius Norwich type, there is also Leslie Crith of the 
	Independent.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "Camera is on Stephen, who is talking, but studio sound 
	isn't up yet."}, {'speaker': 'Caption', 'text': '
	Susan Digby with dinner guests
		
	Camera pans along the table to Hugh, lips also moving 
	wordlessly.
		Jeremy James Duff, travel-writer, broadcaster and
		journalist.
		
	Pan/track along to Leslie.
		
		Leslie Crith, the Independent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... and similarly louche places. But Jeremy, I must
		tell you. I was in Venice last year.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah, la serenissima!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right. You probably know more than anyone
		else in the world about Venice.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The Queen of the Adriatic.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Is only one of the things you've been called. I was
		walking along the Rialto, returning from a walk
		that took in Santa Maria della Salute and San
		Giorgio Romano ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	Along the Giudecca?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Along the Giudecca, and I think I'm right in
		saying that I counted no less than seventy-nine
		backpackers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	Backpackers, oh dear lord.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... who were "doing", as I believe they say, the
		Accademia.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ugh, ugh, ugh, ugh. Tourists, you see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And I remember thinking, they're taking away our
		Venice.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Our Venice is being taken away from us. It's
		crawling with Germans.
"}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	And Italians.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Our Venice is sinking under their weight, not just
		physically, but the beauty, Jeremy, the grandeur of
		our Venice is sinking under the blue nylon of their
		wind-cheaters, their Coca-Cola cans, their eternal
		flashlight photo-cameras.
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	And that monstrous tinny noise that emanates from
		their Sony Walkmans.
		
	Hugh and Stephen are baffled.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Their ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Erm?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh you mean those personal stereophonic
		discotheques?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Stop it, stop it, stop it at once.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	If only ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ah, yes well now you see, I have campaigned for
		years now to have tourists banned from Venice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Have you? Have you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I have, I have. It sounds very harsh, very cruel,
		very ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Deglante?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Very deglante, thank you. But I'm sure it's the
		only way.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ng, ng, ng, ng.
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	Who was it, who was it, who said "He is a
		tourist, you are a holidaymaker, but I am a
		traveller?"
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, was it Humbert Wolfe?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It was Cocteau, surely?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It doesn't sound very Cocteau.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But then Cocteau never did, which is how you can
		always tell it's Cocteau.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	True, true. Trouche!
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': "
	Of course it's not just Venice is it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's not just Venezia, Venedig, Veneeess, not by a
		very long stroke.
"}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	Our whole world is being stained.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen/Hugh', 'text': '
	Stained, stained.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Eheu fugaces! O tempora, o mores, Jeremy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes indeed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': "
	I blame television. I'm sorry but I do.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Pained at the thought) Ah ... ah, ah, television.
		That fearful Mervyn Bragg.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mervyn Bragg, stop it, don't, shush, now please,
		really. If I had my way with Mervyn Bragg ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No one would be in the least surprised.
		
	Lots of laughter.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	This is most awfully good Tarte Citron.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen/Hugh', 'text': '
	Er ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	Tatre Citron.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh, the lemon pie. Thank you. I always said I could
		never really be friends with someone who didn't
		love lemon pie.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Susan, don't be sly, did you make it yourself?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Let's just say I made it to the shops in time
		to buy it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh/Leslie', 'text': '
	Marks & Spencer?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who else, but M & S?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	M & S!
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': "
	M & S! M et S. They are simply amazing
		aren't they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And have you tried their new boxer shorts?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No I haven't, I haven't, I haven't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	I have. Delicious.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And their dips! Oh bless me, their dips.
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': "
	In my local one there's a really marvellous school.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A primary school?
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': "
	Oh yes. Both mine and my husband's children
		go there.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mine's just opened a hospital section.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Have they? Have they really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes, you can go in and have minor operations,
		everything.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	In the one just round the corner from me they sell
		weaponry.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is that right?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh it is. Quite right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Leslie', 'text': '
	Mine too.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I bought an F1-11 there last week ... so fresh ... I
		swear it was made that day ...
		
	Fading out.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And of course if you're unhappy, you can always go
		back and change it ...
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Holding up plate) See this? You
		could eat your dinner off this.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh and Stephen are two rather doddery old 
	commentators.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	As we look down now, on this glorious July
		afternoon ... what a splendid slight it is, Peter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's an absolute picture, isn't it? The sun beating
		down ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Beautiful day ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The crowds ... not a seat to be had anywhere ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Packed house ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Absolutely packed ... and the grass looking so
		lovely ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Green as anything.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Green as you like. Absolutely as green as
		could be ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Grass has never looked greener ... The
		groundsman Arthur ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Alan.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is it? Alan Dixon. Alan Dixon has done a
		marvellous job ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Marvellous job, he really has. What a scene.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Marvellous scene ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I say there's a bus.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, look there's a beautiful old English ... what
		is that? Number 29?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's a 29 bus, yes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A beautiful English 29 bus, yes, what a marvellous
		scene. Grass, sun, bus, marvellous.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, that bus making its way now along the
		Garboldisham road.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Garboldisham, beautiful village that is ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Absolutely delightful village ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Garboldisham. What a lovely name.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Lovely name. Lovely English name.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello, there are some people getting off the
		bus ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Look out ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	They're off the enjoy their good old English
		strawberries and cream ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, English, yes, watch out for those German
		strawberries ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not the same ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not the same thing at all ... English strawberries
		and cream ... 29 bus going down the
		Garboldisham road ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Grass ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Cream ...
		
	They begin to gather momentum in some sort of 
	unpleasant sexual exchange of fruity things.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Garboldisham ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Crowds ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The South Downs ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Malvern hills rolling like a ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Motor cars ... leather gloves ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	A quarter pound of Mrs Faversham's extra strong
		peppermints ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ovaltine ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wellington boots ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Cream ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Heaps of cream ... cream and lawnmowers ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Summer holidays in Cromer ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Vaulting over a stile in a country lane ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Catching sticklebacks in an old tin can ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	"Honestly nanny, I never touched then ..."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Piano lessons with Mrs Duckworth ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Father's hands on the steering wheel ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sit up straight!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Going faster and faster ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Locked in the cupboard for being rude to
		Mrs Howlett ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Take the Wolseley for a run ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	England ... Elgar ... Malvern Hills.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Bath Olivers. Play the game ... elbows off
		the table.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Who's a brave soldier then? Nanny's hands all
		steamy and starched.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	England! England and cream ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Custard cream ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Strawberries and cream ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Strawberries and English cream ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Take the B road to Petersfield. England.
		
	(Shouting now)
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Creamy England!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	England!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Cream!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The roast cream of old England.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh I say.
		
	A post-coital interlude.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And here comes Nigel Lawson now ...
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A challenge for her? Yes I've got
		a challenge for her. Why doesn't
		she see if she can bleeding well
		BLEEP herself. For charity
		obviously.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My first kiss. I suppose everyone can remember
		their first kiss. Nothing quite lives up to it, does
		it? I was eleven years old I remember and my great
		uncle had come to stay for a few weeks on parole.
		We used to play a game where I would sit on his
		lap and he would pretend to be a train. Then one
		day ...
		
	Stephen comes on.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hugh, Hugh, what are you saying?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I was telling the ladies and gentlemen about my
		first kiss.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, but Hugh, this is a delicate area, I really
		don't think -
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We agreed that "A Bit Of Fry & Laurie" was
		going to be an arena for the expression of all kinds
		of ideas and experiences that wouldn't normally
		find their way on to television, didn't we?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We did, we did agree.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So my surprise at feeling a tongue suddenly ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hugh, there are valid arenas and valid arenas. This
		is not one of them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But I want that experience to be understood, it
		may help others to know that they're not the first
		to feel that wet ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hugh. Believe me this is a whole can of worms
		you're opening here, and if there is one single
		taboo left, one unmentionable subject not fit for
		comic treatment, you've just mentioned it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But surely there's nothing so very odd about
		it. There I was, on my great-uncle's lap and in
		came Lucy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Lucy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, Lucy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And how old was Lucy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, twelve I think. And I kissed her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You kissed her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You've done this deliberately, haven't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Done what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You set it up to make it sound as if -
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	As is what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Never mind. Get on with it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All right. So I kissed Lucy, and was very surprised
		to feel her tongue pop out. It was my first real
		snog and I loved it. You can imagine that I fell in
		love instantly. Sadly the next year Lucy developed
		distemper and had to be put down.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Doh.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(As woman) Well, I was born
		Mary Patterson, but then I
		married and naturally took my
		husband's name, so now I'm Neil
		Patterson.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Five people around a table: flimsies, photographs,
	graphics etc. The people are Stephen, a copy-writer,
	Hugh a ditto, Fee, an imponderably stupid graphic 
	artist, Rhiannon an agressive producer, and Dick,
	another copy-writer.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Standing and stretching) All right. Before we crack
		off on this new campaign, I'd like you all to get
		to know each other. Rhiannon, you must all know,
		worked on that draught-excluder commercial, the
		one with the young guy in the American leather
		jacket, driving around in an old pink Cadillac.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Hi, everyone.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hiya. That was a great television commercial.
		Made me weep.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Thanks.
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	That was really beautiful work actually. Because
		I saw it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fee of course was the power behind that brilliant
		campaign for Total Protein Concept Balance
		System shampoo, the one with ... how did it
		go? It had a guy in an American leather jacket,
		driving round in a ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	... an old pink Cadillac. Hi.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	That was bitchingly good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	World class, world class.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Jake, obviously, came up with the commercial
		for Dong Jeans, which had a guy in an American
		leather jacket driving round in a ... what was
		it, Jake?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It was an old blue Cadillac.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Incredible.
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	Genius.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I hardly need say that Jake's ideas tend to be a
		little bit off the wall.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah, I'm crazy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And joining us from an out of town agency is
		Dick. Dick's just come from working on that
		fabulous commercial for "Pretension" by Calvin
		Klein ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': "
	Er ... no ... that wasn't me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh ... they've sent us another Dick, have
		they? Well what was the last thing you worked
		on, Dick?
"}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': "
	I wrote an advertisement for Tideyman's Carpets.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	It had a picture of lots of carpets, and a voice said
		"Tideyman's Carpets, sale now on".
		Slightly embarrassed silence.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Great stuff.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, fantastic.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So we have a team here with one hell of a proven
		track record. Drinks anyone?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Jack Daniels.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Jack Daniels suits me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bourbons for everyone then, yeah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	A Fanta for me, please.
		
	Stephen is at the fridge.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	OK. Floor's yours, Jake.
		
	Hugh rises; he's a gum-chewing cockney whizz.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What we've got here, people, is a big campaign
		for a new bank account. The Nexus Bank
		Account.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I want to stress new here. New means different.
		That means different advertising.
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	Different.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Different.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Different.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	I want it on record that I think this should be
		different.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Point taken.
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	Can I butt in here?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sure, Fee.
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	Thanks.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	All right. So let's brainstorm it. Let's find a hook,
		a peg, an angle, a line, a channel ... what is it
		that's going to sell this bank account?
"}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': "
	What's going to sell that guts and kidneys
		out of it?
		
	They all start clicking their fingers, clapping their 
	hands. All except Dick that is, who sits there slightly 
	surprised by their behaviour.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right well. How about ... how about ... a guy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Young?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	A young guy, thanks darling, he's wearing ... I
		dunno ... what?
"}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	Sweatshirt?
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Jeans?
'}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	A cardigan?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No wait ... What about an American leather
		jacket?
		
	They whoop and emote.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	An American leather jacket!
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Jake I hate you!
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': "
	That's brilliant. That's really brilliant because
		people wear those.
"}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	Um ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, Dick?
'}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': "
	It's not very different.
		
	Silence.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Maybe Dick's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hell I'm not married to the idea.
"}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': '
	It always worried me, I must say.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	I always hated the bastard.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	OK. Clean slate, everybody. Let's start afresh
		from scratch one.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What about a Canadian leather jacket ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Suede ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': "
	That's it! A Canadian suede leather jacket. And
		... (She's got an idea coming) and ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': "
	(It dawns on her) HE'S DRIVING AN OLD
		CAR!!!!
"}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': "
	An old car! He's driving an oldcar!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	An old Jaguar.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What about (Thumps the table) a Cadillac. He's
		driving a sodding old pink Cadillac!
		
	Thunderous applause and cheering.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Something.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Perfect. Amazing work. Right, well. Lunch
		everyone?
		
	They make as if to go.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': "
	That's it, is it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I see what Dick's getting at. We need something
		else as well.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Okay, let's run with Dick's something else as well
		idea for the moment. The young guy has got to
		have something else as well.
		
	People start getting up and looking at things.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Picking up a coffee cup) Something aspirational ...
		Coffee ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bigger!
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	(Picking up a stapler) A stapler?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bigger than that!
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': "
	A telephone? They can be quite big. I've seen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Much bigger!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wait a minute ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Jake's got something ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	What have you got, Jake?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	A baby. The guy's got a baby.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	New man, caring, tender, Jake I love you!
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': "
	That's brilliant because people have those. A
		really huge baby.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	A really huge American baby.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Wearing ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'All', 'text': '
	An American leather jacket!!!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So what are we saying? What are we saying about
		Nexus here? We're saying ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We're saying "this bank account is so good it will
		virtually make you American".
'}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	Why are we saying that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, um ... we're saying that ... we're saying
		that because ... we're saying that ... Problem,
		Dick? Objection?
"}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': "
	Well why does everything have to be American?
		Why couldn't it be an English leather jacket?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Dick, I'm sensing you're not with us on this. You
		have another idea?
"}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	Well, I have worked something out as a matter of
		fact.
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': "
	We're all ears.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	We are. Nothing but ears.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm just one huge ear, Dick.
"}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	Um ... (Reading) "The Nexus bank Account.
		It offers the same rate of interest as every
		other young person's account and comes with
		a perfectly normal plastic card. You may find it
		quite useful."
		
	Stephen grabs Dick's notepad.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Dick, Dick, Dick.
		
	Stephen hands notepad to Hugh.
		
		The anti-ad. Dick, you've got something there.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Christ, I'm beginning to see what you mean!
		"The Nexus Bank Account. It's not so bad really."
'}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': '
	Sen-Christing-sational.
'}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': "
	You're so clever, Dick. Because that's a really
		good idea.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You've cracked it, Dick.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rhiannon', 'text': "
	Dick's cracked the son of a bastard.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Dick's cracked it!!
"}, {'speaker': 'Fee', 'text': "
	Dick, you're a star.
"}, {'speaker': 'Dick', 'text': '
	Well, looks like the Fantas are on me then.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Showing the places on his body)
		The cut me right round that way
		to see if they could find anything.
		Then they had a dig about down
		here. Still nothing. So they poked
		this thing up my ... you know
		... had a look up there. Nothing.
		I'm going through the red
		channel next time.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Hugh knocks and enters the spies' office. It is empty, but 
	the window is open."}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Morning Control, I was just ... oh.
		
	He looks round the office, disappointed. He is about to 
	leave when the phone on Control's desk starts ringing; 
	Hugh is unsure about answering it, but eventually does.
		
		Hello, this is the Secret Service ... No, I'm
		afraid Control's not here at the moment, who is
		this please? Oh hello Mrs Control ... No it's
		rather strange. I just popped into Control's office
		to see if he'd like a cup of coffee, because it's
		nearly eleven o'clock, and there's no one here ...
		I can't think where he can have got to. I agree
		with you, Mrs Control, that he'll probably turn up.
		Bye bye.
		He hangs up, just as Stephen enters.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello Tony.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Control, there you are. I was beginning to worry.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mrs Control has just been on the telephone,
		and between me and Mrs Control, neither of us
		seemed to know where you were.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah. Well let me explain, Tony. But let me first
		ask whether you notice anything unusual about
		the office?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Let's see. The only thing that struck me about
		it was that you weren't in it, Control. Apart from
		that ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What about the window, Tony?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The window, of course! The window always used
		to be slightly further to the left!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not quite, Tony.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. It was a bit of a guess, actually.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, the window is in the same place that it's
		always been. I know we talked about moving it,
		and you very kindly looked into the feasibility of
		the whole thing, but after a while I had to make
		the difficult decision that that particular game just
		wasn't worth the candle.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, and after you'd made that decision, I
		remember you talked at some length about what
		you saw as the loneliness of command.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right, Tony. No, what's unusual about the
		window is that it's open.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're right, Control. Is this is some way
		connected to your not having been in the office
		earlier on?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, Tony, it is. You see, I fell out of the window.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Control, I can only say how sorry I am, and ask
		whether you were hurt in any way.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	To my surprise, Tony, I am in fact not hurt at all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well that is something of a blessing anyway.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, you're right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Because one of the other things about being
		Control, I've always thought, is that your office is
		on the sixth floor, so that in the event of something
		like this happening, you have got slightly further
		to fall than if you were in the Record department
		which is located on the first floor of this building.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very similar thoughts were going through my
		mind, Tony, as I travelled towards the pavement
		with gathering speed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But how did this whole sorry business come about,
		Control?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Tony, I've a confession to make. One of the things
		I like to do before you kindly bring me my
		morning coffee is feed the pigeons who perch on
		my window sill.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Control, I can't say I'm surprised. There had been
		some rumour in the canteen to that effect.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well then, I'm glad to be able to silence those
		wagging tongues one way or another. I do feed the
		pigeons, and it was while I was doing this that I
		fell out of the window.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Control, I think I can picture the scene. There you
		were, at the open window, so engrossed in what
		you were doing that you neglected not to fall out of
		the window. Am I fairly near the mark?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Spot on, Tony.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I thought so. And I'll tell you another thing that
		has resulted from this whole adventure.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What's that?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's after 11 o'clock and you've not had your
		coffee.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're right. Huh. It never rains but it pours,
		eh Tony?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, Control, but quite often it rains and pours at
		the same time.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. Well on your way to the coffee-making area,
		could you ask Valerie to pop out and apologise to
		the old lady who was selling flowers outside the
		main entrance.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'll certainly do that, Control. Did she happen to
		be the unlucky one who broke your fall?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. She was fortunate in that respect, Tony.
		But she might be a little upset that her young
		grandson did.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fair enough, Control. Tell you what then. She
		might welcome a cup of coffee too!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good thinking, Tony. B-bye!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	B-bye.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Both of them. Stark naked and
		at it like knives. BBC 1 at seven
		o'clock in the evening. It was
		disgusting. I don't know what
		that David Attenborough thinks
		he's about.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	A sitting room. A doorbell rings. A woman gets up and 
	answers the door to Stephen and Hugh. Most of the 
	way through Hugh is repeating everything Stephen says,
	a fraction of a second later.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We're from the Westminster Society ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Society ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We wondered if we could come in and talk to
		you about our aims, and the possibility of you
		joining us.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... joining us, possibly, who knows?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So much.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm Mr Willis. And this is Mr Barraclough.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Barraclough.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No relation, in case you're wondering.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Sorry?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We're not related to each other, in case you
		thought we were.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Well why should you be?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well we shouldn't, that's what I'm saying. We
		shouldn't be related and we're not. Hence the
		totally different names.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	So, what can I do for you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	As I say, my colleague and I are thinking of
		founding this society ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Society ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would you be interested in joining us?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... perhaps joining us?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	And what is this society for?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well ...
		
	They look at each other.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well obviously this is one of the things we need to
		look at ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Look at it very carefully indeed ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And I think you've already shown that you would
		be a very useful member ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Useful member of the society.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	But you said you had some aims.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't think we did.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... did say that, we may have done ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	But when I answered the door, you said could you
		come in and talk about the aims of your society.
		
	They look uncomfortable.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well that's a matter of opinion ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Subjective opinion, really ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Well all right, but what is the point of this society?
		I mean you've got to have a point, otherwise ...
		there's no point.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hmm. That's a good point.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well made.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	I mean are you going to collect postage stamps?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Definitely. Collect postage stamps.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Or are you going to practise Highland dancing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. Stamps and Highland dancing are very high
		on the society's agenda.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hardly anything higher on the agenda than
		those two.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Or talk about Roman ruins in Shropshire?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Definitely that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's even higher on the agenda. That's right up
		at the top.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	But you don't know?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Know what?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Know what, precisely?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	You don't know for certain what the society is
		going to be for?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, we have made one or two notes ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just one or two ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	But unfortunately, not to do with the society.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	On a completely separate matter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	However, to answer your question in the spirit in
		which is was asked ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	In that very selfsame spirit ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	My view is that the society should be run in the
		interest of its members.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Brilliant. That's my view too. Members.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But you see, until we have some members, we
		don't really have any interests.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You might say that our hands are tied ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So. Will you help us?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Can I make a suggestion?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Of course. Suggestions.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Eureka. Suggestions.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tuesdays and Thursdays could be suggestion
		evenings.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	No, can I make a suggestion now. And that is that
		you come back when you've decided what this
		society is supposed to be for. I can't stand here
		talking all day.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now there's an idea.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Definitely an idea there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A society for people who can't stand here
		talking all day.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All day and all night.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think that would be a very popular society ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Flock to join that society ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	When you think of all the people who knock on
		your door.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Knock on your bell ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Jehovah's witnesses ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Witnesses to the Jehovah's incident ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Charity collectors ... estate agents ... small boys
		wanting their ball back ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The ball which accidentally went over the fence
		back ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Could we interest you in joining that society?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	I'm going to shut the door now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Excellent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Shutting the door indicates a definite interest in
		joining a society for people who can't stand here
		talking all day ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Total commitment to the society.
		
	She slams the door. Cut to a shot of them outside 
	the door.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well that's one member for our society, then ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	One member for definite member ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Shall we try next door?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Next door, why not?
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	He just picked me up and
		slapped me. Really hard. I cried
		and cried, but he wouldn't take
		any notice. Then he put a plastic
		tag round my wrist, cut my
		umbilical cord and put me in a
		cot. It was awful.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh in studio with an old man and Stephen.
		'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello and welcome to "Introducing My
		Grandfather To". Tonight I shall be Introducing
		My Grandfather To the novelist and corporate
		accountant Sir Benton Asher. Good evening Sir
		Benton.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good evening.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	May I introduce you to my grandfather?
		Grandfather, this is Sir Benton Asher.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Shaking hands with old man) How do you do?
'}, {'speaker': 'Old Man', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Next week I shall be introducing my grandfather to
		Desmond Lynam. Until then, goodnight.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Everyone looks on me as the local
		historian. But it's amazing what a
		fascinating history Solihull does
		in fact have. But the odd thing is
		that I am the only person, so far
		as I know, to find it even remotely
		interesting.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen rings the doorbell of a semi, dressed in an 
	anorak and sensible hat. The door swings open, but 
	there is no one there. Stephen enters hesitantly.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello? Hello? Yoo hoo? Anyone at ho ...
		
	Hugh springs out, hanging upside down, dressed in 
	camouflage gear with a headband and khaki greasepaint 
	all over his face: he is holding a gun.
		
		Oh good afternoon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	In a combat situation you would be dead
		meat, mister.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sorry?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If you'd been some sort of gook, I would have
		burned you away and had your arse for breakfast.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh. Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're not a gook, though, are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I hope not.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No. Gooks don't wear anoraks, as far as I can
		ascertain. Pass friend.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Thank you. Are you anything to do with Martin
		Wilson's Recreational Wargames Limited?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Indeed. I am he.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I am Colonel "Mad" Martin Wilson, and
		Recreational Wargames are very much my
		business.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh good. I'm interested in taking part in one of
		these combat games.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, you've come to the right place. This is what I
		call the game zone.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. This is where the combat games take
		place, is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That is correct, my friend. Trust no one and
		nothing. The game zone is full of surprises.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. The first surprise is, it's your front room.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A front room equipped for war. This, for example,
		is an anti-personnel magazine rack.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No. But you couldn't possibly have known that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Is this what we're going to play with?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Please do not aim your weapon unless you intend
		to discharge it, and then only if in a full combat
		situation.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a water pistol.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. Loaded with live water.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Righty ho.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I will count to ten, and you will secrete youself
		somewhere in the game zone, preferably in a
		potential ambush position. I will then come after
		you in what I choose to call a search and destroy
		mission.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Crikey.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And remember, the first rule of the game zone is,
		there are no rules. And the second rule is, don't go
		into the kitchen. It's out of bounds.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Understood.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right, the game time begins ...
		
	A woman enters from the kitchen.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Do you want some tea, Martin? Oh good
		afternoon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	I was just making some tea for my husband. Would
		you fancy a cup?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh that'd be very nice. Thank you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Won't be a minute.
		
	She goes back into the kitchen.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's very kind of her.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Coo. You really are dead meat. Never trust
		civilians.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But she's your wife, isn't she.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	She said she was my wife. But she could easily be
		a gook, for all you know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well surely gooks don't wear aprons, do they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Never mind.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Cooks do.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All right. Game time begins. One. Two. Three.
		Four ...
		
	Stephen tiptoes out of the room.
		
		Five. Six. Seven. Eight, nine, ten seconds of game
		time have elapsed.
		
	Hugh opens his eyes and looks round the room: 
	then he suddenly drops to the floor and starts 
	to move around the room in a series of somersaults 
	and ridiculous combat poses. Eventually he is forced 
	to give up.

		(Calling out) Right. Congratulations, my friend. You
		are the first person ever to have outwitted Colonel
		"Mad" Martin Wilson in a game situation. Hello?
		Tscch. Honestly. That chap is dead meat.
		
	Mrs Wilson enters with a tray of tea things.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	There you are dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Where's your friend?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Friend? He is the enemy, dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Well doesn't he want his tea, then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well he might do.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Hugh is standing by the window: Stephen opens it from 
	the outside and sticks his pistol through at Hugh's head.
		"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We meet again, Colonel.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Your tea's ready.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh thanks very much.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You went outside the game zone. You broke
		the rules.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In combat there are no rules. Except survival.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All right then.
		
	Hugh drops his water pistol.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's better. Now then. Very slowly reach out and
		pass me my cup of tea. By the handle, Colonel.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Very well.
		
	Hugh makes as if to do so, but grabs his wife round the 
	neck, holding a large knife to her neck.
		
		One false move and the woman gets it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh come come, Colonel.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I mean it. Drop your weapon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	How do I know that she isn't a gook?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She's not a gook
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	I'm not a gook.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There you are. So come on. Throw down your
		weapon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. I call your bluff, Colonel.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm serious.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Off you go then.
		
	Hugh suddenly cuts her throat: lots of blood: she falls to 
	the floor.
		Er ... looks like you've killed your wife.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's only a game. (Pause) Isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm not really interested in
		clothes. Not really. As long as
		they get me from A to B.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen addresses the loyal audience.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	When I was nine, oh fewer years ago now than
		I care to remember, hum, hum! my mother told
		me that in life one could either be an elf or
		a pixie. What she meant by that, I fully suppose
		you may be able all too readily to guess. But her
		remarks set me thinking and from that moment
		on I purposed to be worthy of her admonitions
		and advisalments. I suppose I can look back
		on my whole life as a kind of quest, a search, a
		hunt, an interrogation if you like. Yesterday was
		my birthday, I won't tell you which, because I
		hate you, and I celebrated it in fine style, in the
		company of a cold bottle of Chablis and a couple
		of prostitutes. I suppose in a sense my quest has
		come full circle, OR RATHER, my hunt is over
		and I can rest now. Goodnight.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I personally think that
		the nineties will be the decade
		in which masturbation really
		takes off.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh and Stephen are in an office. Hugh is finishing a 
	phone conversation.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Much obliged for your time, Keith.
		
	Puts phone down.
		
		Dammit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's pretty much as we feared, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Only a whole heap worse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Suppose you start from the beginning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not much to say. Seems that twenty minutes
		ago, our time, Derwent Enterprises went into
		liquidation.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Keith called a couple of hours ago from Helsinki.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But that was Keith just now, wasn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, just now our time. But he called a couple of
		hours ago his time.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. And he called to say that Derwent has
		gone under?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Damn!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Damn it to damnation!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Damn, blast, and two extra slices of buttered
		damn. Who else knows about this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It'll be all round town before you can say "Hell and
		double-blast, dammit to Hades twice."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hell and double-blast, dammit to Hades ...
		
	The phone rings. Hugh picks it up.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
		
	He hangs up.
		
		Derek knows.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Dammit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If they pull on their options ... Christ it doesn't
		bear thinking about. This whole health club could
		go belly up.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right. I want to know who's behind them, I want
		to know who's pulling the strings, I want to know
		WHAT IN HELL'S NAME IS GOING ON.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	John, I do believe you're scared.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're damn right I'm scared, Peter. I sense
		Marjorie's hand in this.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Marjorie?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I never told you this, Peter, but when Marjorie left
		me I settled a block of shares on her and the boy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Shares in the health club? Were you out of your
		goddamned mind?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	In the club, no. I knew I couldn't trust her there.
		But I gave her shares in D-Tec.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And you think ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Think? I don't think anything. There isn't time to
		think. There's only time to act.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But is Marjorie really capable of pulling a
		scrimshaw trick like this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Bitter laugh) Marjorie? She would float her own
		grandmother as a holding corporation, and strip
		her clean of preference stock if she thought it
		would hurt me.
		
	Stephen picks up a framed photo of Marjorie and 
	her son.
		
		Three pints of damn and a chaser of hellblast!!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What about the boy, John?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The boy's Dennis, Peter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. What about the boy.... John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Leave the boy out of this, Peter. He's only a boy.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Something I've always wondered, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How come the boy has been living with Marjorie
		since the divorce?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hih. The court ruled that I was violent and
		unstable, an unfit father.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You, John? That's a damned laugh. If they had
		seen the way you've parented this company ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, Marjorie told this story ... one night I came
		home, I was tired, there was something about
		the way she looked at me, I sensed a mocking,
		a sneering ... I dunno, anyway I flipped ...
		emptied a bowl of trifle over her pretty little head.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And she got custody.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	John, it must hurt, not being able to watch
		Dennis grow up.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hurt? No. He's nothing to me now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yeah, John? So how come every year on his
		birthday you take him down to London to see
		Phantom of the Opera?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I do that because I hate him.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fair enough.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But I give Marjorie due warning ... if she wants a
		fight, then by God she's going to get one!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And the prize, John?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	As big as they get, Peter. The entire leisure market
		in the Uttoxeter catchment area goes to the winner.
		No strings attached.
		
	Picks up photo of Marjorie.
		
		Why can't you leave me alone?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	John, what was it you once said to me about
		perspective?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Er ... I seem to remember asking you how it was
		spelt....
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, no, after that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What are you saying to me, Peter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm saying, John, I'm saying, I'm saying ...
		dammit I'm saying I'm here, Marjorie's a hundred
		and fifty miles away her time, if we can't fight this
		bastard son of a mongrel bitch then we aren't the
		team who weathered the Babylex crisis and came
		up smelling of roses. That's what I'm saying.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Peter, you're right. Call Ipswich now, your time
		and tell them Derwent Enterprises or no Derwent
		Enterprises this Health Club is in business and
		stays in busines.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And if Marjorie should call?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Marjorie? Never heard of her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit John, I love you when you're flying.
		
	Stephen speaks into an intercom.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Sarah, bring in a pot of hot strong coffee and a
		dozen memo pads. (Intercom off) Now, let's get the
		hell out of here before they arrive.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't really believe in all this
		fuss about clouds of radioactive
		dust. It'll all blow over before
		long, I'm sure of it.
"}]
