'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, Lord.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would you be prepared to do something in the
		cause of freedom?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What sort of thing, Jack? Jumble sale, hand out
		leaflets? What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Put a bomb in a restaurant.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Put a bomb in a restaurant. Ah Crikey. And leave
		it there, you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Leave it there. That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, yes. You don't mean put it there, have a spot
		of lunch and then take it out again?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, I mean leave it there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Um, until it goes off?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Precisely. Do you think you could manage that in
		the cause of freedom?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh, Jack, Jack, I wonder if you wouldn't mind, sort
		of, joining up the dots for me, if you like.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	If it'll make it easier for you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I think it will, Jack, I think it will, because unless
		I've fainted and missed a whole chunk of the
		conversation, um, we've been sitting here, you
		and I, having a nice old chat, putting the world to
		rights and so on, and then suddenly you're asking
		me to put a bomb in a restaurant.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Those are the two dots I'd like you to join
		up, Jack. The nice chat and the bomb in the
		restaurant. Join them up for me, there's a
		good fellow.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	All right then, Freddy. There are certain people
		who do not believe in the cause.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't believe in freedom, you mean?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, utter swines, and they eat in a particular
		restaurant, do they Jack?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Some of them will be eating in a particular
		restaurant on a particular day.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ah, well, Jack, sorry to stop you, but, I've an idea,
		um, well, you know who these people are, Jack.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And you know which restaurant they'll be in?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Right, well, so here's the idea. We go in there, you
		and I, Jack and we sit down at their table and we
		hammer it out with them face to face. What do
		you say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fight them, you mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, no, no, Jack, no: argument. You're a persuasive
		fellow, Jack - I bet we could sit down at their table
		over the soup, and you could talk and I'll back you
		to the hilt and I bet you anything we could have
		them believing in freedom by the time the pudding
		arrives. What do you say Jack?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't think that'll quite do.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It won't quite do. Well, all right Jack. How about
		this (Laughs) we pretend to put a bomb in the
		restaurant.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Freddy ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, Jack?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think perhaps ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think perhaps that I was wrong about you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, Jack, no. No you were absolutely right, Jack.
		Right as bloody rain, you were.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, then.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well Jack, it's just ... I'm just the most awful
		duffer at this sort of thing.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The restaurant is called the Etoile d'Or in Maddox
		Street. I suggest you put it behind the lavatory
		cistern. But it's up to you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh, Hell.
		
	Stephen (Gordon) and Hugh (Stuart) are at a 
	restaurant with their wives.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They've got a bigger table than we have.
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	Come on Stuart, this is fine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Look, there are two of them and they've got a
		bigger table. There are four of us and look at this.
		(Bangs table)
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 2', 'text': "
	Oh Stuart for heaven's sake, a table's a table!
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Darling ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, Jill, there we differ. To me there are tables
		and there are tables. Am I right Gordon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well you know me, Stuart, table is as table does.
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': "
	At least it's snug, poppet.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What it is, poppet, is cramped. You should've used
		my name when you booked.
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	Well I did.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What, Mr Poppet?
		
	(They all laugh at Hugh)

		(Hugh enters the restaurant as the character from the 
	club, clutching briefcase with bomb in it)
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Good evening, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good evening. A table for bomb please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Excuse me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Laughing hysterically) A table for one. Sorry ... bit
		nervous. I've never actually eaten a meal before.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Well, you have chosen the perfect place to start.
		Follow me please.
		
	(Cut back to Gordon and Stuart)
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So what did we think of the show?
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	Loved it. Thought it was really nice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Me too. High quality entertainment.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm going to come right out and say it. To
		me, Jeffrey Archer is the finest playwright this
		country's turned out since William Shakespeare.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's a hell of a statement, Stu.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well let me go one further, Gordon. To me, Jeffrey
		Archer delivers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh the guy can write, no question.
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 2', 'text': '
	Delivers, does he?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon, Jill?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Come on darling, you know what he means.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, it's all right thank you, Gordon. I can fight
		my own battles. What he delivers, Jill, to my mind,
		is quality drama ... OK it's a little dangerous
		... OK it's not something that your average Joe
		punter is going to find all that accessible, but
		in the market he's working to he delivers and
		Gordon will tell you that's a compliment I use very
		sparingly indeed.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It's true actually Jill, it's true. Stuart is not the
		kind of man to bandy the word "deliver" around
		the place.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you Gordon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': "
	Thought the sets were marvellous. They were
		really clever. Weren't they poppet?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, and the costumes were fantastic.
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 2', 'text': "
	Sorry, they were wearing suits weren't they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, this is where Jeffrey Archer is so strong you
		see ... in his observation. He's observed that in
		an office a large number of people wear suits. Isn't
		that right, Gordon?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Absolutely, Stu.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, he's observed that, you see. I mean the guy's
		got an eye for detail like well, there's no one like
		him in my book.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	To be fair to myself, Stu, I'd observed that people
		in offices wear suits too.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, no, no you hadn't, Gordon. You can only say
		that after you've seen the play. If I'd asked you
		before the play what people wear in offices you
		wouldn't have had a clue.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I think I would've said suits.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No you wouldn't, Gordon.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think I would.
		
	(Hugh clicks his fingers at the waiter)
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No you wouldn't. Now wait a minute, look, that
		bloke came in after us and they're taking his order.
		
	(Hugh is the character with the bomb, still clutching the 
	briefcase)
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	What would you like, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Crikey, yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Something the matter, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, how many lavatories have you got here?
'}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Just one, sir, over there.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes, I've tried that one, it's no good. No bloody
		good. It's the cistern, it's too close to the wall ...
		you can't get anything between the cistern and the
		wall. Oh hell.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Are you ready to order, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Order yes, well, to be perfectly honest I'm not
		awfully hungry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Well may I recommend a salad? Perhaps a smoked
		chicken salad? It makes a perfect light meal.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes that sounds awfully good. Tell you what
		though, instead of that I think I'll just have a glass
		of water.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Just a glass of water, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Lord no, make it a bottle. Or tell you what, half a
		dozen bottles. I mean you only live once don't you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Waiter', 'text': '
	Very good, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh hell.
		
	(Stephen is a waiter. He goes to a table where a man 
	sits alone)
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good evening, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': "
	Good evening. I'd like to order some soup to start.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Wait a minute, good Lord, you're Keith Bennett
		aren't you? The government minister?
"}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	Well, as a matter of fact I am.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I thought so, I knew it. Oh Mr Bennett, this is
		wonderful. I have to say I'm a great admirer of you
		and your policies.
"}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Definitely. Can I recommend the halibut by the
		way. It comes with a nice black butter sauce.
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You steered that broadcasting bill through the
		House of Commons didn't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	I did indeed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Brilliant, quite brilliant.
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	Well I must say this is really most gratifying. So
		you really do admire my politics?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes well, most people don't like you then?
"}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': "
	Well, you know how it is, we aren't always the
		most popular of people, we politicians.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, you must get used to people calling you a
		complete dickhead I suppose.
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	No, not exactly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That speech you made about deregulating
		broadcasting ... oh, I cheered for you that night.
		We must strive to offer the consumer a far greater
		range of choice, for too long broadcasting has been
		in the grip of a small elite. We must expand and
		offer more choice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': "
	Good heavens, you've remembered it word
		for word.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, it was masterly stuff ... oh my God, your
		cutlery ... a silver knife and fork, I can't believe
		it. (Removes cutlery)
"}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': "
	Those are rather nice. They're not dirty are they?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That this should happen to you of all people. I'm
		so sorry, I'll be right back.
"}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	But they were fine ...
		
	(Cut back to Gordon and Stuart)
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': "
	Of course, Moulinex. All the way through I was
		trying to think where I'd seen that actress before.
		She's the one in the Moulinex advert.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh that's right, the one about the blender.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What, the wife?
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	Sorry?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The actress who plays the wife? She's in some
		sort of advert at the moment, is she? Hello! Laura,
		wake up! The actress in the play who was playing
		the wife that we just saw tonight - you're saying
		she's in an advert at the moment?
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	The wife ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Actually she was playing his daughter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hold on, I'm probably getting her confused with
		someone, wait a minute ... (Looks at programme)
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 2', 'text': '
	There was only one woman in the play, Stuart.
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	And she was his daughter, Poppet.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That was sort of the idea of the entire evening.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, daughter. What did I say?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You said wife.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Did I? This table is definitely smaller you know
		... I mean all those other ones ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Look, that man over there, he's in the government.
		Isn't he a cabinet minister or something?
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	Keith Bennett.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Got it! Roy Hattersley, you're quite right, Gordon.
		
	(Stephen as waiter)
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I do apologise.
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	Apologise for what? The fork and knife were fine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh it's very kind of you, sir, but I absolutely
		insist ...
		
	(Pours bag of plastic coffee stirrers into man's lap)
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': "
	What's this?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your cutlery, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': '
	But these are plastic coffee stirrers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes I know, but at least you've got the choice now.
		I mean they may be complete crap but you've got
		the choice ... that's what's important, the choice
		... (Starting to shout and strangle man)

		(Cut back to Gordon and Stuart)
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 2', 'text': "
	That politician man's being strangled by a waiter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	At least he's got a decent size table.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Anyway to return to the play I have to say that
		although the acting was really good ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	Marvellous acting.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I do think the play would've benefitted from having
		a Paul Eddington in it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 2', 'text': '
	A Paul Eddington?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well ideally, the Paul Eddington.
'}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': "
	Isn't he wonderful?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well you see the thing about Paul Eddington of
		course is his timing.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	His timing is just so ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's the timing of a master.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	A friend of mine's sister married Paul Eddington's
		doctor.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You never told me that, Gordon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, you know, one doesn't like to boast.
		Apparently it's well known that Paul Eddington has
		the second best timing in the business, after Nigel
		Havers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 2', 'text': '
	What is timing, exactly?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, it's a bit difficult to explain to a woman, Jill,
		but timing is basically the magic ingredient that
		Paul Eddington's got.
		
	(Paul Eddington comes in)
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Girl 1', 'text': '
	What is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Paul Eddington', 'text': "
	Yes, I'd like to know that too, I must say.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I know your doctor's brother-in-law.
"}, {'speaker': 'Paul Eddington', 'text': '
	How nice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	We were just explaining to our wives that you've
		got about the best timing in showbusiness.
"}, {'speaker': 'Paul Eddington', 'text': '
	After Nigel Havers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Level with us, Paul, would you class your timing as
		good, very good, extremely good or immaculate?
'}, {'speaker': 'Paul', 'text': '
	Well ...
		
	(Cut back to Hugh as the character with the bomb)
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hello, look, excuse me everyone, sorry to bother
		you and all that sort of filth ... nearly forgot,
		long live freedom ... the thing is there's a bomb
		... yes I know, rotten isn't it ... the thing is it is
		about to go off so you might like to leave.
		
	(Everyone runs out)
		
		That's right, this way. Crikey, my bill!
		
	(Bomb explodes)

		"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Cut to '}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It was just so funny. It was just
		so bloody funny. I literally died.
		It was bloody brilliant actually.
		No seriously, it was really funny,
		actually.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You know that scene in Where Eagles Dare?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Which scene?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The one where Richard Burton is pretending to be
		a German agent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And in fact he's trying to find out the name of all
		the German agents in Britain. You know the one?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, yes. I remember it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. That happened to me once.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Did it, did it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes. In spades. In fact it's always happening to me.
		Lots of things from films happen to me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Is that right?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You know the scene in War Games where the
		scientist calls the air-force general a pig-eyed sack
		of shit. Someone called me that the other day.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The other day?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh no, you're right. It was the same day. And Fatal 
		Attraction could have been written about me. I
		almost sued when I saw it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You were persecuted by a one-night stand
		were you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. No. I once went to bed with Glenn Close
		though.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's ridiculous.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're right, it's completely ridiculous. I went to
		bed with Michael Douglas.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You went to bed with Michael Douglas.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	In a sense.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What sense?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A completely made-up untrue sense.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well as it happens, I've been to bed with Michael
		Douglas in that sense.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, snogged with him.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How was it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know. I made it up. But I'll tell you a
		really true thing that definitely happened to me,
		Kathleen Turner and Adrian Moorhouse. We were
		all lying in bed when ...
		
	Enter Paul Eddington very suddenly.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Paul', 'text': "
	Immaculate, I'd say.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I had this idea for a television
		series, which I sent to Channel
		4, in which every week people
		have to kill Noel Edmonds in
		a different way. But they said
		they were already working on
		something very similar.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh is Peter, a lavatory attendant, inside a lavatory,
	making strange noises as he wrestles with some 
	recalcitrant object or other.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Off) Come on. Come on ... Gotcha.
		
	Lavatory flush sound.

		Stephen, as John, another attendant, crashes in and 
	throws his coat onto a hook "baa-ing".

		(Off) That you, John?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Who else, Peter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I was beginning to wonder where the hell ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Traffic, Peter, plain and simple.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's a bitch, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Took the switchback routes wherever I could, but
		the A47 is a car-park at the moment.
		
	Hugh comes out of the stall carring a plunger and 
	wearing rubber gloves.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Damn that ballcock.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's no good blaming the cistern, Peter. So fill me
		in. How's business this a.m.?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Quiet, John. Very quiet. Couple of noisy ones in
		stall three earlier on.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah, but mostly it's been quiet.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. Calls?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, had one from the maintenance boys about
		fixing the towel rollers ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Can't make it till next Tuesday.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Dammit.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's what I said, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Damn, blast, triple damn, with an extra side order
		of damn.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yup. I said that as well.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How the hell do they expect us to run a public
		lavatory complex without maintenance back-up?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Beats me, John. They said they'd give it top
		priority ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Top priority my arse! (Scrunches up a cup) That's
		just a lot of hot air, Peter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Our clients can't dry their hands with hot air.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well actually ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Peter, don't start on this electric hand-drier stuff
		again. I've read your report, and it's good work,
		but now is not the time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Not the time? I wonder if you'd have said that
		when we were running the health club?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Forget the health club, Peter, God damn it!
		Marjorie won. Pure and simple. It wasn't a clean
		fight I grant you, but she won. That's it. Over.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You don't have to throw Marjorie in my face, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm sorry, Peter. But dammit we've got a chance
		here, a chance to build the finest damned personal
		relief centre Uttoxeter has ever known.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But when, John? What's the timeframe?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hell, Peter, only a fool would try and answer that
		question. Six months, maybe.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Every morning when I leave the house, Sarah
		kisses me on the cheek ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sarah? But your wife is Nancy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Sarah's the au pair, John. Helps out with a lot of
		Nancy's chores.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	She kisses me and dammit if there aren't tears in
		her eyes.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Peter, I know it's hard ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Kids have a hard time at school. "Haha, Sherman's
		dad is a lavatory attendant ..."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't ever say that, Peter. (Scrunches up a cup) The
		Peter I know is an equal partner in an enterprise
		that is going to alter the face of Uttoxeter's
		sanitation for ever.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But the shame, John.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Peter, you're doing this for Nancy and the kids.
		When you refill the soap dispensers, it's for them.
		When you pick the cigarette ends out of the urinal,
		it's for them. When you unclog a U-bend with
		your bare hands, you're doing it for them!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dammit, John, you're right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's more like it. (Scrunches a full cup. It hurts.)
		Now let's get to it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Shoot.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Paper in every stall?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Check.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Evacuation points cleaned?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Check.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Even under the rim?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Even under the rim.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mirrors polished?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Till you could see your face in them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good work.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Had to close the urinal momentarily for cleaning
		purposes. And when something like that happens,
		as you know, the weak go to the wall.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Did you stop them?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No trouble.
		
	A drunk shuffles in coughing.
		
		Good morning, sir.
		
	Man coughs.
		
		This your first visit to our facility?
		
	Man coughs again.
		
		If you require our full relief service, the cubicles
		are to your left, otherwise you will find the quick
		service stall situated ahead of you.
		
	Man lurches awway and vomits into a corner.
		
		Dammit!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Dammit, Peter, we're still not attracting the right
		kind of customer.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know, John. But a lot of the more desirable
		punters are going next door.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And why in hell aren't they coming here?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Because they're women, John.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Peter, I want you to get in next door, and find out
		who's running their operation.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I already know who's running it, John. It was quite
		a shock, I can tell you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't say it, Peter. Don't tell me ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Marjorie.
"}, {'speaker': 'Both', 'text': '
	DAAAAMN!
'}]

[{'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, Hugh?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fine thanks.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Exactly. Now that, I believe, is an example of
		the kind of "joke" the ladies and gentlemen are
		entitled not to expect over the coming ... oh, how
		long d'you reckon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I think the average person could get through this
		book, cover to cover, reading every single word, in
		something under three months. Give or take. I mean
		don't rush it. Don't forego quality weekend time with
		your spouse or partner just to make that deadline. It's
		simply a rule of thumb.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mm. You're not a fast reader, are you Hugh?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What I like to say is, I may not be fast, but I'm gentle.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	All right, that's enough soft-soap and fragrance-free
		conditioner. What about the hard facts and odour-rich
		detail? Will this book mean an increase in personal
		taxation?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Certainly our hope at the moment is that the
		book will be financed largely by the tooth fairy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hmm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Stephen?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, my old pen-caddie?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I noticed that when you made that "hmm" noise,
		your eyes flicked towards the telephone, as if to
		say I wonder what my chances are of calling for
		help before I am horribly butchered in another one
		of those cases one seems to read about almost every
		day now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hmm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There you go again.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Now I can't help but observe that you're moving
		sideways towards the door, while keeping what seems
		to be a relaxed and cheerful expression on your face.
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	There follows an incredibly long pause which, thanks to 
	the miracle of modern book technology, you can experience 
	in a fraction of the time - leaving you free to get on with 
	the things that really matter. Your garden, for instance -
	or perhaps you're a bit of a DIY addict? Or maybe it's just 
	a question of loafing round the house in a comfortable pair 
	of hats."}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	OK. Time to get serious.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Crikey.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The more observant among you will have noticed
		that this collection of scripts from A Bit Of Fry & 
		Laurie is a "tad" fatter than in days gone by.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fatter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Plumper. Wider. Broader in the beam. Differently-
		girthed. Widthly-challenged.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fatter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Precisely. Now there's a reason for this. And that
		is that this great lardy zeppelin of a blubber-book
		contains not one, not two, not four, not five, but
		six, yes, that's right, three whole editions between
		the covers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Stephen, have they gone mad, the publishers and
		retailers of this book? Do they not realise that this in
		itself represents quite extraordinary value for money?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know, Hugh. I really don't. You try to reason
		with people, to steer them in the right direction, but
		sometimes you may just as well wear a calf-length
		purple kaftan and have done with it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're trying that course of action now, I see.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I had to, Hugh. It may be futile, but I had to try it.
		If I ever thought there was a chance of saving this
		once-mighty publishing empire from financial ruin,
		and that I hadn't taken that chance, I just wouldn't
		be able to sleep with myself. I'm a giver, you see.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Stephen, sometimes I quite admire you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh stop that. It's fool's talk, and we haven't much
		time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ten-four.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The threeness-in-oneness of this book is being
		talked about in pubs and clubs up and down the room
		we're now in. Not since the Ford Motor Company
		published the Workshop Manuals of the Cortina Marks
		1, 2 and 3, in the same handy stowaway folder, has
		such a publishing phenomenon occurred. History
		may look upon it as a grandiose folly. Or it may
		say, hell, they took the chance, they rode the tiger,
		they caught some stardust, who are we to say they
		were wrong? We can't predict. We simply do not know
		whether A Bit Of Fry & Laurie will even be on the
		History syllabus in fifty years' time.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Stephen, the picture you're painting is a horrifying
		one.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I know. But it helps me to concentrate. Just lift
		your chin a little. There, that's perfect.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, I suppose it falls to me to restate the dull, dry legal
		warnings. To the effect that you may not perform any
		of the material contained herewithin to a fee-paying
		audience without the prior written consent of the
		authors. And that your home is at risk if you do
		not keep up repayments on any loan or mortgage
		secured against it. And that the manufacturers accept
		no responsibility for you driving into a motorway
		bridge at eighty miles an hour on your way back
		from a Cluedo party. And that in the event of you
		ever wanting to make a claim against this policy, we
		moved, we never heard of you, whistle for it suckers.
		And so on and so forth.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But, hey, in the words of the song, it's not all
		doom and gloom.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, of course not. Lots to be cheerful about.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tons. Sally Gunnell got that gold medal in the
		400 metres hurdles.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well there you are. The Hexham bypass has been
		shelved until at least 1996 ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Bob's Full House has been moved to the earlier time
		of 7.15 ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	In fact a whole raft of feel-good factors seem to
		be at work, making Britain a happier place to live.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And if we've done our part ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Thrown our twopen'orth in ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... then ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... then ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... maybe ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... just maybe ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	... it's all been ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... a massive error.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Unforgiveable.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	We're very sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very sorry indeed.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen is in his study at home. There is a knock 
	at the door.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Come in.
		
	Hugh enters.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello, father. Mother said you wanted to see
		me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, Timothy. A word. I want to ... (He is
		trying to open a drawer in his desk) Damn this
		drawer, I just cannot open it, would you mind, I
		wonder Timothy?
		
	Hugh goes round and easily opens the drawer.
		
		(Eyes rolling to heaven) Yes, yes. I knew it. I tried to
		go on fighting it, but I could not. It is true. Every
		word is true.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Puzzled) Father?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Timothy, it is time you knew who you were.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But I know who I am, father.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No, child, you do not.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I am Timothy Forrest.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. I wish it were true, but no. Sit. Twenty-four
		years ago a doctor told your mother and me that it
		was impossible that we could ever have children.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. Why not?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I can't remember the precise reason. It was
		something to do with penises I think. We decided
		to adopt a child.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I see. And you chose me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	After a great deal of shopping around, yes. From a
		new edge-of-town orphanage that had just opened
		in Royston.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Did they tell you who my real parents were?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	They told us that you were an orphan, that your real
		parents had died in a walking accident shortly after
		your birth. But that was a lie as we subsequently had
		cause to understand.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	They're still alive?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Let me tell this in my own time, in my own
		way, in my own clothes, Timothy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry, father.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	On your seventh birthday a man called round to
		this house. His name was Furlo Roth. He took out a
		silver multi-bladed knife and placed it in this drawer,
		the one you have just opened. (Stephen takes out the 
		knife) He closed the drawer and said that only the
		Chosen One could open it. You, Timothy ... you
		are the Chosen One.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I am?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	And this (indicating knife) is Berwhale. The avenger.
		The weapon of the Chosen One. Tomorrow is your
		twenty-fifth birthday and you must leave us to go in
		search of Pewnack, the Destroyer, the Dark One, the
		Beast.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Golly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	When the fourth moon of Trollack rises above the
		Cylinder of Eyelass then Pewnack will strike. His
		kingdom will be numberless and darkness will
		blight the land, all men shall be slaves and the time
		of weeping will begin. So it is written in the runes
		of Ollerman-Goth, so it must be. Only the Chosen
		One can stop him, and only Berwhale, the avenger,
		can pierce the armour of the beast.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I knew it! It sounds funny, father, but in my heart I
		knew there was something. I realise now that I have
		been waiting for this moment all my life.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes! Yes, it must be so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Where do I find this beast, this Pewnack the destroyer?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	He lives in Saffron Walden.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Saffron Walden, right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You must go there. Surprise is the key. If he
		knew you were after him he would set the minions
		of Threek on you. Become a part of the community.
		Get a job in a canning factory. Bide your time.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. How will I know this Beast?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Only Teece, the Wise One, can tell you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Teece.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Teece. In six months, when you have been accepted
		by the Saffron Walden community Furlo Roth will
		come to you and tell you how you might find Teece
		and begin the battle to free us of Pewnack.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes! Yes! It shall be done.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now take Berwhale, the avenger and go upstairs
		and wash your hands for lunch.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
		
	Exit Hugh.

		Stephen looks sorrowfully after him.

		Enter woman.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Well?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think he swallowed it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Thank God.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We'll get that lazy sod out of the house and earning
		his living.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Only one decent brothel left in
		this part of town now. I remember
		when it was built. I fainted halfway
		through the topping-out ceremony
		as a matter of fact.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen addresses the audience.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I wonder if you can remember what you were doing
		at half past three on the sixteenth of August, 1977. I
		remember exactly. I was revising for my insect-killng
		exams. In those days you could never call yourself
		educated unless you knew how to kill wasps. Anyway,
		as I say, I was swatting away for these exams, when I
		felt a sudden rush in my soul, a sense of something
		incredibly beautiful and mysterious passing into me.
		An extraordinary feeling, not unlike an evening with
		Cliff Michelmore, but somehow more peaceful. What
		could this feeling portend? Two hours later I dis-
		covered its meaning exactly. For it was precisely at
		that time that Elvis Aaron Presley died. I knew then
		that the soul of Elvis had passed into me. And since
		that day I have, more or less, been Elvis. I have spent
		nearly all my time eating ice cream and Big Macs and
		popping Percodan and Quaalude pills. Eerie isn't it?
		But I am, of course, not the only person into whom
		Elvis, with his customary generosity, breathed his
		soul. My colleague and bitter, sworn friend Hugh
		Laurie had a similar experience and here he is to
		tell you about it in the only way he knows.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh sitting on a stool singing "Love Me Tender".
	Shot develops to reveal that he is singing it to Nicholas 
	Parsons, who is sitting on a stool next to him.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Love me tender, love me sweet
		Never let me go
		You've made my life so complete
		And I love you so
		Love me tender, love me true
		All my dreams fulfil
		For my darling I love you
		And I always will.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I have to read when I'm on the
		throne. Have to read. Harpic
		bottle, tube of toothpaste, doesn't
		matter what it is. Even a book
		sometimes.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen and Hugh enter as medieval clerics. A pot of 
	UHT milk is on the table between them. They play the 
	whole thing to camera as if the camera is a judge.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Behold. The Court under the eye of God finds
		itself convened this day of our Lord, Tuesday which
		is called Tuesday.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So be it. Be it so. And not otherwise.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nay.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Moo.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	As witness my hand hereunto bearing the great
		seal of Rotherham.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Miaow.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	All who do have righteous business before these
		presents make sign or else say this court nay.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Or moo.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Or, possibly, moo.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The charge. Make known the charge.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Fourteen guineas per calendar hour.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Cheap.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Woof.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Be it appended and known in these our records
		that this chalice of Ultra Heat Treated milk being
		appointed in the wisdom of our Lord God to accompany
		the coffee of the most revered and holy Bishop
		of Uffington did fail to yield up its juices therefore
		most basely causing that holy and right goodly man
		to snag his fingernail against the tab the which is
		provided for the opening. Of. Thereunto.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Of it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Slightly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	This snagging the devil having achieved, for it must
		rightwise be known that the devil hath possessed this
		chalice ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Or pot.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hath possessed this chalice or pot ... the lid did
		then open in an irritating little "V" shape and most
		lewdly disgorge its opal fluids upon the chaste and
		seemly waistcoat of our most Godly bishop.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thereat proving that the pot is a most wicked pot ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Or chalice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A most wicked and contumely pot or chalice
		wherein Satan doth play Jackalawkins.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	This being said ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And neighed.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	This being said and neighed unto the articles
		where of it is written that it should be said or
		neighed we do make most erotic demand that
		this pot or chalice be cast out, excommunicated,
		denied the blessing and eucharist of our Saviour
		and be tossed unshriven, unhouseled, interdict to the
		condign flames whence it most surely rose. Prepare
		the chasting dish. Prepare the chasting dish.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It is prepared.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The chasting dish is prepared and now the pouring.
		
	Opens milk and spills it.
		
		Bugger.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh is returning to his flat with some shopping.
	Echoing stairwells etc. Stops outside door and reaches for 
	key, but something is wrong. Ears pricked. He carefully 
	puts down shopping and removes an automatic from his 
	belt. He works the slide to load the chamber, the way one 
	has seen countless times, but instead it comes away in his 
	hand.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Mutters) Shit.
		
	Hugh puts the gun down and gently nudges the door 
	open with his foot. Nothing. He moves stealthily through 
	the flat. Nothing. A lavatory flushes. Hugh whirls round 
	in a martial-looking crouch. Stephen emerges from the 
	bathroom, drying his hands.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alan, my boy. Good to see you. I hope you
		don't mind, but I was ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What the hell are you doing here? How did you get in?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Your landlady. Charming woman. It turns out that
		she and I are great fans of Johnny Mathis.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So what the hell do you want?
		
	Stephen crosses to a fish tank in the middle of the room.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mmm. I'd forgotten your obsession with Japanese
		fighting fish. You're quite an expert aren't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Never mind that. Just say your piece and get
		the hell out of here.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Never could really see it myself. What is it about
		them that interests you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Japanese fighting fish? They're loyal. Honest. They
		don't send you to Aylesbury on half-arsed operations
		and then sell you down the river.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now that's hardly fair, Alan. The Department ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The hell with the Department. That's finished,
		over. Finished with. Over. Finished and done with.
		It's over. Completely finished.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You're right, Alan. I shouldn't have come. You have
		your own life now, I can see that. Your flat. Your fish.
		And there's a girl now, I gather. Deborah, is it?
		
	At the mention of "Deborah" Hugh snatches up a banana 
	from the fruit bowl and hold it under Stephen's throat.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You want to know something, read the file. Sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course, Alan. Of course. I'll leave you now.
		Thanks for the use of the lavatory. Oh by the way ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We're reopening the Steinbeck case. I thought you
		might like to know ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Steinbeck? What the hell ...?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You and Steinbeck were pretty close, weren't you?
		Both orphaned at an early age. Both took excellent
		degrees at the Sorbonne. Both had trials for West
		Bromwich Albion. You at inside right, Steinbeck in
		goal, if I remember rightly. Both have an account
		with John Lewis at Brent Cross.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Is that a crime?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course not, dear boy. I'm just pointing out the
		similarities, that's all. And then of course, you both
		adore fish. Really quite remarkable.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You bastard.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	He trusts you Alan. You're the only one who
		can get him back for us.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's your damned porridge, use your own damned
		spoon.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Please Alan, don't throw porridge in my face.
		That's completely over. Finished. Done with. Over
		and finished. Done over and finished with. Over.
		You understand? Finished over with. Done.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello! I seem to have touched a nerve.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	All right Alan, blast you. Fifteen all. We need you
		and you need us.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I need nothing and nobody.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You need an import licence for those oh so pretty
		Japanese fighting fish of yours.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You bastard.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Throwing documents on to the table) First class
		flight to Chichester. Table for two in the sleeper
		from Chichester to Stroud. (Puts down a gun and 
		some bullets) Hair-trigger, fur-barrel and soft-eared
		bullets. Just as you like them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You certainly came prepared didn't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I prefer to put it this way. I certainly came prepared.
		(More documents) Welsh passport, hotel reservation at
		the Welcome Break, Low Wycombe, all in the name of
		one Lewis Potter.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And the real Lewis Potter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A chartered prostitute from Hereford. Killed two
		years ago in a smiling accident. Will you do it, Alan?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You said table for two ... ?.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Of course, Alan. Allow me to introduce your wife.
		
	A woman emerges from the bathroom.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What the hell ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	You need a new ballcock.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	On your cistern. I've fixed it for now, but it
		needs replacing.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I know you've always worked alone, Alan, but
		under the circumstances the Department felt ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The Department can go to hell. I'm finished, done
		away with, at last, period, no more, full stop, the end,
		full period. You can shove the Department up your
		arse.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Well of course I can't do that, as you well know
		Alan. The Department is a huge building housing
		hundreds of people - not the sort of thing you can
		shove up your arse without a great deal of ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Excuse me, Admiral.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is it, my dear?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Major Tarrant seems to doubt my abilities.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're damn right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Would it make any difference if I said that I was
		the case officer on Operation Richard Whitely?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Since your time Alan. Ugly business. Russians
		tried to flood Europe with counterfeit Richard
		Whitelys. The Department was on a Code 1 for
		three months.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	All I'm saying is, I don't carry passengers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Neither do I, Major.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ho ho ho. Looks like you've met your match at last,
		Alan. Now, I'll leave you two to get acquainted, while
		I have another go on that excellent lavatory of yours.
		(Sotto voce to the woman as he passes) Don't worry. His
		bark's worse than his bite.
		
	Exit Stephen.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Did he tell you what happened to my last partner?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Shot dead on the steps of the Prague Embassy.
		I've read the file.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah? Well files ain't a lot of use when you're
		staring down the barrel of a knife.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	I'll try and remember that, Major.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, you do that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Nice flat.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Refusing to be charming) It gets me from A to B.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Quite a collection of Japanese fighting fish. Are
		they good?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	At fighting?
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	At being Japanese.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Grudgingly) The one on the left has a black belt
		fourth dan, the one on the right has retired.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Look, if we're going to be working together we
		might as well be friends.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I work faster alone.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Perhaps it would be a good idea if we went
		to bed together.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Like I just said, I work faster alone.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Me too. Have you got two bedrooms?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sure.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	I'll take that one. You take the other.
		
	They both disappear into seperate bedrooms. Almost 
	a split second later they re-emerge, both smoking cigarettes.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Better?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Much. Dammit, I don't even know your name.
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Does it matter?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I guess not. Well if you want to be useful, you
		could start by fixing us both a drink. You'll find
		some whisky ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': "
	Above the sink. I know. I've read the file, remember?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Huh. You minx.
		
	Stephen emerges from the lavatory.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hmm. That really was most enjoyable. Would anyone
		else like a go?
		
	There is no response.
		
		No? Well in that case, I think I might have another
		turn. Really most excellent.
		
	Stephen bumbles off again.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	What does he do in there?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've really no idea.
"}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Cut to '}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I can't stop now, my wife is being
		towed away.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	This is a spoken song, done against a backing of 
	high strings. Not unlike Eamonn Andrew's unforgettably 
	majestic "The Shifting, Whispering Sands". It is a kind 
	of spoken "Windmills of your Mind".'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is dressed in a very new-agey sort of way.
	Possibly a caftan, possibly not. His hair is silky. The  
	microphone is long and is held between his slim, sensitive  
	palms.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The world is ever sliding
		Ever gliding, ever turning;
		Ever yearning and colliding.
		The stairs begin to creak
		You turn but cannot speak
		When the bubble starts to squeak
		And you find the truth you seek
		
		Chorus:
		You, yes, you, you, you
		It's you I'm speaking to.
		You ... the starling of my night
		The goddess of what seems
		You ... the sparkle of my fright
		The parcel of my dreams
		(Slowly) Just ... the ... parcel ...
		Of my ... dreams. (Whispered) Yes
		
		The you, why, you, you, you
		The you who do what none can do
		The you that haunts my ears
		On the shortlist of wasted rains
		The avenue of chandeliers
		That shames my frozen veins
		(Slowly) That ... shames ... my ...
		Frozen ... veins. (Whispered) Not yet
		
		The world is ever hiding
		Ever riding, ever burning;
		Ever churning and dividing.
		For the horse bestrides the cart
		And the temple rent apart
		Thou wilt be what thou art
		As your hand becomes your heart
		
		You, yes, you, you, you
		You who knows what once I knew
		The you that spits my blood
		And stares at both my clouds
		You wear a sleeve of mud
		Your cuffs become my shrouds
		(Slowly) Your ... cuffs ... become ...
		My shrouds. (Whispered) Oh why?
		
		You, yes, you, you, you
		Which you the what how who
		You crumple the skirts of need
		In the belly of desire
		Where my freshly planted seed
		Can spin its tangled wire
		(Slowly) Can ... spin ... its ...
		Tangled ... wire. (Whispered) Oh
		Certainly
		
		Thank you.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Doctor's surgery cum office. Hugh and Stephen are 
	on chairs. Each has a notebook on their lap."}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I think it might be helpful to start off with your
		telling me something about your state of mind at
		the moment. Would you say you were generally happy,
		depressed, confident, unsure ... what word comes
		into your mind, would you say? Take your time.
		
	Hugh stares at Stephen for a moment, deeply interested.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	This is fascinating. Quite fascinating. Your problem
		seems to centre around the delusion that you are a
		psychiatrist and that everyone you speak to is some
		kind of patient of yours. This is a rare, but not
		unheard of syndrome.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mm-hm. Perhaps it would help if we talked a
		little about your mother at this point.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Extraordinary. Very interesting. Why "Mother"? Was
		your mother affectionate when you were small?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Affection! Affection. Now perhaps we're getting
		somewhere. You felt a lack of affection. I wonder
		if you happen to know whether you were breast-fed
		or not?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ah! Ah-ha! Breasts. Already we've focused in on
		breasts. What are your feeling about breasts, I wonder?
		Do they frighten you? This is not uncommon.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Writing) "Breasts and fear" ... intriguing. And
		where do you think your father fits into all this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Father ... father. Mm. So let's imagine a line,
		shall we, with fear at one end and breasts at the
		other. I want you to tell me where you think your
		father fits on this line.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Lines, interesting, lines. Why "lines" I wonder? Lines
		are very male, aren't they? Very forceful. They thrust,
		they penetrate, don't they? They urge onwards.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	At last the layers are beginning to unpeel. Urging,
		penetrating, maleness, breasts. How often would you
		say you masturbated?
		
	Pause.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes. I really do think if you don't mind we had
		better get back to me asking the questions. I think
		it is important, if you're to be helped, to remember
		who is the doctor here and who the patient. I will
		ask the questions.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And I'll pretend to be the patient, all right. That
		way I can tell from the questions you ask me, what
		it is that is truly disturbing you. All right. Good.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now, come on I'm going to be quite firm. You
		are the patient.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Humouringly) Yes ... that's right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I want to hear you say "I am the patient."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What was that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	"I am the patient."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Writing this down) Good! That's a breakthrough.
		Now that you know that, let's proceed.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Exasperated) You are the patient!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Shrugging) I am, you are - perhaps we're all patients.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Really quite angry) I am not a patient!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Please remain calm, Mr Windrush.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Doctor Windrush.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Lifting telephone) Yes. You know. I only have to
		lift a telephone and you will be restrained.
'}, {'speaker': 'Telephone V/O', 'text': '
	Yes, hello.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen & Hugh', 'text': "
	It's all right Rebecca, I'm in a session.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Look, I'm sorry, I really cannot help you unless
		you stop playing this ridiculous game.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Extraordinary. I really don't think I have ever
		detected a more deeply embedded illusion.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's not an illusion!!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm trying to be as understanding as I can, Mr
		Windrush.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You came asking for help. I am prepared to offer
		that help, but really Mr Johanssen ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Tony. I've told you, call me Tony.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Really Mr Johanssen, that help can only be
		forthcoming if you are honest ... not only with
		me, but with yourself. Now please ... no more
		tricks, no more games. I am a very busy man. I
		have another patient coming in any minute now.
		So let's be reasonable. Hey? What do you say?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Your last doctor tried a course of lentizol, I
		believe? Did you find that helped at all?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	All right. Let's begin very simply, shall we? If
		you are, as you say, a doctor ...
		
	A sort of egg-timer type device goes off on the desk, it 
	rings.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry, Mr Windrush. That's the full hour. Shall
		we say, same time next week?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, I think I can fit you in then. This time bring
		some photographs of your patients, if you have any.
		I think that might be useful.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I might try a little hypnosis I think.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Perhaps you would be kind enough to confirm
		that appointment with Rebecca on your way out.
		
	They both stay where they are.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mm.
		
	The door opens. In comes Kay.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Kay', 'text': "
	Oh, you're both here. I think I'm seeing you
		first, Mr Windrush. Would you mind waiting outside
		Mr Johanssen, you're a little early. Rebecca - two
		cups of tea please.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Extraordinary.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So deep-seated.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Simply fascinating.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do sit, Mrs Meddlicott. Make yourself as comfortable
		as you can.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You see what worries me about
		education is this. Where are the
		future Ned Sherrins? Mm? Who are
		the young Sherrins of tomorrow?
		Are they being trained up? No.
		I shudder for the sake of our
		children.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	A chemist's counter: Hugh strides up to confront the 
	shop assistant."}, {'speaker': 'Assistant', 'text': '
	Can I help you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes please. I'd like eight packets of condoms, please.
"}, {'speaker': 'Assistant', 'text': '
	Eight?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Eight. Four of them Fetherlite, three of them
		ribbed, (half sotto voce) the new single by Jason
		Donovan, (loud again) and one multi-coloured pack
		of Fiestas.
'}, {'speaker': 'Assistant', 'text': '
	Jason Donovan?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Can you make sure they're all sensitol
		lubricated?
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hoo, that's a tricky one. Er, dinner
		with Melvyn Bragg, cooked by
		Keith Floyd, followed by sex with
		Madonna, and then breakfast in
		bed, served by Chris Patten in a
		yellow jumpsuit.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Singing) But in spite of all temptations
		To belong to other nations
		He remains an Englishman
		He remains an Englishman
		For in spite of all temptations
		To belong to other nations
		He remains an Englishman
		He remains an Englishman
		
	Hugh enters bearing a piece of paper.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ambassador.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ah, Witty, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right, sir. A message just came through
		for you from the Vice-Consul in Al Rahad. Marked
		most urgent.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A message. Then read it dear boy. Our esteemed
		Vice-Consul is not the sort of man to bandy the
		words "most" and "urgent" without that he has
		cause.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right, sir. "Twelve armoured divisions heading
		south. Infantry build-up along border continues.
		Every indication, repeat every indication that invasion
		is imminent repeat imminent."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hmm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What should we do, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good question, Witty. Very good question. My feeling
		is that we should do The Mikado.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry, sir?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I know that some of the younger fellows in
		the chancellery feel that it's time for a Pirates of 
		Penzance, but there isn't a part for me in it, you
		see.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry sir, but I don't quite ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't want to seem like a spoilsport, but I do
		feel that there must be a part for me in it, and
		The Mikado seems the be the most appropriate.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Surely sir, there are more pressing calls upon
		our time.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The gymkhana? Oh I think we can let our wives
		sort that one out. I've agreed to pin the winning
		rosette, Julia is going to have to be satisfied with
		that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The invasion, sir. Unless he is stopped now there'll
		be the most appalling catastrophe. Surely we must
		at least issue an ultimatum.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	All right, Witty, all right. Despatch this. "Unless
		you withdraw soonest your ticket allocation for
		our next Gilbert and Sullivan production will be
		severely reduced."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ambassador. For heaven's sake.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Too strong, you think? Perhaps you're right.
		"Unless you withdraw soonest Derek Nimmo's
		touring production of Separate Tables will not be
		cancelled."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ambassador, he's about to invade! Within a matter
		of hours we could be on the brink of a world
		war.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You've not been long in the Foreign Office have
		you, Witty?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Three years, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah. Really? So you missed our last production
		of Pirates?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm afraid so, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hm. Pity, pity. I wore one of Julia's dresses.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'd heard that, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Little tight under the arms, but otherwise
		surprisingly comfortable.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Really, sir? But shouldn't we be ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	There was the most wonderful moment in the
		second act when I was supposed to go to the front
		of the stage and kiss the wife of the second secretary.
		Well, I tripped on one of the steps going down ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Sir, I'm sorry to interrupt you, but we are facing
		an extremely dangerous situation and it is our duty
		to inform London that invasion is imminent and
		request instructions.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'll be honest with you, Witty.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't like you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Why not, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Because you're a troublemaker, Witty, that's why.
		Because you think you know it all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No I don't sir. But with respect we are paid
		an astonishing amount of money, given servants,
		wine cellars, automatic knighthoods and fantastic
		privileges just so that when moments like this arise
		we will be able to avert war. That is our one function,
		sir and we owe it to the peoples of the world to start
		earning our money and actually do something.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A pretty speech, Witty.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Pretty and convincing.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thank you very much sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The Victoria Club in Daar al Rashchid holds a
		public speaking competition every April, first prize
		is only a silver sup, but this Embassy hasn't won it
		for over a hundred years. Think I might enter you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But sir, in twenty four hours, there isn't going
		to be a Victoria Club.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What are you talking about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's slap bang next to the Sheik's Palace. So if
		there's a war, sir, it'll be the first target. Bound
		to be the first target.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Hell's bells. We must do something. Get me the
		Foreign Secretary, who's the Foreign Secretary?
		And how do we get hold of him?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We signal from the cypher room.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Cypher room? Where's that?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's where we rehearsed The Gondoliers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes, a very attractive room.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We had our first child on the NHS,
		and had to wait nine months. Can
		you believe it?
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh and Stephen in period dress on a misty heath,
	about to duel. There is a referee, and possibly some seconds.'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Gentlemen, I believe you both know the purpose
		of this meeting.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you Mr Tollerby, but we have no need of
		explanation. The circumstances are well known to us.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Quite right. Let us be about the business.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Very well, gentlemen. Sir David, I understand
		the choice is yours - sword or pistol?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sword.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	As you wish.
		
	Hugh takes the sword and swishes it expertly.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ha. The only weapon for a gentleman.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Quite so. That means, Mr Van Hoyle, that you
		have the pistol.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you, Tollerby.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	When I give the command, I shall expect ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wait a minute.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Is there something wrong, Sir David?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Quick man, the hour grows late ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's just that when you said sword or pistol, I
		sort of assumed that we would both have the same
		one, if you know what I mean ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Ah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm not with you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well I said sword, assuming that meant we would
		both have a sword ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': "
	Mmm. Thing is, I've only brought one of each,
		unfortunately.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh damn and blast.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sorry to make a fuss, but it seems a bit unfair
		otherwise.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	No, I take your point, Sir David.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well is there somewhere we could get a sword?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I doubt there'd be anything open at this time
		... Excuse me!
		
	Hugh dashes off and stops a pair of joggers in dayglo strip.
		
		You wouldn't happen to have a sword on you,
		would you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Jogger', 'text': '
	(Not stopping) Twenty past seven.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Damn.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well ... we're a bit stuck, really, aren't we?
"}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Gentlemen, I realise that this is a bit of an
		improvisation, but needs must when the devil ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Get on with it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Right, how would it be if Mr Van Hoyle were
		to take the pistol but promise not to fire it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You mean, use the pistol as if it were a sword?
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Exactly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, suits me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Wait a minute, wait a minute. That's hopeless.
		Wouldn't cut anything, look.
		
	Stephen prods referee with the pistol.
		
		See?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Perhaps you're right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Well it was just an idea.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You could try shooting with your ... no, that
		won't work. Forget I spoke.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mm. How about fists?
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	You mean boxing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh Lord no. I'm no good at that at all. It hurts
		your knuckles.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, I can't think of anything else ... hang on
		I've got some matches here I think.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What, you mean set fire to each other?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Better than nothing. Oh no, actually look, there's
		only one match left in fact.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We could nip across to that cafe and see if they
		have any forks ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': "
	Gentlemen, if you'll bear with me - I have one
		last idea up my sleeve.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well?
		
	Referee reaches up his sleeve and pulls out a handkerchief.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A handkerchief?
'}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	No, Sir David. Two handkerchiefs.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're suggesting that we duel to the death with
		a pair of handkerchiefs?
"}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': "
	I realise it's not ideal, Mr Van Hoyle, but it
		would at least be fair ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It would take for ever. I've got to be in town by eight.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well we haven't got anything else.
		
	Stephen sighs.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh all right then. Better be clean, that's all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Referee', 'text': '
	Perfectly clean, I assure you.
		
	They each take a handkerchief.
		
		Gentlemen, I believe you both know the purpose
		of this meeting?
		
	Stephen and Hugh start hitting each other with 
	handkerchiefs.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You see it's a slippery slope. It
		starts by reading the Daily Mail.
		Within a few weeks that's it. You're
		a witless, heartless lump of shit.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh and Stephen are a pair of country boys: Hugh 
	has a guitar and Stephen has a '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My brother Oren and I would like to sing for
		you now, but we can't. At least my brother Oren
		can't, bein' as how he suffered a strange musical
		accident when he was young, that caused lasting and
		considerable damage. So if it's all the same to you,
		my brother Oren will just sit here and tap along to
		the strange rhythms in his head. This song is called
		"There Ain't But One Way".
		
		(Starts to play)

		(Sings)
		The world is facin' problems,
		Gettin' bigger every day,
		We got a greenhouse over Texas,
		And recession's on the way,
		There's hunger in the third world,
		There's anger in the first,
		Half the world is floodin',
		And the other's dyin' of thirst,
		But tho' people they may tell you,
		That this planet's dyin' fast,
		I ain't seen a problem yet,
		Can't be solved by kickin' ass,
		Kickin' ass!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Kickin' ass!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Kickin' ass is what we do,
		Kickin' ass!
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Kickin' ass!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Iron foot in the velvet shoe,
		We don't care whose ass we kick,
		If we're ever all alone,
		We just stand in front of the mirror,
		And try to kick our own,
		We kicked ass in Grenada
		We kicked ass in Iraq
		We've kicked the ass out of the ozone layer
		Now they say we gotta kick it back,
		We'll kick the ass of cancer
		We'll kick the ass of AIDS
		And as for global warming
		We'll just kick ass wearing shades.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Kickin' ass!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Kickin' ass is what we do
		Kickin' ass
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Kickin' ass!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Iron foot in the velvet shoe
		We don't care whose ass we kick
		If we're ever all alone
		We just stand in front of the mirror
		And try to kick our own
		Yes you can move your ass
		Haul your ass
		And bustin' ass is fine
		And there ain't a better place to put your ass
		Than on the line
		But if you're like us
		And you won't take second best
		You'll just put your kickin' boots on
		And kick like all the rest.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen and Hugh are dressed as estate agents, but 
	are working behind the counter of a petrol station.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	... pity you couldn't make it down to that club
		the other night.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Down to Shaggers?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah. Cracking club, that. The crumpet there
		is first rate. I mean really excellent. Absolutely
		excellent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I heard that. I had heard that the crumpet was
		top drawer stuff.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh it's excellent. Excellent.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're a what, gold member there?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	At Shaggers? Platinum member.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right, 'cos I just got given membership at Screwers.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really? Platinum?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Diamond, with strontium edging.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh that's excellent.
		
	Rebecca enters
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	Excuse me, I'm trying to get some petrol out
		of pump number four.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yup?
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	Well it doesn't seem to work, can you ...
		wait a minute. Don't I know you two from
		somewhere?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Don't believe I've had the pleasure, no. Have
		you had the pleasure, Simon?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't believe I have had the pleasure of having
		the pleasure, Nick, no.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	Didn't you used to be estate agents?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	You did! You were estate agents at ... where
		was it? Wilson and Routledge.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er, we did at one point dabble in the property
		game, yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	And it is a game, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh hell yes, it's just a game. Stakes are high of
		course, not everyone can take it, but it's a game
		nonetheless.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	And now you're running a petrol station?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now we're in the petrol game, yeah.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	And it is a game.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	Well do you mind moving into the switching on
		pump number four game, because I'm in a bit of a
		hurry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, can I ask first of all how much you were
		thinking of spending?
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	M'colleague is trying to get an idea of your price
		bracket.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Look, I just want some petrol out of pump number
		four.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That would be Super Plus?
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Yes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Simon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Nick?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Details on the Super Plus? Lady's in a bit of a
		hurry. (To Rebecca) M'colleague won't keep you a
		moment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Details ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Reaching into a filing cabinet) Super Plus, Super
