		Plus. There we go. "A fine, well-produced petrol
		in an increasingly sought after octane range, ideal
		for the professional person."
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Yes, yes, can I have some please?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Simon, do we have the keys to pump number four?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Looking at a board behind the counter) I believe
		they're out at the moment, Nick. There's been
		quite a lot of interest in the Super Plus, as it
		happens.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh a great deal of interest. We've had several
		motorists in here this afternoon, offering cash
		deals.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	Well look, I'm offering a cash deal. I want ten
		pounds worth of petrol.
		
	She puts a tenner on the counter.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yowzer. Looks like the lady means business.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Surely does and then some.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So ten pounds of Super Plus would be what,
		Simon ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm on the case. (Taps away the till) That
		would buy you ... about two pints.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Two pints?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Forty pounds a gallon, Simon, am I right?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right as ever you be, Nick.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Forty pounds for a gallon of petrol?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	For a gallon of Super Plus.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a top drawer petrol, that, no question.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh it's excellent. Absolutely excellent.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	But ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Tell you what. D'you mind, Nick?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Carry on ahead.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Lady's obviously keen ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I read the lady as keen myself, Simon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	What we might be able to do is ring Mobil and
		ask whether they'd take an offer.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	What are you talking about?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Tscch. Very unlikely, Simon.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm not saying it'll work, Nick, I'm saying give it a try.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	K.
		
	Stephen dials a number.
		
		So, what does yourself do in the evenings, I'm
		wonderings?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good question there from m'colleague. Does
		yourself ever get down to Shaggers in the Kings
		Parade?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Or Screwers in Horley Street?
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	I'm afraid not.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's a shame. Excellent clubs. Absolutely excellent.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Into phone) Hi, Mrs Mobil? Simon Pointless here.
		About that Super Plus ... yeah, well I have a
		lady here who says she's interested, but wondered
		whether you'd be at all flexible on price? Sure I'll
		hold. She's gone to check with Mr Mobil.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Presumably you're hoping for a more attractive price?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I'm going to try for a sensible price.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Good move. Try for a sensible price first, then
		an attractive price later.
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	I wouldn't mind if it was cheaper.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Cheaper. Long time since I've heard that one.
		What's "cheaper" in new money?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Beautifully priced.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's it. Let's see what old Simon can do.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Into phone) Still here, Mrs Mobil. Lady's looking
		for a beautifully priced package. Can do. (To Rebecca)
		Mrs Mobil is anxious to dispose of the property and
		feels she can let it go for 195 a gallon, immediate
		sale.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Fine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's fine Mrs Mobil, we'll get back to you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': '
	Can we get on with it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	We're expecting the keys back in a couple of days,
		so how about we fix up an appointment towards the
		end of the week?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Friday at 11?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ah, I'm showing some first-time drivers round
		pump number four at eleven on Friday ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Some time early next week then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Rebecca', 'text': "
	Twenty five thousand estate agents who were safely
		confined in offices only a year ago have been forced
		by the property slump out into the community. It's
		a dreadful situation. But you can do something to
		help. Five pounds will help towards buying an assault rifle
		or handgun. Even 50p will buy enough ammunition
		to deal with a team like Nick and Simon. Please. Give
		generously. In the meantime, I'm going to have to
		decide which of these two to shoot first. Goodbye.
		
	Points gun at Hugh & Stephen.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Bye.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Bye.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, I don't have any children.
		At least, not that I know of ...
		hahahahaha. Because I've never
		been to bed with anybody.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Hugh addresses the camera:'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hm. Yes. Jobs. I've had a variety of jobs since
		I moved to London. I started off, let me see,
		running a mobile twenty-four hour discotheque,
		for the St John's Ambulance Brigade, for when
		they had those big functions, and they needed a
		discotheque standing by, just in case. And then after
		that I set up as a freelance nudist, doing odds and
		ends, weddings, supermarket openings, that sort of
		thing. A lot of work for Securicor, funnily enough.
		But then there was the great nudism crash of '87
		and I got in with a removals firm in Notting Hill,
		doing a job for an Iraqi diplomat called Nigel Havers.
		You can imagine the stick he used to get, having the
		same name as Nigel Havers. But he was a nice chap,
		and we moved house for him. He wanted his house
		moved to the end of the street, because he said it
		was easier to park there. Funny things was that by
		the time we'd finished, and put the last slate back
		on the roof, an Austin 1100 went and parked in the
		space in front of the house, so we had to move it
		all back again. Happy days, though. And then, let's
		see, I had a couple of months in the white slave
		trade - on the selling side, I should point out. Just
		on the telephone, really, it was mostly mail order
		work, pretty dull, but it did get me into my next
		job which was director of pharmaceutical research
		at ICI. God knows how I got it, because I don't
		know the first thing about drugs, although I was
		pretty good in the interview. But they rumbled me
		eventually. All I could think of to say was that the
		pills ought to be oblong instead of round, and after
		a couple of years of that they threw me out. Then
		I thought I needed a break so I joined a group of
		travelling loss adjusters. They used to tour round
		the seaside resorts every summer putting on loss
		adjusting shows for children. That was very good
		fun, although I used to drink far too much. God
		those loss adjusters can stick it away. Unbelievable.
		Then I was Princess Anne's assistant for a while, but
		I chucked that in because it was obvious they were
		never going to make me Princess Anne, no matter
		how well I did the job. It was a question of who you
		were, rather than how well you did, you know, and
		I hate that. After that, let me see ... etc
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So I said "Why don't you shove it
		where the sun don't shine" and so
		he did. He put it in the cupboard
		under the stairs and it hasn't been
		mentioned since.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh, Stephen and Mrs Carrybannerchief sit around a boardroom
	table. Stephen is the interpreter between Hugh and the woman.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	First may I say what an honour this is for my
		company. I hope this will be the start of a long and
		fruitful business relationship. Now shall we begin?
		First of all, Mrs Carry Bannerchief.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Tistrada mempot cloonystart, wekwester memenchyfud,
		lililili hi mau Carrybannerchief ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My company ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hip lokerbelly wimey wimey bobular custole
		fiper ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Would ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Stisterharbulan cotrotty bububub whesker ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... like ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Marpy fanholer crikerbomb yelymasterman incy
		gobtratter ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... to tie up a European deal with your company.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ti.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	But I hope you'll agree ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Wop bum bum bum bum bum bum bum bum bum ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That the price must be fair to both parties.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Linhakky tutular ... er ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Problem?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm afraid there's no such word as price in Strom.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh. Er ... cost?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	(Worried) Hinty p-pepular?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Reassuring her) Streen hathock.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You must have a word for the amount that is
		to be paid for something.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not really. There's "hifty bewn-hate".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What does that mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It means price in the sense of "exploding vest".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	There's no sense in which price means exploding
		vest.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's the closest we get.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All right - the exploding vest must be fair to
		both parties.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hifty bewn-hate. Happy hip-wipe.
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Niling clover bolips weethle-fwisk prenty arse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's perfectly sofa factory.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Now - any long-term contracts?
		
	Stephen & woman laugh.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Long-term contracts - ha ha ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wha ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You see "long-term contracts" in Strom means
		"wee-wee".
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Really?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes ... ha ha ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, well, the only thing left is the outstanding
		"long-term contracts", ha ha, for after sales service.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	After sales service.
		
	Woman stands up looking furious.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Woman', 'text': '
	Fudd nob.
		
	She smacks Hugh hard in the face and stalks out 
	of the room.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What!!!???
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I do apologise.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What on earth did she do that for?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I think that she is not so happy that you would
		be insulting her.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	All I said was "after sales service".
		
	Stephen slaps Hugh.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So you do speak Strom after all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No. What does it mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	After sales service.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ah well. I could show you, but I'd have to have
		a goat and four pairs of Marigold washing-up gloves.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh you really are cruising for a bruising.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Now what? What does "dear" mean?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In Strom, dear means a large animal with wet noses,
		the soft brown eyes, and the antlings. I suggest you
		speak with your principals, and I will go and try and
		placate Mrs Carrybannerchief.
'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'The set is empty. There is a longish pause.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Caption: "I expect they'll be back in a minute"'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Pause.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Caption: "Oh dear"'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Pause.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Caption: "In a way, it's surprising that this doesn't happen more often."'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Pause.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Caption: "After all, rooms spend a lot of their time being empty, don't they?"'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Pause.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Caption: "Not that this is a real room, of course."'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Pause.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Caption: "I mean, since there's nothing else going on you	might as well take a peek round the sides."'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	The camera slowly pans off the set and shows a bit 
	of wall. It return to the centre and looks off the other 
	side. We catch a glimpse of the rear of a naked man just 
	slipping behind a flat. Camera returns to the centre again.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Caption: "There's an audience as well"'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'The camera goes all the way round and looks at 
	the audience. Returns to the room.'}, {'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'We hear Hugh and Stephen re-entering the set.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Off camera) Ah. Any luck with Mrs Vetsach?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Off camera) I'm afraid she's inconsolable.
		Caption: "Hello. Sounds like they're off again."
		
	The camera pans round to the set again: Hugh and 
	Stephen are back.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well this is more than a little embarrassing. I'd
		certainly hoped to have this entire deal wrapped
		up by the end of today.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You don't know where to stop.
		Caption: "There's quite a good film on the other side, if you're interested."

		Pause.

		Caption: "I think it's got Rod Steiger in it."
		
		Pause.

		Caption: "And I believe there's a thriller on Channel Four."
	
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh and Stephen address the camera at the end of the 
	show: they are in black tie and Hugh is sitting at 
	the piano.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well that's just about it for this week.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Time the old enemy ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh shut up. So it's good night from me ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And it's good night from me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	We're going to leave you with tonight's cocktail
		recipe. This one's called "A Slow Snog With A
		Distant Relative". For this you'll need two measures
		of brandy, three of rum. One measure pink gin, one
		white. A dash of lemonade, a sprint of orange-juice,
		a spoonful of crushed Sugar Puffs, two hard-boiled
		eggs and an open-toed sandal, size nine if you can
		get it. Hit it Mr Laurie, if you'd be so very kind.
		
	Hugh strikes up a jazzy sort of riff while Stephen mixes 
	a "Slow Snog With A Distant Relative", spilling drinks 
	everywhere.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My only criticism of David Icke
		is that he doesn't go far enough.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'A drinks party. Hugh approaches Stephen.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Hello. We haven't met, Terry Swale. My wife tells
		me that you're new to Yorkshire.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes, I'm a bit of a southerner, I'm afraid.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Whoops! Can't have that. (Laughs)
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No! (Laughs) My mother's family came from Sheriff
		Hutton, though.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ah, well perhaps there's some hope for you!
		(Laughs a great deal)
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Also laughing a great deal) Yes!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ng.
		
	Pause.

		(At length) I must say everyone seems very friendly.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well it's not all whippets and cloth-caps, you know.
		(Laughs)
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. No. (Laughs)
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We have heard of avocados and hot and cold running
		water. (Shrieks with laughter)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Also laughing) Hot and cold running water!
		Avocados! That's lovely. So, you live ... ?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Boroughbridge way.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah, lovely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, you know. We've got the Moors handy and the
		Dales. Ten minutes and you can be in York, Ripon
		or Harrogate. We like it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. Lots of good air and lovely walks, I should
		imagine.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ye-e-es. But we have all got cars, you know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, naturally.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I mean it's not all fell-walking and climbing boots.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No. Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You should see some of the traffic we get in
		Thirsk and Harrogate.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And the pollution in Leeds can rival anything
		you've got down south, we like to think.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mm.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh yes. Sometimes takes me two hours to get
		to work there are so many cars.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, right. It can be terrible, can't it? I always
		used to go to work by bicycle when I was living in
		London.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You can't move in Ripon for bicycles. Worst bicycle
		jams in Britain.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right. Still, it's a much better place to bring up the
		kids. I mean, quality of life and everything. Less of
		the seamier side of life to ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	We have heard of sex and violence up here, you
		know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, obviously.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	We like to think that there are more drug-related
		muggings, rapings and beatings in the Vale of York
		than anywhere outside America. See that woman
		over there? Sally Oldcastle. She runs the biggest
		crack ring in Europe. And what's more she's not
		stuck-up.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good Lord. So there's not much that's different
		from London, really.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You said it, mate. Whatever they've got down south,
		there's more of it up here and it's cheaper and more
		expensive and you can't park.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right, right. Well it's getting late, I think I'll just
		translocate myself home now.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Beg pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I must translocate myself back home with my personal
		translocation podule.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What the hell's that?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well it's basically just the same as a domestic
		translocation podule, but you wear it on your wrist,
		that's all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, what does it do?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I punch in the grid coordinates of where I am now,
		then the coordinates of wherever it is I want to go,
		press the button on the side and hey presto.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hey presto?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	My molecular structure disintegrates and reassembles
		within a matter of seconds at my chosen
		destination.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hang on, hang on ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You mean like Star Trek?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'm sorry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You mean you go all wobbly and then disappear?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	My God.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You mean you've never seen one of these before?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	They're all the rage down South. My daughter
		bought me this at a petrol station. It's the Sinclair
		version, but some of the Japanese ones are really
		fabulous.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Wait a minute.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If you've all got these things ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What do you need petrol stations for?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	For everlasting life.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Everlasting life. They discovered it a couple of years
		ago in Southampton. If you drink a gallon of petrol
		every day, you'll live for ever. You must have heard
		that?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That? Oh yeah. We drink petrol up here, all right.
		Yeah. Live for ever, we do, sometimes longer.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I should hope so. I'm just amazed you don't
		have personal translocation podules.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Who said we don't have them?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well I just thought ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Bloody designed and built up here, those things.
		We've had them for years. In fact, they've come and
		gone.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Have they?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh yeah. They were a sort of craze for a while,
		but nowadays ... no, I was just surprised to see
		people still using them after all this time. It's been
		years since I've seen one of them things.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh, well would you like to have a go on mine?
		For old time's sake.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No thanks.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sure?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've had a couple of drinks. Don't want to get
		pulled by the law when my molecules are all over
		the place.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Fair enough. Well, I'll be on my way.
		
	Stephen grabs a cloth-cap and puts it on his head.
	He collects a leash on the end of which there is a 
	whippet.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What are those?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Cloth-cap and whippet. All the rage down south.
		Bye.
		
	He presses a button on his watch and disappears.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(With beautiful woman on arm) Yes,
		indeed. Very happily married. Very
		happily married indeed. My wife's
		away at the moment visiting her
		sister in Wales, but very ...
		(suddenly realises) Is this going
		out on television? (turns to 
		beautiful woman) Who the hell
		are you? Go away! Honestly ...
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen and Hugh are going through letters.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Certainly. You know, we've had, as you can see
		from these post bags, the most marvellous response
		to our Name Quest.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. We know that a lot of you out there
		have known or met people who have amusing and
		unusual names.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So we asked you to write in and tell us about them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And what crackers you've told us about!
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Reading) "There is a man who comes to wash
		my windows once a month whose name is Jervillian
		Swike. It always makes me laugh a great deal." That
		was sent in from a Mr Suckmaster Burstingfoam of
		Ipswich.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I'm rather fond of this one: "Dear A Bit Of Fry 
		and Laurie, I was at school with a boy called Donald
		Duck and later went out with a woman named Soilia
		Piffin. Yours etc. Peter Cummin-Myear."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Five pounds on its way to you for that one Mr
		Cummin-Myear. Or how about this one "Dear A
		Bit Of Fry and Laurie, My wife's first husband
		was called Simon Coggie. I still split my sides
		whenever I hear that name. Yours faithfully Frigmy
		Popplehate-Fresharse."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Tremendous response all around. Many thanks
		to all of you who wrote in. Meanwhile ...
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	On Film: Hugh is loitering on a street corner, looking 
	hard. He looks around him, and then enters one of 
	those Pay-Az-U-Krapp public lavatories: cut inside to 
	the interior of a dingy office, which, in a tardis sort of 
	fashion, is larger than it ought to be. Hugh looks round 
	him and then approaches a desk, behind which Stephen 
	is being measured up by a tailor.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alan, dear boy, glad you could make it. Shan't
		keep you a moment.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No problem.
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Three or four buttons on the cuff, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh, I'm not sure. What do you think, Alan?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Shrugs) Three's plenty.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You think?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The lighter the cuff, the faster you move.
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Four is normal nowadays, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hm. Tell you what, three on the left, four on
		the right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Very good, sir. (Jots in his notebook)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now, I dare say you'll be wondering why I asked
		you here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Well I assumed you wanted a suit made.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hm. Alan, do you know why I asked you here?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Nope.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not even the teensiest hint of a suspicion?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	None at all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Good. That's why I asked for you. That's why
		I asked for you. Thats why I asked for you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't follow.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're an outsider, Alan, and that means I can
		trust you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Excuse me, sir. Trousers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Trousers? Oh yes, I think so. Got to have trousers.
		Look a complete arse without trousers.
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Yes, sir. Did you envisage zip or button fly?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hoo, tricky. Views, Alan?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Buttons are a dangerous luxury in my line of
		work. Personally, I'm a velcro man.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Really? Bit noisy, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Noisy but fast. By the time they've heard your
		flies, it's a lifetime too late.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Right, velcro it is. Now Alan, I have a little
		theory that I'd like you to hear.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm listening.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The Department is rotten. Rotten to the core.
		Am I ringing any bells with you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You're saying the Department is rotten?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's a theory, Alan. Just a theory. Run with me,
		and let's see how it plays.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	K.
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	One other thing, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Which side do you dress?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Er, nearest the window usually. Now Alan, I want
		you to cast your mind back to Berlin.
		
	Hugh looks grim.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Problem?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You told me to draw a line after Berlin. Walk
		away and forget, you said.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Of course. You had to get out in rather a hurry,
		didn't you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I can't remember.
"}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Ticket pocket, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hm?
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	On the waistcoat.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ticket pocket, ticket pocket, ticket pocket. I think
		not. Hermoine and I don't seem to get out to the
		theatre as much as we used to these days. Seems a
		bit of a waste.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Look, if you've hauled me all the way out here ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Calm yourself, Alan. There's reason in my madness.
		Now tell me. What do you know of Carl Albert
		Beiderbeck?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Beiderbeck. 5'11". Blue build, medium eyes. Father
		was a Romanian circus acrobat, did some courier
		work for the Soviets in the late fifties. Mother was
		a small business adviser for the Midland Bank in
		Altrincham. Small arms, big feet. Fluent at the
		violin. Distinguishing marks, a small mole in his
		garden.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ha. I'm impressed Alan.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've seen the file.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well then, you're one of the few people in the
		Department who has.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Meaning?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Meaning you're one of the few people in the
		Department who has.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The Beiderbeck file went walkies six weeks ago.
		Hasn't been seen since.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I see. Hence your rotten apple theory.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Noooo. Hence my rotten Department theory. I
		don't really have a rotten apple theory.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Who drew the file last?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That is what you're going to find out.
"}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Begging your pardon, sir ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh no. You're not going to ask about turn-ups
		are you?
"}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	No sir. About the Beiderbeck file.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	I was the last person to draw the file.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well I'll be rogered with a stiff wire brush ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': "
	Mr Beiderbeck wanted a suit made. Said he was
		going on a trip, and where he was headed, no one
		knew how to cut cloth properly. He couldn't come
		in for a fitting, so I had to get his measurements
		from the file.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Alan, are you thinking what I'm thinking?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What sort of suit did Beiderbeck order from you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Three piece houndstooth worsted, zip fly, four
		button cuffs.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ticket pocket?
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Oh yes, sir. Mr Beiderbeck was a great one for
		the theatre.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Was he? Was he by didgery-handpoo?
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': "
	Very flamboyant gentleman, Mr Beiderbeck. I often
		thought he'd have done well on the stage himself.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You know what this means, don't you Alan?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Berlin, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Precisely. We have to get that file back.
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': "
	Well I'll ask my wife to put it in a taxi, if you like sir?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	There's a Lufthansa flight in an hour.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'll ask Judy to book you on it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': "
	Well we're only up in Finsbury Park, sir.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	If that file should fall into the wrong hands ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': "
	It's just sitting on the kitchen table ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Or get tea spilt on it ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Tailor', 'text': '
	Ah. Er ... Which side do you keep your penis, sir?
		
	Cut to next sketch incredibly quickly.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My wife and I have been going
		to Provence for years. Well before
		it was fashionable. We like to think
		that we discovered it. The French
		were amazed when we pointed it
		out. They'd simply never noticed
		it.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen addresses camera.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I don't know if I ever told you about the day
		I forgot my legs. I can't remember which day
		it was: it was one of those ones that happened
		in 1987, I can't remember which exactly, there
		were so many. In particular there were quite a lot
		of Tuesdays then, I remember, so I've a feeling it
		might have been one of those. Anyway, I was on
		my way into work with Sir Peter Thorneycroft, no
		relation, one fresh June morning in early May and
		we took the short cut across the fields. I stooped
		to pick a buttercup, why people leave buttocks
		lying around, I've no idea. The gentlest
		breeze and mildest Camemberts were packed
		in our hamper and all nature seemed to be
		holding its breath. We made good time by taking a
		back way across what was then the main Corpusty
		to Saxmundham Road. I was just remarking to
		Peter how still and peaceful everything was
		when he suddenly agreed with me and said how he
		thought everything was still and peaceful too.
		You know how if you half-close your eyes you can't
		see so well? I'd just discovered that it was equally
		true if you half-opened them. I was pointing this
		out when I suddenly noticed that I'd completely
		forgotten my legs. We had to go back and get them. The
		moment was spoiled and three years later almost to
		the decade, Margaret Thatcher was hounded from
		office. I sometimes muse on what might have
		happened if I had forgotten my ears as well. Never
		go back, ladies and gentlemen. Never go back.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Stephen is sitting at a desk. Hugh knocks and enters.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah, Terry, thanks for dropping by.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No problem,
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good, good. You got my memo, I take it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The one asking me to drop by?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Got it this morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Excellent, excellent.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You got mine, hopefully?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yours? I don't think I did, no.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It's not important. Just said I would drop by.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. Probably in my in-tray. I dare say Carol
		will have taken care of it.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. How is Carol, by the way?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Er ... How is Carol. Hold on a sec.
		
	Stephen presses intercom buzzer.
		
		Carol?
'}, {'speaker': 'Carol', 'text': '
	(Off) Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	How are you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Carol', 'text': '
	(Off) Fine, thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	She's fine.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Oh good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I thought she was, but I don't have the paperwork
		in front of me. Anyway. Worth checking.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Absolutely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now Terry. I'd like if I may to go through a little
		recap of your career. You've been with us for nearly
		three years, am I right?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Seven actually.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Seven, is it really? Seven years. Tscch. There was
		I thinking it was three, when all along it was seven.
		Well thanks for putting me right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No trouble.
		
	Stephen starts taking notes.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Now how would you describe your duties here
		in that time?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I suppose as personnel manager I guess it's
		been my job to look after the hiring and firing
		around here.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The hiring and ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Firing.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Firing. Hmm. (Writing) Two "F's" in firing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, just one.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Just one. Firing. Yes of course it's one. One "F" in
		firing. It would look silly with two. Now by firing,
		I take it that you don't mean rifles or anything like
		that? You mean firing in the sense of sacking, or
		dismissing an employee.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's right. Although a rifle would be handy
		every now and then.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would it? Oh my dear chap, you should have said.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, not really.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You sure?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I've had to give courses of instruction to senior
		management.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	In how to fire people. You've done wonders, Terry.
		The whole company is massively grateful to you for
		the guidance you've given in how to fire, sack or
		dismiss employees.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, I aim to please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ha. Aim to please, and fire to please.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ha ha. Very good.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thanks. Well now, Terry, I need your advice.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Fire away. Ha ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ha ha ha. That's it exactly. I have to fire away. So
		Terry, let us suppose for a moment, that I wanted
		to fire someone.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. Well I advise directness and candour.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Two s's in directness. Directness and candour.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Start off with a brief recap of their career, how
		long they've held their present job ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Done that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	... and then tell them, as directly and candidly
		as you can, that they're fired.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Just like that?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just like that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, sort of "Terry, you're fired", you think would
		meet the case?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Absolutely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Terry, you're fired.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. Good. Er ... Terry?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yup.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're fired.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's perfect.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good, good. Terry, you are actually fired.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah, you only have to say it once.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh do I? I don't have to repeat it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Best not to.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So having said, "Terry you're fired" you would
		ideally get up and walk out of the building.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sometimes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sometimes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sometimes I might break down in tears and beg
		you to take me back.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh dear.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well we don't want that.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Other times, I would just go very quiet and nod.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well that's more the sort of thing I was hoping
		for, I must say.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It varies a lot from case to case. Depends on
		the individual.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hmm. What about you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would you say that you were a crier, or a
		nodder?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well you never really know until it's happening.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. I see.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I think I'm a nodder.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. Terry?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're fired.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's great.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You're fired.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, just once.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Mm. And if the person you want to fire, doesn't
		really take it seriously?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That often happens.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Does it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Thing to do is to look them right in the eyes
		and tell them.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I see.
		
	Stephen looks deep into Hugh's eyes.
		
		Terry?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You are ... fired.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Just like that, perfect.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good. Excellent. Thank you, Terry.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So, is that all?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No. There's one other thing. (Searching through 
		paper on his desk) I'm having the most
		tremendous difficulty firing someone. I've followed
		your instruction to the letter, directness with two s's,
		candour, look them in the eye ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And they can't take it on board, can't accept it's
		them, give me their name and department, and I'll
		take care of it for you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Would you Terry? That would be a great burden
		off my shoulders.
		
	Stephen hands Hugh a piece of paper.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's what I'm here for. Catch you later.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Possibly Terry, possibly.
		
	Hugh exits.

		Stephen sighs.

		Hugh re-enters.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You bastard.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I thought you said you were a nodder.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I lost my sense of smell during
		the Korean War. I was cycling down
		Witford Street, just over there, and
		I got knocked off by a GPO van.
		Never smelt anything since.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Question of Sport studio. Hugh is Emlyn Hughes 
	and Stephen is David Coleman.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, Emlyn, what happened next?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, the lad's gone through, he's gone through the
		door .. and he's hit it, but it's gone right into the
		crowd, and so ... he gets arrested. Bobby comes
		along and nicks him.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's what you think happened next, is it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah. He's hit it, and been arrested.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So, you think he's hit it and then been arrested.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That is what you think actually happened?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Don't want to change your mind?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No, that's definitely what happened.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You are sure about that. You definitely think ...
		that that is the right answer? He hits it into the
		crowd and then gets arrested ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... is what you think actually happened ... next.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, Emlyn, I have to tell you that you are ...
		righwroorigh ...
		
	Freeze frame: same happens again. We pull out from 
	the still to see another QoS studio, and another David 
	and Emlyn.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	So, Emlyn, what happened next?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, the lad's answered the question, and then he's
		got so pissed off because the other bloke wouldn't
		say whether the answer was right or not, that he's
		pulled out a gun and shot him.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's what you think happened is it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You think that Emlyn shoots the host of the
		programme, because he takes so long to say
		whether the answer is right or not?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	That is actually, what you think happened?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You think, that what you have just said is the
		right answer to the question?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yeah.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well, you are ... righwrorigh ...
		
	Hugh shoots Stephen in the head.
		
		... absolutely right.
	
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I don't know much about
		pornography. But I know what I
		like.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I said good morning.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good morning to you sir. (Calling) Mr Dalliard,
		we have a gentleman in the shop. I have parried his
		opening remark, and we are now having a pleasant
		conversation. (To Hugh) Mr Dalliard will be joining
		us as soon as is likely. Though of course, one says
		good morning, does one not, Mr ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er. Pardoe.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	One says good morning Mr Jowett, but if you
		would be delicious enough to pop your head out of
		the door (inexplicably impatient) conveniently situated
		just over there for God's sake! - it's far from good. It
		is very very win ... try.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yes. Yes it is, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very win ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... try.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	That's right. Certainly. So. From win ... triness
		to you, young master Jowett. How may we serve?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes. I was after a pair of shoes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ah very well. I shall serve them first.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, no. I meant I am looking for a pair of shoes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	To buy?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	To buy.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mr Dalliard. The gentleman wishes to buy a pair
		of shoes. (Pause) Oh, what rotten decomposing luck.
		Mr Dalliard tells me we have no shoes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I must say, you've got very good hearing.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I beg your pardon?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I didn't hear your Mr Dalliard at all.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	My Mr Dalliard?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes, the fellow you ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh sir, I've confused you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Have you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Indeed, yes. I should make it clearer than a Waterford
		bed-pan, that Mr Dalliard is most assuredly not my
		Mr Dalliard. He's everybody's Mr Dalliard. A gift to
		the nation, if you like. As much my Mr Dalliard as
		your Mr Dalliard, or, dare I say it, and I think I dare,
		Gary Lineker's Mr Dalliard.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Gary Lineker?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	So it looks as if you've come to exactly the wrong
		place. I should advise you to turn around, leave by
		the door which is (angry again) still conveniently
		situated just over there for God's sake! (Nice again)
		Walk seventeen paces to your left and enter the shoe
		shop you will find next to a branch of Finlay's the
		tobacco people.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	This isn't a shoe shop?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Good lord and lots else beside, no, Mr Jowett.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, wh ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	This is a place where people come to meet privately
		and talk in an informal, intimate atmosphere with a
		view to enjoying a massage and several rounds of
		sexual intercourse.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	THIS IS A PLACE ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You mean a brothel?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I dislike the word brothel, Mr Jowett. I prefer
		to use the word brothels. Yes, this is a brothels.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	But ... the shoes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Shoes?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	These - (indicating the large collection of shoes 
		around the place)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Those are my prostitutes, Mr Jowett.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Prostitutes. You mean people pay to have sex
		with those?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very much of course they pay, Colonel Jowett. I
		am not a charitable organisation, much though the
		evidence may point to my being reasonably tall.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Lots of people?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Ah. I fancy I detect a wrinkle of concern on your
		otherwise smooth and toboggonable brow. Business
		is not what it was, nor even what it is. It may not
		even be what it will be. We shall see. If it is. If it
		isn't, I may have to consider an early retirement.
		Mr Dalliard, I'm drivelling!
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, I mean really, having sex with shoes.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It seems very ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Very ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, very ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well very?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh I don't know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Yes it does, doesn't it? VERY oh I don't know.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I mean this ... (he picks up a large moccasin)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Fredericka is perhaps the most popular moccasin
		in this brothels, Professor Jowett, and I don't care
		who knows it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	(Feeling inside with his hand) Well I grant you that
		the lining is very ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Twenty pounds.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sorry.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Master Anthony Jowett, you have just inserted your
		hand right inside Fredericka's most intimate interior
		partlets. You cannot be expected to do such things
		gratis.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes but ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Twenty pounds.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	And that's all I get for twenty pounds is it. A feel?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, no. If you would like to go into the copulatorium
		thither you may take Fredericka and an escort of
		your choice therein and sauce her to your heart's
		con ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... tent, I see. Well, in that case, I suppose ...
		(He reviews the selection of shoes and holds up a small 
		sandal)
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	(Shocked) Sir! It is more than my job's worth. If
		you want that kind of thing, I suggest you go to
		the Philippines.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Ah, right. Well, I'll take Fredericka and ... this
		one. (He selects a Chelsea boot)
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Very good, sir. Fredericka and Colin. Through
		there. You have half an hour.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Er ... Colin?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I won't tell sir, discretion is my middle letter.
		(Hugh exits. Stephen shouts off) Mr Dalliard, we
		have a three way, see you at the peep-hole!
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Stephen enters a stationer's, general Sub Post Office,
	card shop sort of place. He is an old man, from the 
	north, with a voice not unlike a combination of Robb 
	Wilton and Harry Worth. I don't know why, but there 
	it is (as Harry Worth used to say). Hugh is a female 
	assistant."}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Help you, chuck?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well dear, I don't know. I don't know as if you
		can help. Do you have any get well cards?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Dozens. We've got dozens. Dozens we've got.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Aye, well, that's all high and dandy, but have
		you got one? You see, it's my daughter's twenty-first
		Friday week.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You'll want a birthday card then, pet.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I wish it were that simple. No, you see. Let me
		think. My wife. She's my second wife you see. The
		first drowned in a mixed salad in 1978. My second
		wife is a younger lady.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Like myself.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Life yourself. Very like yourself. Slightly heavier
		beard-line though. I've got a photo ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ooh, lovely.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	But it's of the Bolton Wanderers' reserve team
		playing away at Blackburn so it's of no use to you.
		Anyway, my second wife, she doesn't like younger
		ladies around you see. They remind her that she's
		getting on herself. And next Friday, when it's my
		daughter Amanda's twenty-first ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That'll be her stepdaughter.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My daughter by my first wife - she'll be jealous.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It is never easy being a stepmother.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	She'll see her stepdaughter be all young on her
		twenty-first and she'll have one of her jealous
		spasms.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	They can be nasty, can spasms.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well that's right love. So I'd like to have a get
		well card good and ready.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well there's one here. It's got a message "Sorry
		about the varicose veins, get well soon".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well it's grand that. It's lovely. But I'm not sure as
		it's appropriate. Have they all got specific messages?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well they do these days. It's the acid rain, I think.
		Hold up chucker-pet, this is more like. "Sorry to
		hear your teeth fell out in the Arndale Centre, All
		my love Thomas."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	My, that is specific, isn't it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	It is specific, doll, that's the charm.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I see. I do see. Still not quite right though, is it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How about a nice printed poem? "I'm right sorry to
		learn yer, Succumbed to another nasty hernia. You
		mustn't lift what you cannot carry, All the best, your
		grandson, Harry."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	I'll take that one, on the off-chance.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What off-chance, duck?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well on the off-chance I change my name from
		Fred to Harry and my grandmother comes back
		to life, and has another nasty hernia. You never
		know.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It's as well to make sure. But I'm sure we've
		got something that meets your particular case,
		petty-love. Ah, now. What's this? "Where are your
		youthful years, your stepdaughter has 'em, That's
		why you had such a dreadful spasm, Hope you
		recover very quick, Your loving husband Frederick."
		That's what you're after.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh, what a pity. I'm Alfred, you see. Not Frederick.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Now that's a shame.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Never mind I'd best forget it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well, you'd best take one of these from me then.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello. What's this. (He reads)
		"Poor old Alfred life is hard,
		You tried to buy a get well card
		There wasn't one to meet your case,
		Ever so sorry, much love, Trace."
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's me.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Well bless you chuck.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Least I could do, dove pot.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	All these so called chattering
		classes. Your Harold Pinters and your
		Lady Antonia Braggs and so
		on. They all earn good money and
		yet they claim to be socialists.
		Incredible. Only poor people
		should be allowed to be left-wing
		in my view. Anyway, if these
		people were real socialists they
		would give everything away.
		Oh no that's Christians who are
		supposed to do that isn't it? You'll
		have to forgive me, I'm mad.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh addresses the camera while standing behind a 
	large office photocopier.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hello, I'm Tony Inchpractice, and welcome to
		"Photocopying My Genitals With". Tonight I shall be
		"Photocopying My Genitals With" Sir Alan Beaverby,
		one time Labour Employment Secretary, now an
		active member of the International Orphans Trust.
		Good evening, Sir Alan, thanks for coming on the
		show.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	My pleasure, Tony. Good of you to have me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Now, Sir Alan, the equipment is ready ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hahaha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Hahaha, yes, so shall I go first?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, after you, Tony.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right.
		
	Hugh lifts up the cover of the photocopier, removing 
	his tackle: he then gently lowers the lid, all while 
	talking.
	
		Now, Sir Alan, you retired from politics last August
		after a quarter of a century in the House of Commons,
		in which you held a variety of Cabinet posts, was that
		a particularly sad time for you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes, very sad indeed. Apart from anything else,
		one makes so many friends in politics, and of course
		I was very sorry to have to leave them behind, as it
		were.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Would you mind pressing the buttons for me?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes, of course. Er ... how many copies do
		we want?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, one for each of us, I think, and one for luck?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right you are.
		
	Stephen presses the relevant buttons and the machine 
	begins to whirr.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	You had a particularly harrowing time in the late
		sixties, when it was alleged that you were involved
		in the Dobro property scandal. Were you at all tempted
		to leave politics then?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	It crossed my mind, Tony, obviously. But my
		wife was adamant that I should carry on, so I did.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Do you still keep in touch with the political scene
		now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Oh yes, as much as I can. I'm still active in the
		constituency, and I like to drop into the visitors
		gallery at the Commons whenever I can.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right, Sir Alan, your turn.
		
	Hugh removes himself from the machine.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I say, would you mind if I did something slightly
		different?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Not at all.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's just that I'd be much more interested in
		photocopying my bottom, if that's all right.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Well I don't see why not. Can we do that? Yes,
		we can do that. Would you like me to hold anything?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No, no. I'll just hop on here ...
		
	Stephen drops his trousers and sits on the photocopier.
		
		There we go.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Three copies?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well again, I don't want to go bucking the system
		and making a nuisance of myself, but would you
		mind doing a couple of hundred?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A couple of hundred, wow.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's just that I do keep getting requests from charity
		auctions and that sort of thing, and it would be so
		useful to have something to send them.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I quite understand. So ... enjoying retirement?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Enormously.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Goodnight.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	What's the difference between a
		man and a woman? (No reply) Oh.
		(Wanders off and stops someone else)
		Excuse me. What's the difference
		between a man and a woman?
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen is seated at a large desk in American military 
	uniform, smoking a huge cigar: a Stars and Stripes 
	flag hangs behind him.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Jacobson! Get your ass in here right now!
		
	Hugh enters, also in uniform, carrying a holdall.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Jacobson, what the hell am I going to do with
		your ass?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My ass, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Can you think of one goddamn reason why I
		shouldn't kick your ass all the way back to New
		Mexico?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, sir if this concerns ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You know what the hell it concerns, Jacobson.
		It concerns your ass! What does it concern?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	My ass, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do you recall what it was I said to you the
		last time you were in here?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well sir. You told me to move my ass, and haul my
		ass, and not to sit on my ass, because if I did, you
		would personally rearrange my ass.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Uh uh. Wrong, Mr Jacobson. I was not going to
		rearrange your ass - I was going to boil your ass
		in a bag, and have your ass for breakfast.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	That's it, sir. Have my ass for breakfast.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Read that sign, Jacobson.
		
	Hugh looks at a sign on Stephen's desk.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	"The buck stops at my ass."
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	See, that's why I have this star Jacobson. Because
		my ass is on the line.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The bottom line ... ?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	The bottom line.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I understand.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Well, I am glad you got your ass straight on that
		one. Now Jacobson, I've got myself a problem.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A problem, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yup. Seems that some goddamn college boy on
		the fifth floor wants a piece of my ass ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Your ass, sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	You bet your ass, my ass. If I could just get
		my hands on this guy's ass, his ass is history.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Whose ass would that be sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The guy who's got his ass in my face, Jacobson.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, Jacobson?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	How does my ass fit into all of this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	It's very simple, Jacobson. You are aware that
		your ass is mine?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	It is sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh yes, your ass is mine, mister. The day you
		joined the army, you signed your ass over to me.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I get it, sir.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh you do, do you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	This guy wants a piece of your ass, so you're
		thinking that, being as my ass is yours, maybe you
		could give him a piece of my ass as a way of saving
		your ass.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Shut your ass, Jacobson. Nobody likes a smart
		Alec. Now boy ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Sir?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Got your ass with you?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Yes sir.
		
	Hugh plops the bag on the desk. Stephen looks into the bag.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	With respect, sir, don't jerk my ass around.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Mm. Nice piece of ass.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Holding a lead) There's a lot
		of crap talked about pit bull
		terriers, really. They're great dogs.
		Absolutely great dogs. The pit bull
		terrier. You see Tyson here, he
		wouldn't hurt anyone unless ...
		arrggh!
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': 'Late Show '}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	With me to discuss that scene from Scorcese's new
		release From Here to Just Over There is the critic,
		critic and critic Ray Daugh. Ray you've written
		countless, almost worthless books on the iconography
		of "the bottom" in American films - in what context
		can we approach this piece?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Not really, no. We knew already that "the ass" has
		come to ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	By "ass" you mean "bottom"?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Tremendously. You'll have to forgive my lapsing
		into jargon for a moment there ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	By "jargon" you mean a series of specialist phrases,
		or better an "argot" if you will, to describe a particular
		area of criticism?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In some ways yes. The bottom has come to stand
		for the essence ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The spirit?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	... the essence of the individual in modern
		American mythology ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The contemporary single person living within a
		set of folkloric beliefs in Stateside North America.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In my last book ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A book being a work of thought or prose bound
		together between hard or soft covers and commonly
		sold in bookshops?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Broadly ... in my last book, Backside Story: A 
		History of the American Bottom I devoted an entire
		chapter to the ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	A chapter meaning a sub-division in a book, of
		which there are perhaps twelve, fifteen, twenty,
		creating blocks of writing?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Often ... an entire chapter I devoted to the
		phrase "my ass is on the line". "The line" being ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I think we all know what a line is.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	In this case "the line" being the vestigal notion of
		the frontier in American folklore. Partly - (gesturing)
		to put his bottom on the frontier - is still the goal of
		the modern American.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Copying gesture) By this you mean an utterly
		infuriating gesture guaranteed to put people's backs
		up in quite a major way.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I hope so.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Well, sadly the clock has ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Large, circular timepiece ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	... beaten us once again.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Flagellated, whipped us for at least a second time ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	So thank you ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Expression of gratitude ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ray ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Shaft, or beam of light ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Very much.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A lot.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Pat.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Small slab of butter.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Hugh is in a belted raincoat, addressing the camera with 
	a microphone: behind him is an imposing building. He is 
	a bit nervous: Stephen is the cameraman, hence we only 
	hear his voice off.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Ready?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yup.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	You don't mind that car being parked there? That's
		all right is it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Fine, we don't see it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	OK. Right. (Clears his throat) The atmosphere
		outside Bristol Crown Court was tense this morning
		... sorry ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Better just let these people through ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What people?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	These people ... Oh. Tsch. They've gone the
		other way. Huh. Looked as if they were going to
		come this ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ready whenever you are.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. The atmosphere outside Bristol Crown Court
		was tense this afternoon as the defendants ... oh
		damn. Ha ha ha.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I said Plymouth Crown Court.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	No you didn't.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Didn't I?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You said Bristol.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Did I? Tsch. Could have sworn I said ... anyway.
		Ready?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Ready.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The atmosphere outside Bristol Crown Court was
		tense this afternoon ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What is it now?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Sorry. Frog in my throat. (He does some very 
		elaborate coughing) That's better. Right. Shall we do
		it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I agree. Let's just go ahead and do it. In one. Ready?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Jesus Christ.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Right. The atmosphere outside Bristol Crown
		Court was ... sorry, would you mind moving
		to one side ... there were some kids staring at
		me, thanks very much. Right. This is it. Here we
		go.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Arrgh.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	The atmosphere outside Bristol Crown Court was
		tense this afternoon, as the defendants ... oh I
		don't believe it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	WHAT IS IT NOW?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Aeroplane.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What!?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Can't you hear it?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	NO!
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Aeroplane. Listen. I thought it was an aeroplane.
		Sounded like a DC10 actually.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Can we get on with this?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Yeah, hear hear. Let's do it right now, OK. The
		atmosphere outside Bristol ... tell you what. I've
		just had a thought. Wouldn't it be better if we did
		this round the back, in case they come out that
		way ...
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Do this now, or I will kill you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	I will kill you unless you do this now.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Oh look, hey, you can't expect me to work under
		these circumst ...
		
	The camera starts to move towards Hugh.
		
		All right, all right. The atmosphere outside
		Bristol Crown Court was tense this afternoon
		as the defendants ... oh my God!
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	There they are!
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Where?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Over there, coming out of that door!
		
	The camera pans quickly round: nothing. Pans back: 
	Hugh has vanished. Pans the other way: Hugh is 
	disappearing down the street.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Twat.
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Computers? Bollocks, more like.
'}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen faces the camera and speaks straight to it, 
	calmly, but with a hint of passion. There is a Union
	Jack behind him.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	God save our gracious Queen,
		Long live our noble Queen,
		God save the Queen,
		Send her victorious,
		Happy and glorious,
		Long to reign over us,
		God save the Queen.
		
		Now, some of the younger people watching me
		here on this programme tonight might think that
		there is something amusing or ridiculous in the
		words of that grand old hymn, our own Great British
		National anthem. I happen to find such people sick,
		disgusting, degraded and enormously limp-making in
		a sexual sense. There is nothing arousing at all about
		people who can mock and sneer at simple love of
		country, nothing to make the loins twitch and quiver
		about the kind of hooligan who can despoil our flag.
		The sort of cynical, atheistic, unpatriotic yoboiks who
		hold nothing sacred have no power at all to bring
		me to a proud stand. You're going to have to do
		something a little bit more than repeat a few cheap
		jibes about the land I love if you want me to thicken
		and engorge with mounting excitement. In the old
		days as soon as the national anthem was heard the
		whole nation would rise stiffly to attention. Am I the
		only one left? Goodnight.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Stephen, Hugh and others are sitting around a large room.
	It is an AA session. Hugh is chairing the discussion. His 
	chair is at the head, the others are grouped around him.
	He clears his throat.'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Peter, would you like to start?
'}, {'speaker': 'Man', 'text': "
	(Stands) My names is Peter Bales and I'm an
		alcoholic. I last had a drink two years, seven weeks
		and three days ago. (Sits to sympathetic murmurs and 
		congratulations.)
"}, {'speaker': 'Man 2', 'text': "
	(Stands) My name in William Gerard. I'm an alcoholic.
		I haven't drunk for five months and six days. (Sits)
"}, {'speaker': 'Woman 1', 'text': "
	(Stands) My name is Andrea Mclean and I'm an
		alcoholic. I last had a drink two days ago. I'm sorry.
		(Sits to sympathy)
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	OK Andrea, no problem. We'll talk about it later.
		
	Camera has arrived at Stephen who appears to be 
	reluctant to speak. He is shy and embarrassed.
		
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Would our new member like to speak?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Um ...
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	I know it can be very hard; but everyone here at
		AA will tell you that the first thing to do is to face
		your problem. To give it a name.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes, I see that.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	Until you can stand up and say it, we can't help
		you.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	I'm sure the others can confirm that AA is about
		confidence and about sharing. OK?
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Right. (Deep breath) My problem is basically that
		the starter motor seems to get stuck. Especially in
		cold weather.
		
	Pause.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Mm. Have you tried putting it in first gear and
		rocking it back and forwards?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Yes. Yes I have.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	We'll send someone round as soon as possible.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Thank you.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(Handing Stephen a hip flask) Have a drink while
		you're waiting.
"}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Now when I was at school we
		had real headmasters. Not clever
		left-wing scholars in oh-so-smart
		Trotskyite sandals and Stalinist
		trousers. Proper, straight-down
		the-line honest-to-goodness
		schoolmasters. They didn't indoc-
		trinate me with a lot of left-wing
		crap-trap. They indoctrinated me
		with a lot of right-wing crap-trap.
		They may have stroked my
		thighs slightly more than is con-
		sidered fashionable these days, but
		they were proper schoolmasters.
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': "
	Stephen and Hugh are sitting at either end of a 
	long table, having breakfast. Hugh is a woman, Stephen 
	isn't."}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Could you pass the marmalade, darling?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	What?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The marmalade, could you pass it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	You want me to arse the parlourmaid?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	No darling, there's a pot of marmalade at your
		elbow, I want you to pass it.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	A potty marinade in my dildo, have you gone mad?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Darling I want you to pass the marmalade.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	(Amazed) You want me to fart the hit parade?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Pass the marmalade.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Smile at Roy Hattersley? You want me to smile
		at Roy Hattersley?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	That doesn't sound anything like "pass the
		marmalade".
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Roy Hattersley hasn't found anyone to pass the
		marmalade? You're babbling, woman.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No dear. I want you to pass the marmalade.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Roy Hattersley wants me to pass the marmalade?
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No, I do darling.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	An eiderdown? I'm not going to pass Roy Hattersley
		an eiderdown.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	If you'll just listen.
"}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	He can get his own damned eiderdown like
		everyone else.
'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	The marmalade dear, can you pass it?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	Expecting people to pass him eiderdown as if he
		was someone special. No one's ever passed me an
		eiderdown.
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	Will you pass the marmalade?
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	No I will not go to bed with Geoffrey Howe. Not
		at any price. I think you must be off your head.
		
	Hugh gets up, walks down the table and picks up 
	the marmalade.

		Stephen buries his head in the paper.
		
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': "
	The Substantial Tide's Indebt smell by more
		quoits?
"}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': '
	No dear, the Financial Times Index fell by four points.
'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Oh. Pass the marmalade will you?
'}, {'speaker': None, 'text': 'Vox Pop'}, {'speaker': 'Hugh', 'text': "
	(As policeman) We're slow but steady. 
		You know, we get there in the end. 
		(Stopping a passer-by) Excuse me 
		madam. Does the name Jack the 
		Ripper mean anything to you?
"}]

[{'speaker': 'direction', 'text': '
	Violent violins. Organ music. Stephen in a deep leather 
	burgundy hide wing chair with dimpled buttons. He is 
	reading. He looks up.'}, {'speaker': 'Stephen', 'text': '
	Hello, I'm Gelliant Gutfright, your host on The 
		Seventh Dimension. Tonight's story is called "The
		Red Hat of Patferrick". I must add a warning. The
